loans.name: Miawand Group

texts.en:
Ozer is a member of the Miawand Group. He lives in the 16th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives in a family of eight members. He is single, but is a responsible boy who works hard and supports the whole family. He is a carpenter and is busy working in his shop seven days a week. He needs the loan to purchase wood and needed carpentry tools such as tape measures, rulers and so on.
 
He hopes to make progress through the loan and he is confident that will make his repayments on time and will join for another loan cycle as well.

loans.use: He wants to buy tools for his carpentry shop

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en: Katerina, a married mother of three grown children, owns a greenhouse business that grows cucumbers, tomatoes and other vegetables. Not afraid of hard work, she has been in this business all of her adult life, her large family requiring lots of provision.  Katerina now needs to borrow 7,000 UAH to purchase fertilizers and film for the green houses. This will allow her to grow abundant crops on time and sell them at a better price.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and film for green house

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru: Беков Сухроб проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст, 25 лет. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Жена, домохозяйка. Живет вместе с родителями. Отец работает в России. Сам Сухроб открыл фотосалон, где обслуживает клиентов. В этой области более 5 лет. Кредит берет для расширения деятельности (бизнеса).
texts.en:
Suhrob B. lives in the Khuroson district. He is 25 years old, married and has one child. His wife is a homemaker. He lives together with his parents. His father works in Russia. Suhrob opened a photo salon, where he serves customers. He has been in this business for over 5 years. He is requesting this loan for business expansion.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Sabz Group

texts.en: Geta, the group leader of Sabz group, lives in District 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan. A married mother of one son and two daughters, she has operated a quilt-sewing business for more five years, having learned the skill from her mother when she was single. Geta now needs a loan to purchase cloth, cotton and various-sized needles.  She hopes to advance her business and increase her income to enable her children to become well-educated.

loans.use: To buy purchase cloth, cotton and different sizes of needle.

loans.name: Ashur

texts.ru: Даминов Ашур проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 62 года. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Ашур более 20 лет занимается растениеводством. Имеет небольшой участок земли, где выращивает овощи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Ashur D. lives in the J. Rumy district. He is 62 years old, married and has one child. His wife is a homemaker. Ashur has been involved in agriculture for over 20 years. He has a small plot of land, where he grows vegetables. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 43-year-old married man from Lebanon who has two children.

Ali has been running a construction business since 2001. He specializes in filling in the gaps of walls and buildings and then smoothing them. He has over seventeen years of experience in this field of work. He says that he has an advantage in his work because there are few competitors in his region. His clients include local community members. In the future, he hopes to expand his business. He is very proud of the quality of his work.

Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He plans to purchase a pulley device that allows him to move up and down a building structure. The device is similar to that used by window cleaners on skyscrapers. He believes that the loan will help improve his work and increase his standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a pulley device

loans.name: Mamatmurod

texts.ru: Лакаев Маматмурод проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 51 год. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Более 8 лет занимается растениеводством. Он в основном сеет пшеницу. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений..
texts.en:
Mamatmurod L. lives in the J. Rumy district. He is 51 years old, married and has 6 children. He has a secondary education. Mamatmurod has been involved in agriculture for over 8 years. He primarily grows wheat. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tagaynazar

texts.ru: Хасанов Тагайназар проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст, 53 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Сын занимается животноводством, а дочь работает в магазине. Сам Тагайназар имеет средне - специальное образование, "Водитель". По профессии работает более 20 лет. Кроме того занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Tagaynazar H. lives in the Khuroson district. He is 53 years old, married and has 4 children. His son is involved in animal husbandry, and a daughter works at a store. Tagaynazar has a secondary-specialized education as a driver. He has been working in his profession for over 20 years. Besides this, he is involved in animal husbandry. He breeds livestock at home. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Lolahon Eshanjonova Group

texts.ru:
Лолахон является лидером группы, ей 40 лет. Она проживает в Араванском районе вместе со своей семьей. У нее 3 детей: дочерям 19 и 17 лет, сыну 15 лет. Старшие дочери активно помогают по семейному хозяйству, старший сын учится в школе. А супруг работает строителем. Клиент в свою очередь откармливает МРС, клиентка планирует закупить доенную КРС на этот кредит.

Халимахон 56 лет. Она замужем, но ее супруг не работает, так как он инвалид второй группы. У нее 3 детей: с ней проживает сын, невестке, и внуку 3 года. Клиентка работает в больнице в отделе стерилизации медсестрой. На кредит она планирует купить холодильник.

Манзурахан, 44, замужем. Ее супруг строитель, работает в основном в родном селе.  Клиентка откармливает доенную корову с быком, сама работает в больнице в отделении ССО санитаркой. Цель кредита - закупить бычков для откорма и перепродажи. 

Наргизахон. 29, замужем. У нее трое сыновые. Старшие двое детей ходят в школу. Она откармливает телку, кур, а также активно занимается сельским хозяйством. Цель кредита -закупить 4х МРС для откорма и перепродажи.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Lolahon is the leader of this group. She is 40 years old. She lives in the Aravan district together with her family. She has 3 children: the daughters are 19 and 17 years old, and the son is 15 years old. The oldest daughters actively help with the family household, and the son goes to school. Lolahon’s husband works as a construction worker. The client fattens small livestock. She plans to use this loan to buy a dairy cow. Halimahon is 56 years old. She is married; however, her husband does not work because he is disabled. She has 3 children. Her son, daughter-in-law and a 3-year-old grandson live with Halimahon. The client works as a nurse at a sterilization department in a hospital. She wants to use this loan to buy a refrigerator. Manzurahan is 44 years old, married. Her husband is a construction worker, who mainly works in their native village. The client fattens a dairy cow and a bull and also works as an orderly at a hospital. The goal of this loan is to purchase calves for fattening and resale. Nargizahon is 29 years old, married. She has three sons. The oldest two children go to school. Nargizahon fattens a heifer, chickens and is also actively involved in agriculture. The goal of this loan is to purchase 4 heads of small livestock for fattening and resale.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 33-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and 5 children. He runs a business installing and replacing floor tiles. He has been involved in this field for almost 18 years. His customers include local community members. He notes that difficulty in finding sufficient financing for his business has been a challenge. He also says that it is a challenge to find new and better ways of advertising his work. He is proud of his extensive experience and high quality work.

He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 Lebanese pounds from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He plans to use this loan to invest in new tools and transportation for his business. This will be his first loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To invest in new tools and transportation for his business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 33-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is an experienced diesel mechanic with 10 years of experience. He has been running his own shop since 2009. His customers include local community members. He notes that securing sufficient capital has been a challenge.

He is proud of the quality of his work and his experience. He says that it is his commitment to his work that has helped distinguish him and make him successful. In the future, he is hoping to expand his business.

He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He plans to invest in a small crane and spray pump for his business. He believes that the loan will help him increase his income and support his family. This will be his first loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To invest in a small crane and spray pump for his business.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 46-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and one child. He has been working as a car electrician for over 25 years. In 2009, he opened his own shop. His main customers are local community members. He says that the unique location of his business has allowed him to remain competitive and successful. He says that effective promotion and securing capital are two major challenges to his work. In the future, he would like to expand his business to include auto repair for new cars.

He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He plans to purchase new electric tools for his work. He believes the loan will add to his business so he can better support his family. This will be his first loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase new electric tools for his work.

loans.name: Jaafar

texts.en:
Jaafar is a 36-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with two family members. He has been working as an auto-repairman for 18 years. He specializes in tires. In 2006, he opened his own tire shop. He sells, buys, and fixes tires as well as sells car lubricant. He notes that securing sufficient capital for his business has been a challenge. He is proud of his experience and hopes to further expand and improve his work in the future.

He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He plans to invest in a new electric generator for his work. This is important in Lebanon where there are frequent power outages, often for multiple hours in the day. He says that the generator will help him increase his work productivity.

loans.use: To invest in a new electric generator for his work.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 46-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and four children. He has been running a small grocery and snack store for 15 years. His most popular products are snacks, cola, and cigarettes. He notes that the presence of many competitors has been a challenge to his business. But, he says, his involvement in all aspects of the business, including keeping good accounting records, is what makes him unique. He has also had some difficulty in acquiring sufficient capital for his work.

He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He plans to use this additional capital to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: To improve and expand his business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 30-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and child. He has been running a painting business for 10 years. He is skilled in painting homes as well as furniture. He says that he is very committed to his work and proud of his experience. He says that finding better ways to advertise his business has been a challenge.

He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He plans to invest in a power generator and compressor for his work. He believes these investments will help increase his productivity.  Having a generator is important in Lebanon, as there are frequent power outages, often for multiple hours in the day. He hopes to further expand his business in the future.

loans.use: To invest in a power generator and compressor for his work.

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 35-year-old married man from Lebanon. He has seven family members in his household. He has been working in the agricultural field for 18 years. His main interest is raising different types of livestock, especially sheep and goats. He is proud that he manages his work and money well. His customers include friends and neighbors. He said that his customers have a high levE. of trust for him and his work. He notes that he faced some financial difficulty over the years, mostly due to the ongoing political conflict and war in Lebanon. 

He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He plans to purchase more sheep with this loan. He believes the loan will have a positive impact on his family. This will be his second loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep.

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is a 43-year-old married man from Lebanon. He has six people living in his household. He has been working in the agricultural industry since 1993. His business includes raising livestock and working as a butcher. His main customers are friends and neighbors. He is proud of his ability to effectively manage his work and money and of the high quality of his work. He notes that he has faced challenges in acquiring sufficient financing for his business.

He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He plans to use the loan to purchase more sheep. He hopes to further expand his business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep.

loans.name: Raji

texts.en:
Raji is a 36-year-old married man from Lebanon. He has five members living in his household. He has been working as a car mechanic for 15 years. His customers include friends and neighbors from his community. He is proud of his ability to manage his money well. He says that he has had some difficulty in securing enough financing for his business.

He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. He plans to use the loan to invest in a machine that can test a car’s carbon levels. He also wants to invest in a new business: a small picnic/seating area located next to one of Lebanon’s rivers. He will rent out the tables to families who want to enjoy the day sitting next to the river. This will be his first loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase auto repair equipment

loans.name: Mavlakat

texts.ru: Баротова Мавлакат проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 44 года. Замужем, имеет 6 детей. Муж, работает водителем. Сама Мавлакат более 10 лет занимается торговлей. Сначала торговала на рынке. Сейчас у нее магазин, где она продает продукты питания. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Mavlakat B. lives in the city of Kulob. She is 44 years old, married and has 6 children. Her husband works as a driver. Mavlakat has been involved in retails sales for over 10 years. She first started selling at a market and now has a store, where she sells food products. She is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Atef

texts.en:
Atef is a 49-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife. He has been working in the construction industry for 27 years. He specializes in placing the concrete foundation in walls, which takes place before other siding or paint is applied. He has been running his own business since 1990. He says that he has faced some challenge in securing sufficient financing for his business. 

He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner. He plans to use the loan to invest in a mode of transportation for his business. He believes the loan will have a positive impact on his business and increase his income, which will help him better support his family.

loans.use: To invest in a mode of transportation for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tools for farming

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.en: J. Shahodat is married with two children. She launched her enterprise five years ago with the assistance of her husband. Today, she is still selling fabrics for national dresses at the famous market of her city. Shahodat has about $2,000 invested in merchandise and her net profit is about $200 each month. Her affordable pricing policy causes good turnover of her inventory and brings Shahodat high profits. Shahodat is seeking a loan of 7,500 Somoni to increase her turnover and sales rates. Shahodat started this business when she couldn't find any other way to support herself and her family, so this venture is just like her baby, and she is very excited to see it expand and become sustainable. Shahodat is hoping to make good money in business and eventually do some repairs to her family's house. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics in order to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 40-year-old married man from Lebanon. He has three people living in his household. He has a business polishing cars. He has been operating this business since 1999 and has been working in the field for 21 years. He is proud of his fast and high quality services. He notes that he has faced some challenges in developing his business due to the war in Lebanon and lack of adequate financing.

He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner. He plans to use the loan to make improvements to his house, specifically painting it. He believes that these improvements will have a positive impact on his family. This will be his second loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To make improvements to his house

loans.name: Nizomadoy

texts.en: Nizomadoy is a hard-working entrepreneur from Pendjikent, Tajikistan. Together with her husband, she has three children. She runs a business where she sells women’s clothing. Nizomadoy started her business 10 years ago and has run it with both extreme care and seriousness. Her daughters help Nizomadoy with her business. She has requested a loan of 6,500 Somoni so that she can purchase more clothing for the upcoming summer season. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to grow her business further and help feed her family. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing clothing for expanding her business

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en: Fotima S. is 51 years old. She is married with five children. Her husband is a taxi driver. In order to help her husband in supporting the family, Fotima is running her own business. Fotima has been in the catering trade for many years. She’s renting the catering room in a caravan in the central local market. This allows Fotima to have many clients, the majority of whom are those making purchases in the market. Every day she purchases the latest foodstuffs and she cooks delicious dishes. Her daughter helps her with her business. Fotima is planning to expand her business and increase the working capital for purchasing extra kitchenware. With this purpose in mind, she requests 3,500 Somoni. Fotima thanks all supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing kitchenware

loans.name: Ravshanbek

texts.ru: Хайдаров Равшанбек проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 23 года. Холост. Образование среднее. Занимается выпечкой уже 2 года. Кредит берет для приобретения духовки. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить большую прибыль.
texts.en:
Ravshanbek H. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 23 years old, single. He has a secondary education. He has been involved in baking for 2 years. Ravshanbek is requesting this loan for the purchase of an oven. He wants to expand his business and make a big profit.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of an oven

loans.name: Noroy

texts.en:
Problems and money shortages never defeated Noroy, who has always looked for a way to get past obstacles and continue to improve her situation. Noroy is an extremely hard-working and energetic woman. She is 49 years old, divorced, and the loving mother of 5 children. Noroy started her own business after her divorce from her husband. 

For more than 10 years, she has operated a store where she sells children’s clothing and toys. Her store is well known and people love to visit because it's clean, tidy, and run by someone who is very kind and thoughtful. Noroy hopes that her store will keep growing so that she can maintain a comfortable life for her family, especially for her children. 

To make that possible, she has applied for a new loan of 5000 Somoni to buy more clothing to sell. She promises to repay the loan in time and thanks everyone for supporting her.     
 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new clothing to sell

loans.name: To God Be The Glory Group

texts.en:
Francis T. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "To God Be The Glory." He is 34 years old, single, and has a 12 year old child. He has an associates degree in electronics.

For 6 years, Francis has been selling building materials, such as nails, hinges, locks, and saws on a table at the Redlight Market in Paynesville, Liberia. He sells goods that customers demand, which keeps customers returning. But he has problems during the rainy season because, when it rains, business can be very hard for him.

Francis started selling with 1,000.00 Liberian Dollars of working capital that he saved from working with a private security firm. He now has about 35,000 Liberian Dollars of working capital. 
 
He plans to use his 10,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 48,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more building materials, such as nails, hinges, locks, and saws, to sell. His goal is to improve his business, open a shop, and build a house for his family.

He describes himself as a quick forgiver and a fast reactor.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Francis is holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more building materials to sell

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a 47-year-old year old man who is married to a hairdresser. He runs a driving and computer college called Ikinu Driving and Computer College. He opened this college fifteen years ago. In addition, he has a retail shop. He belongs to Ikinu Jitahidi group in Faulu Kenya whose members guarantee each other's loans. 

He wants to take his first loan of KES 20,000 from Faulu Kenya. He wants to use this loan, along with his savings, to service his driving school pick-up.  He hopes to expand his college to accommodate more students.

loans.use: To service his driving school pick-up

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a 35-year-old married woman. She operates a salon called "Kwa N. Salon." She has twelve years of experience in the business. She uses part of her income to pay wages to her two employees. She is a member of the Matel Group of Faulu Kenya, whose members guarantee each other's loans. She plans to use her first loan of KES 20,000 to buy a hair dryer and hair treatments. She wants to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a hair dryer and hair treatments

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: New Hope Group

texts.en:
S. B. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called "New Hope." He is 61 years old, married, and has 6 children who range from 28 to 32 years old. He did not have the opportunity to go school due to poverty; he had to send his brothers to school and take care of his ill father.

For 11 years, S. has been selling building materials, such as cutlasses, nails, hinges, locks, and saws from a table at the Redlight Market in Paynesville, Liberia. He talks to customers in a nice manner, which keeps customers returning.

S. started selling with 20.00 Liberian Dollars of working capital and now has about 40,000 Liberian Dollars for working capital. He plans to use his 8,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 39,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more building materials to sell. His goal is to expand his business to other locations in Monrovia and educate his children. He describes himself as a good businessman.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, S. is holding the sign. A photo of Augustine B. is inset at the lower right of the group photo, because he was absent during the interview.

loans.use: To buy more building materials to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 39-year-old married man who has a one year old child and a seven year old child. He has been selling clothes in an open-air market called Kawangware Market. He has hired one person to assist him in his business. He is an active member of a Faulu Kenya group. He attends the weekly group meetings and pays his dues consistently. 

He is requesting for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy two bales of denim trousers. He is a hard-working and determined man who hopes to own a big boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy two bales of denim trousers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 28 years old and married. He lives with his wife and three children. He sells cosmetics for a living. He has been involved in the business for eight years. He also sells clothes and fabrics to tailors. 

He is a new member of a Faulu Kenya group called Millenium Self-Help Group. He joined this group to access financial support easily from Faulu Kenya.  He is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to buy more cosmetics. He hopes to become a major distributor of cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a 34-year-old married man. He has been operating a retail shop for six years. He also farms with his wife, who practices dairy farming. He is a member of a Faulu Kenya group called "Gathaiti Tuinuane." 

He managed to open a retail shop with the help of a KES 20,000 loan from the organization, which he succssfully repaid. He has requested a loan of KES 40,000 to add sugar, maize flour, cooking fat, soap and brooms to his inventory. He hopes to enlarge his shop into a wholesale store in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour, cooking fat, soap and brooms

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more fish to serve her customers.

loans.name: Tenjei

texts.en:
Z. is married and has six children. He is presently retired and, due to ill health, cannot indulge in agricultural activities, which are the main source of income in his community. He has been a GHAPE member since 2004 and has successfully borrowed and repaid four loans. 

With this new loan, he plans to buy a motorcycle taxi for transportation. Given the nature of the roads in his community, motorcycles are the most favorable means of transport. He also plans to repair his pig sty and add one more piglet to his farm. The profits from this loan will be used to provide food to his family and help to pay for the education of his children.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su Sexto ciclo y todas las integrantes se encuentran satisfechas con el trabajo que cada una realiza.
Una de las integrantes es la  Sra. Ramona M. tiene 50 años con  2 hijas  señorita, una de ellas también participa del comité.
La Sra.  Ramona se dedica a dos actividades una de ellas es la venta de ropas de segunda mano y la otra es la  confección y venta de lencería.
La ropas las ofrece en su salón de ventas y  las  confecciona de lencería   vende los  fines de semana visitando locales comerciales con su hija.
 Es una señora muy guapa y le gusta lo que hace y agradece por el apoyo que le brinda la Fundación por el crédito que se le otorga.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de fardos de ropas de segunda mano.
En el futuro desea ampliar su salón  para su taller de costura, por ende ella pone mucho empeño en su trabajo y dice que si uno procura por sus metas se puede lograr el objetivo .
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Luchadoras” (“Fighting Women”) group is in its sixth loan cycle and all of its members are satisfied with each other's work. One of the group's members is Ramona M.. Ramona is 50 years old and has two daughters, one of whom is also in the group. Ramona has two businesses. She sells used clothing from her shop, and she makes lingerie which she and her daughter sell on the weekends by visiting local businesses. Ramona is a very beautiful woman and she likes what she does. She is grateful for the support of the loans she has received from Fundación Paraguaya. She will use this loan to purchase bundles of used clothing. In the future, she would like to expand her shop and sewing studio, and so she puts a lot of effort into her work. She says that if you work hard you can achieve your goals.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Hermínio

texts.pt:
Hermínio N. nasceu na Província de Inambane, sul de Moçambique, tem 51 anos de idade, casado e pai de 6 filhos de 17, 14, 12, 10, 8 e 7 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 8ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta Mais ninguém para alem da sua familia.
Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo cumprindo o serviço militar em 1980, mais tarde fixou sua residência e formou uma família. Actualmente trabalha como professor de música na escola de música das forças armadas, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário mensal de 11.300.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas de serviço que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo no valor de 30.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, chapas de zinco, portas, aros de portas e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir e mobilar a sua casa oferecendo conforto a sua família.
texts.en:
Hermínio N. was born in Inhambane, in Southern Mozambique. He is 51 years old, married, and the father of 6 children ages 17, 14, 12, 10, 8 and 7, all enrolled in school. His studies were interrupted after 8th Grade due to financial constraints. He lives with his family in a house they own. Hermínio left Inhambane for Maputo in 1980, to fulfill his military service duties, and has been living there ever since. He currently works as a music teacher at the Armed Forces School of Music, earning a monthly salary of 11.300.00mt, which allows him to cover the family's expenses as well as to save some money. He learned about Hluvuku through colleagues at work and this is his 5th loan with the institution. He plans to use the 30.000.00mt to buy construction material (cement, zinc plates, doors, door frames, etc) to continue building his house. He is committed to paying this loan back in a timely manner and plans to apply for more credit in the future, to finish and furnish his house, so that his family can have a more comfortable place to live.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cement, zinc plates, doors, door frames, etc

loans.name: Carlos

texts.pt:
Carlos Z. nasceu na Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, tem 46 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos de 28, 20, 09 e 06 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez 10ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras e teve que iniciar a trabalhar muito cedo. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 irmaos e 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ele.
Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo cumprindo o serviço militar em 1981, em 1986 casou se e fixou sua residência onde continua a viver actualmente. Trabalha como agente de medicina geral no hospital militar e tem um salário de 10.180.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária. 
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus oficiais de credito que vinham fazer a mobilização no serviço. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 30.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, blocos, chapas, barrotes e outros) para continuar com a construção da sua casa. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir e mobilar a sua casa, pretende ainda solicitar para a compra de uma viatura.
texts.en:
Carlos Z. was born in Inhambane Province in southern Mozambique. He is 46 years old, married, and has four children, ages 28, 20, 9 and 6. All the children go to school. Carlos finished tenth grade but did not continue because of financial difficulties and because he had to start working while very young. He lives in his own house with his family and supports two brothers and two younger relatives (nieces or nephews) who live with him. In 1981, he left Inhambane to come to Maputo while completing his military service. In 1986 he got married and established a home, where he is still living today. Carlos works in general medicine in the military hospital and has a salary of 10,800 meticais per month. He uses the money for household expenses and saves some in his bank account. He has never had loans from other banks. Carlos learned about Hluvuku through its loan officers, who came to his workplace to run an enrollment drive. This is his third loan, and he is asking for 30,000 meticais. He intends to buy construction materials (sand, cement, blocks, zinc sheets, beams and other items) to continue construction on his house. Carlos promises to pay off this loan on time so he can take out other loans. In the future he would like to ask for more loans to finish building and furnishing his house. He also intends to ask for a loan to buy a vehicle.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sand, cement, zinc sheets, blocks and other items

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Carmen es una cliente antigua de la institución, anteriormente trabajó con un grupo solidario llamado "Madrugadores", ahora trabaja individualmente, ella se dedica a la confección de trajes para dama, vestidos de fiesta y pantalones maternales, es un señora muy conocida en la zona de Pampahasi que donde ella vive, tiene sus hijos que ya son independientes pero siempre están al pendiente de su mamá, el crédito que solicita ahora es para la compra de tela para la confección de pantalones, ya que tiene muchos  pedidos por estas epocas ya que se acerca el dia de la Madre. Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen is a former member of our institution. Previously she was a member of a community group called “Madrugadores” (Early Risers), but now she works on her own. She makes women’s clothing such as dresses for special occasions and maternity pants. Carmen is well known in the Pampahasi area where she lives. Her children are independent but they are still close to their mother. This loan will be used to buy material to make pants as there are currently many orders for the upcoming Mothers Day. Carmen is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in her in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Felismina

texts.pt:
Felismina A. M. nasceu no Distrito Municipal da Catembe, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 42 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 5 filhos de 25, 23, 20, 9 e 4 anos de idade, 3 destes vão a escola. Fés somente 3ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta também uma sobrinha que vive com ela.
Saiu da Catembe para cidade de Maputo quando se juntou ao seu marido. Tem um negócio próprio que desenvolve no seu quintal ha mais de 10 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 23.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, blocos, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. Tem como sonho realizar uma cerimónia de casamento oficial. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para desenvolver o seu negocio.
texts.en:
Felismina A. M. was born in Catembe Municipal District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is 42 years old, married, and has five children, ages 25, 23, 20, 9 and 4. Three of the children go to school. Felismina only finished third grade and did not continue because of her parents' financial difficulties. She lives in her own house with her family and also supports a niece who lives with her. She left Catembe to move to Maputo City when she got married. Felismina has run her own business from her yard for more than 10 years. She has no employees and earns about 6,000 meticais per month, which she uses for household expenses. She also saves some money in her bank account. Felismina has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also customers of this institution. This is her second loan, and she is asking for 23,000 meticais. She intends to buy construction materials (cement, sand, blocks, stone and other items) to continue building her house. She promises to pay off this loan on time so she can have more loans. One of Felismina's dreams is to have an official wedding ceremony. In the future she intends to ask for more loans to develop her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cement, sand, blocks, stone and other items

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es:
Evelyn  vive en la zona El Tejar, ubicada en una zona populosa de la ciudad de La Paz.

Es casada, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como chofer propietario de un taxi y sus pequeños hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar

Trabaja  como comerciante de productos para el hogar, como ser edredones, camas y otros, los cuales lo adquiere en la frontera y lo vende en la ciudad.


El crédito lo destinará a la adquisición de materiales de construcción para continuar con las mejoras en la infraestructura de su vivienda, y así mejorar su calidad de vida. 
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro,  la  evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Evelyn lives in El Tejar, a densely populated neighborhood in La Paz. She is married and lives with her husband and school-aged children in their own home. Her husband drives his own taxi. Evelyn sells household items, including comforters and beds, which she buys at the border and sells in the city. She will use this loan to purchase construction materials to continue making improvements to her home and thereby improve her standard of living. This is her first loan with IMPRO, but she has been evaluated as being qualified to receive credit.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Amélia

texts.pt:
Amélia A. L. nasceu na cidade Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 55 anos de idade, casada e mae de 9 filhos de idades entre 36 a 15 anos de idade, os dois mais velhos ja com o nível superior concluído, os restantes continuam a estudar. Fez somente 7ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com sua família e sustenta 3 netos que vivem com ela.
Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, depois de parar de estudar devido as dificuldades financeiras começou a trabalhar como administrativa no Hospital militar. Trabalha ha mais de 15 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 8.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de suas amigas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, areia, ferro e outros) para continuar com a ampliação da sua residência. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt, 21.000.00mt e 21.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. Tem o sonho de iniciar uma actividade comercial. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para desenvolver o seu negocio e se tornar uma empresaria de renome.
texts.en:
Amélia A. L. was born in Maputo City, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is 55 years old, married, and has 9 children between the ages of 36 and 15. The two eldest children have finished college, and the rest are still studying. Amélia only finished seventh grade and did not continue because of financial difficulties. She lives in her own house with her family and supports three grandchildren who live with her. She has never left her hometown. After she stopped her studies because of financial difficulties, Amélia started working in administration at the military hospital, where she has been working for more than 15 years. She has no employees and has a salary of 8,000 meticais per month. She uses this money for household expenses and can still save some in her bank account. Amélia has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also customers of this institution. This is her fifth loan, and she is asking for 25,000 meticais. She intends to buy construction materials (cement, stone, sand, iron and other items) to continue adding on to her home. The previous loans were for 10,000 meticais, 15,000 meticais, 21,000 meticais and 21,000 meticais, all for the same purpose. Amélia promises to pay off this loan on time so she can take out other loans. Her dream is to start a business. In the future she intends to ask for more loans to develop her business and become a businesswoman of renown.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cement, iron, stone and sand

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline N. is a widow who has eight children to look after, five of whom are still in school. Unable to meet the material needs of her children, she sought assistance from GHAPE when she joined the program in 2004. Her dedication to the program is unquestionable and her hard work has had untold results on her family's situation.

With her new loan, she plans to repair her pig sty, buy more three more piglets, pig feed and coffee from neighboring villages. There are a lot of small-scale coffee farmers in neighboring villages whose products are too small to attract coffee-processing firms. She plans to go to them, buy the coffee from several farmers, and resell to the coffee cooperative society in Mbengwi, which serves as a collection centre for coffee processing firms. The profit she gets from the loans will be used to educate her children and provide food for her family.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buy piglets, pig feed, and coffee

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Mbachio Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su Décimo Primer ciclo.
 Podemos hablar de la Sra. Carola M. con 32años,  tiene 1 hijo y es madre soltera.
Ella  se dedica en la venta de electrodomésticos, su trabajo consiste en salir por la  mañana para ofrecer sus productos por catálogos y se traslada en moto en distintas ciudades vuelve a su casa por la tarde.
Es una señora muy sufrida que tiene un día a día muy pesado  por que al llegar de su trabajo debe de realizar las tareas de la casa y todo lo hace para salir adelante con su hijo ya que es madre soltera.  
Ella solicita el préstamo para el pago de algunos gastos de la vivienda como agua, luz y otros, agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva por la ayuda que le brinda a ella y sus compañeras ya que todas son de escasos recursos.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is in its eleventh loan cycle. The member who will be highlighted is Sra. Carola M., who is a 32 year old single mother of one child.

Carola sells electrical appliances. Her work requires that she leave in the morning so that she can offer her products through catalogs. She travels by motorcycle to different cities and returns home in the afternoon. Carola is a very patient woman who has a tedious daily work schedule, but she finds a way to complete her housework and do everything she can as a single mother so that she and her son can succeed.

She is requesting a loan in order to pay a few of her household expenses, such as water, electricity, and other utilities. Carola is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the support they have provided to her and her fellow Communal Bank members since they all have limited resources.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for housing utilities (water, electricity, etc.)

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julián es productor lechero y realiza inseminaciones, es su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de su familia. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad de Jahuirlaca – Achacachi Prov. Omasuyos a 2 horas y media de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera para  incrementar su producción de leche y así poder mejorar sus ingresos.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro, pero el análisis de su flujo de caja muestra que es capaz de afrontar los pagos mensuales del crédito sin poner en peligro el sustento familiar.
texts.en:
Julian is a milk producer and a dairy cattle breeder. These activities are the main source of income that help support his family. His home is located in the community of Jahuirlaca – Achacachi in the Province of Omasuyos, which is 2½ hours away from the city of El Alto.

This loan will be used to buy a dairy cow so that he can increase his milk production, thereby improving his income. Julian is requesting his first loan from IMPRO. The analysis of his cash flow indicates he is capable of meeting his monthly loan payments without compromising financial support for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow to increase milk production

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es: La Sra. Janeth se dedica a la confección de jeans para mujer, labor que viene desempeñando junto a sus hijos ya hace bastante tiempo que se dedica a esta actividad, con la ayuda de sus hijos siempre esta innovando en cuanto a la moda sacando diseños nuevos, justamente este fue el motivo para que ella solicitara su primer prestamo en la empresa, las exigencias de mercado y el crecimiento del mismo obligaron que ella tenga que aumentar el número de maquinas de costura en su pequeño taller, actualmente ella ha demostrado un buen comportamiento de pago en la Institución razón por la cual no se le negó el presente crédito. Doña Janeth cuenta con domicilio propio en la zona Primavera, el dinero del credito lo utilizara en la compra de tela ya que se acerca el dia de la madre y tiene muchos pedidos, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Janeth makes jeans for women. She has been in this line of work for a long time, and her children have also joined in the business. With the help of her children, she is always innovative in terms of fashion and creating new designs. This was exactly the reason she asked for her first loan for the business. The demands of the market and the growth of the business forced her to increase the amount of sewing machines in her small workshop. She has demonstrated good payment behavior with the Institution, which is why she was not denied the present loan. Janeth has her own home in the Primavera area. She will use the loan money to buy cloth since Mother's Day is approaching, and she has many orders. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have shown in giving her this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tania Mazumdar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cloth to make clothes.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
Rafaela es productora lechera y tiene una Tienda, es su principal fuente de ingreso con  que cubre la manutención de su familia. La señora está separada de su esposo. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad de Jahuirlaca – Achacachi Prov. Omasuyos a 2 horas y media de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de una vaca lechera para  incrementar su producción de leche.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro y el análisis socio-económico muestra que es sujeto de crédito.
texts.en:
Rafaela is a milk producer and manages a store as her main sources of income to support her family. She is separated from her spouse. Her home is located in the community of Jahuirlaca – Achacachi in Omasuyos Province, which is 2½ hours away from the city of El Alto.

This loan will be used to buy a dairy cow so that she can increase her milk production. Rafaela is requesting her first loan from IMPRO. The socio-economic analysis indicates she is eligible for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow to increase her milk production

loans.name: Fongyen

texts.en:
Born in 1962, J. is married and a father of three. He has been a victim of a sickness that incapacitated his left arm. His greatest wish is to see all his children be responsible citizens in the future. He joined GHAPE in 2004 and has been a devoted member since then. He bought a motorbike with his previous loan but, unfortunately, it is not in working condition.

With this loan, he plans to repair the motorbike and use it as a motorcycle taxi for public transportation. This will serve as an additional source of income for his family and will go a long way to help meet the family needs of food, clothing, medication, and education for the children. Motorcycle taxis provide a door-to-door service that is preferred by all. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Repair Motorcycle Taxi

loans.name: Doh

texts.en:
P. is married to two wives and has seven children, four of whom are under the age of fifteen. He lives in Kobenyang, Momo Division, in the northwest region of Cameroon. As a very hard-working guy. He has faced some major challenges in life, such as inadequate funds to pay for his children's education, ill health, and death of relatives. In 2008, he saw GHAPE as a source of relief and became a member. He has received and repaid loans from GHAPE twice and his previous repayments were encouraging.

With the loan he is requesting now, he plans to invest in his farm. With the profit from the loan, he will pay for his children's education, clothe them, and give them good food and good medication whenever they are sick.
	
He prefers to receive loan from GHAPE, rather than other financial institutions, because of the training GHAPE offers and because proper follow-up is done to ensure the loan is properly managed.


About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement

loans.use: To purchase yams, corn, beans, and seeds

loans.name: Lucia Nila

texts.es:
Lucia de 55 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, esta separada pero tiene tres hijos, hace años atrás para que Lucia pudiera mantener a sus hijos pequeños tuvo que invertir sus ahorros en víveres y empezar a vender comida los fines de semana, ubico una carpa y sillas fuera de su casa para vender caldo de salchicha (es un sopa hecha con los intestinos de la vaca, rellena de plátanos). 

Por los buenos ingresos ahora ella hace almuerzos de lunes a viernes, los platos que vende son arroz con carne, arroz con pescado, caldo de pollo etc. Todos los platos los vende por pedido, para ayudarse sigue haciendo caldo de salchicha los fines de semana. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar un quintales de arroz y azúcar para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener un restaurante, y construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Lucia is 55 years old and lives in the urban area of Suburbio in Guayaquil. She is separated from her spouse, but she has three children. Several years ago, Lucia used her savings to buy groceries so that she could begin selling food on the weekends to support her young children. She set up a tent and some chairs outside of her house in order to sell “caldo de salchicha” (a soup made of cow intestines stuffed with plantains).

To generate good income, she now prepares lunches Monday through Friday. The dishes she sells include rice with beef, rice with fish, chicken soup, etc. All of her dishes are sold upon order. She continues to make “caldo de salchicha” on the weekends to help earn extra income.

With this loan, Lucia plans to buy one quintal (1 quintal = 100 kg) each of rice and sugar for her business. In the future, she wants to open a restaurant and build a better house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice & sugar

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza produce salteñas (turnovers) hechas con carne de vaca y con carne de pollo y las vende; su esposo es transportista, de esta manera consiguen sus  ingresos con los que cubren la manutención de su familia. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, zona villa Tunari.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de insumos, como ser carne de vaca y de pollo, papa, harina, huevos, etc., para la elaboración de salteñas.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro, pero dado el carácter social del mismo y el análisis financiero, Esperanza tiene la oportunidad de aplicar para dicho préstamo.
texts.en:
Esperanza produces “salteñas” (turnovers) made of beef and chicken and sells them. Her husband works as a carrier, so both of their incomes are used to cover their family’s expenses. Their home is located in the city of El Alto, Villa Tunari District.

This loan will be used to buy supplies such as beef, chicken, potatoes, flour, eggs, and other items used for making turnovers. Esperanza is requesting her first loan from IMPRO. Given her social character and the financial analysis, she is eligible to apply for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making turnovers

loans.name: Clara

texts.pt:
Carla N. nasceu na cidade Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 30 anos de idade, solteira e não tem filhos ainda. Fez 12ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com  seus familiares e sustenta 2 irmaos que vivem com ela.
 Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, depois de parar de estudar devido as dificuldades financeiras iniciou um negocio próprio. Faz este negocio ha mais de 7 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 10.000.00mt a 15.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de suas amigas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar roupa (calcas, blusas, casacos, saias e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. Tem o sonho de se formar no ensino superior, no futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para desenvolver o seu negocio e se tornar uma empresaria de renome.
texts.en:
Clara N. was born in Maputo City, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is 30 years old, single and does not yet have children. She finished twelfth grade but did not continue school because of financial difficulties. She lives in her own house with her relatives and supports two brothers who live with her. She never left her hometown. After she stopped studying because of financial difficulties, Clara began her own business. She has run this business for more than seven years. She has no employees and earns about 10,000 to 15,000 meticais per month, which she uses for household expenses. She also saves some in her bank account. Clara has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through her friends, who are also customers of this institution. This is her third loan, and she is asking for 25,000 meticais. She intends to buy clothing (pants, blouses, jackets, skirts and other items) to increase her inventory. She promises to pay off this loan on time so she can take out more loans. Clara's dream is to attend college. In the future she intends to ask for more loans to develop her business and become a businesswoman of renown.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing (pants, blouses, jackets and skirts)

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia trabaja como cajera en una casa de cambio y su esposo es técnico en sistemas de computación y su taller esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio, con estas actividades ellos consiguen sus ingresos mensuales con los que cubren la manutención de su familia. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona de Pura Pura ciudad de La Paz. 

El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de material de construcción (arena, cemento, ladrillos y pinturas) para terminar de construir su casa.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro y en vista de que si terminan su casa ellos podrán vivir más cómodamente, nos parece que es un candidato ideal para un préstamo a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Julia works as a cashier at a currency exchange center, while her husband is a computer systems technician. His workshop is located in their home. From these activities, they receive a monthly income by which they can cover their family’s expenses. Their home is located in the district of Pura Pura in the city of La Paz.

This loan will be used to buy materials (sand, cement, bricks, and paint) to finish the construction of their house.

This is Julia’s first loan with IMPRO. Since the completion of her house will allow her family to live more comfortably, she makes an ideal candidate for a loan through Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sand, cement, bricks, and paint to finish the construction of her house

loans.name: Nih

texts.en:
Nih P. is married and he is the father of three children. He lives in Wumngang-Mbengwi, Momo Division, in the northwest region of Cameroon. As a very hard-working man, he has faced some major challenges in life, such as being unable to meet the educational needs of his children, ill health, and death of close relatives. In 2004, he saw GHAPE as a source of relief. He has received loans from GHAPE four times and his previous repayments were satisfactory. His community is privileged to have someone like him. Most of them are learn from him how to keep fish and good pigs.

With the loan he is requesting now, he plans to invest in his pig and fish businesses. With the profit from the loan, he will pay for his children's educations, clothe them, and give them good food and good medication whenever they are sick.
	
He prefers to receive loans from GHAPE, rather than other financial institutions, because of the training GHAPE offers and because proper follow-up is done to ensure that the loan is properly managed.


About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement

loans.use: To buy better piglets and a variety of fish

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
Banco de Emprendimiento:  VIRGEN DE GUADALUPE  se encuentra ubicado en el Barrio Palmira, ubicado en la calle Las Ameritas, el B.E. esta en su 3er ciclo, compuesto por 10 personas, Se fundo el  19 de Junio  del 2009, a iniciativa de un grupo de señoras.

Como PRESIDENTA tenemos a la señora Cinthia , TESORERA la  Sra. Francisca y SECRETARIA la Sra. Fabiola, en el grupo hay señoras que se dedican a la  venta de  panadería ,jugos de frutas, abarrotes, ropa, dulces asaditos ,empanadas comida, ropas, albañilería y otros. Las reuniones se llevan acabo los días jueves a horas  en la casa de la señora Cristina. Los nuevos clientes están conforme de trabajar con Emprender debido a que dentro de la capacitación del  B.E. VIRGEN DE GUADALUPE  ,se les estableció una proyección de sus ahorros a la finalización  del ciclo  en la cual  aprenderán a ahorrar  y compartir con sus amigas cada 14 días.

La Sra. CINTHIA (Presidenta) vende Cosmeticos de manera ambulante  en diferentes mercados populares, a parte de esta actividad se dedica a cuidar a sus hijos en sus tiempos libres y  le va bien el negocio. En el banco comunal ha aprendido a ahorrar, a quererse y valorarse como persona, siente útil con lo que le enseñan en las capacitaciones. El sueño de la señora  Cinthia  es tener su propia vitrina de cosméticos, y progresar en la vida con su negocio, con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia al por mayor.

Todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Guadalupe Communal Bank is located in the Palmira neighborhood on Las Ameritas street. The communal bank is in its third cycle. There are ten people in this communal bank. It was founded by a group of women on June 19th, 2009. Cinthia is the president, Francisca is the treasurer, and Fabiola is the secretary. There are women in the group who sell baked goods, fruit juices, groceries, clothes, sweets, grilled meats, empanadas, food, or other things. Some work as bricklayers. Meetings take place on Thursdays at Cristina’s house. The new clients are happy to work with Emprender as they learn how to save and share with their friends every 14 days. Cinthia (the president) sells cosmetics as a street vendor at the different popular fairs. Aside from this activity, she devotes herself to taking care of her children in her free time. The business is going well for her. She feels that what they teach in the trainings is useful. Cinthia’s dream is to have her own cosmetic display case. She will use the loan to buy wholesale merchandise. All of the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy mercandise

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar ,de 36 años, vive con su esposa y sus  dos hijos. Juntos habitan  en una comunidad ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su casa que es propia.Sabe lo duro que ha sido su vida,por las dificultades que se le presentaron de pequeño pues con las ganancias  del trabajo de  su padre  con las justas tenían  para sobrevivir. Es por eso que cuando creció busco una labor rentable, y en la actualidad se dedica por entero a la actividad agrícola. Él cultiva cacao y café, y esta actividad le genera  buenas ganancias económicas . Generalmente labora en su chacra solo, y  durante la temporada de cosecha contrata la ayuda de peones que le  facilitan la extracción de su cosecha . Sus productos que cultiva son el  cacao y café ; que  vende en los centros de acopio de su comunidad. Su plan a futuro es comprar más terrenos con la finalidad de cumplir con sus compromisos pactados, además de empezar a producir a gran escala.Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y se compromete a cumplir con sus obligaciones puntualmente , además se siente fortalecido con el trabajo de su banco comunal.Oscar tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de  abono e insumos con la finalidad de brindar un mantenimiento de sus plantaciones, y empezar a producir en cantidad.
texts.en:
Oscar is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a community located on the edge of the Peruvian jungle where they have their own home. He knows how hard life can be as a result of difficulties he experienced. Growing up, his father’s meager earnings were just enough for his family to survive. For this reason, he decided to pursue more profitable work and now devotes himself entirely to farming. Oscar grows cacao and coffee, two crops that that generate good income. He generally works alone, but during the harvest season he will hire workers to help gather the crops. His products are sold to the collection centers in his community. In the future, Oscar has plans to buy more land so that he can start producing on a larger scale and satisfy all of his commitments.

This is his third loan with MFP. Oscar promises to complete his payments on time and feels empowered by the work of his Communal Bank. He plans to use the money to purchase compost and farming supplies so that he can maintain his crops and begin producing in large quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & farming supplies

loans.name: Soh

texts.en: E. is married and the mother of three children, all of them below the age of fifteen. She lives in Mile 19, Mbengwi, Momo division, in the northwest region of Cameroon. She is a very hard working woman but is still unable to meet the needs of her family. As for every mother, her wish is to see that her children have a good education in order to be able to support themselves in the future and give her a helping hand when she comes of age. She joined GHAPE in the year 2007 and has successfully taken and repaid two loans. With the loan she is requesting, she plans to expand her palm oil business by buying and selling palm oil on a larger scale. With the profit from the loan, she plans to pay for her children's' education, clothe them, give them good food and good medication whenever they are sick. She prefers to receive a loan from GHAPE to other financial institutions because of the training GHAPE offers and because proper follow up is done to ensure the loan is properly managed. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.

loans.use: Purchase of palm oil and containers.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité “Nueva Esperanza” se formó en base al espíritu emprendedor de las señoras y por necesidad de generar mas ingresos de sus integrantes  para tratar de mejorar su calidad de vida.
Utilizaran el crédito para diversas opciones dependiendo de la actividad a que se dedica cada integrante así como la señora Lorenza quien realiza servicios de manicura y pedicura sus horas libres.
Ella recibe los pedidos por teléfono y hace servicio a domicilio de las clientas, por sus buenos trabajos ya cuenta con clientela formada y un ingreso seguro mediante este trabajo.
Ella comenta que esta actividad genera un ingreso imprescindible para ayudar con los gastos de su familia por ello desea adquirir para mejorar sus servicios herramientas mas sofisticadas como limas de distintos tipos, raspa callos, pinzas, y otros.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de estas herramientas y agradece a kiva por la ayuda que brinda a las personas de escasos recursos pero con ganas de trabajar.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) Committee was established out of the entrepreneurial spirit of a group of women who needed to generate more income to improve their quality of life. They will use this loan in different ways depending on the business activities of each member. Sra. Lorenza provides manicure and pedicure services in her free time. She receives appointment requests over the phone and provides her services in the homes of her clients. Lorenza already has an established clientele and earns a steady income from this line of work. She says that this business generates essential income to help with her family’s expenses. In order to improve her services, she wants to acquire more sophisticated equipment such as distinct types of nail files, callus files, tweezers, and other items. She is requesting a loan to buy this equipment and thanks Kiva for helping people of limited resources who are eager to work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase nail files, callus files, tweezers, and other items

loans.name: Carla

texts.es:
La señora Carla vive en ella sola en alquiler en  la zona 14 de septiembre de la ciudad de La Paz,, sus padres viven en Santa Cruz. La actividad que ella realiza es la venta de comida en un restaurante en su mismo domicilio.

 El crédito que solicita es para comprar víveres e insumos para los almuerzos que ella vende, pues esta actividad es su única fuente de ingresos que usa para su manutención.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo de Impro y  por el carácter social del mismo nos parece que lo podemos canalizar a través de Ki
texts.en:
Sra. Carla lives alone in a rental property in the September 14th district of the city of La Paz. Her parents live in Santa Cruz. She sells food from a restaurant she manages out of her home.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy food and supplies for preparing lunches that she sells. This activity is her only source of income by which she supports herself.

Carla is applying for her first loan with IMPRO. Based on her social character, it is evident that her loan request can be channeled through Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her small restaurant

loans.name: Jardin De Las Lomas Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA JARDIN DELAS LOMAS YA QUE ASI SE LAMA LA COMUNIDAD DONDE VIVEN. LAS 4 PERSONAS DEL GRUPO Y SUS ACTIVIDADES SON: SOFIA L. VA A VENDER REFRESCO, RAFAELA R. VENTA  DE ARTESANIAS, MARIA GUADALUPE VA A VENDER ZAPATOS POR CATALOGO Y MARIA ISABEL L. VA A VENDER ROPA.
LA SRA. SOFIA L. S. ES CASADA TIENE 5 HIJOS LOS CUALES SE LLAMAN DAVID, MARIA DEL ROSARIO, JOAQUIN, JOSUE Y EVELIN. 

LA SRA. SOFIA QUIERE VENDER REFRESCO EN SU CASA Y UN POCO DE ABARROTES YA QUE EN DONDE VIVE NO HAY TIENDAS CERCA Y TODOS LOS VECINOS SE TIENEN QUE TRASLADAR HASTA EL CENTRO Y ESTA RETIRADO Y ELLA CREE QUE SERIA UN BUEN NEGOCIO Y DARIA MUCHAS GANANCIAS.

CON ESTE CREDITO QUIERE COMPRAR REFRESCO DE TODOS SABORES Y TAMAÑOS Y UN POCO DE AZUCAR, HUEVO, LECHE, JABON EN POLVO, ETC. PARA EMPESAR A VENDER Y SACAR ADELANTE A SUS HIJOS.
NOS COMENTA QUE SE SIENTE AGUSTO CON SU GRUPO YA QUE ES PURA GENTE CUMPLIDA Y PUNTUAL Y AGRADECE A FUNDACION REALIDAD Y A KIVA POR DARLES LA OPORTUNIDAD DE QUE LAS CONOZCAN Y QUE LAS SIGAN APOYANDO MAS ADELANTE.
texts.en:
This group is called “Jardin de Las Lomas” (Garden of the Little Hills), which is also the name of the community where they live. The group consists of four people and their business activities are noted below:
