- Sofia L. sells soft drinks. - Rafaela R. sells handicrafts. - Maria Guadalupe sells shoes through a catalog. - Maria Isabel L. sells clothing.

Sra. Sofia L. S. is married and has five children. Their names are David, Maria del Rosario, Joaquin, Josue, and Evelin. She sells soft drinks out of her home as well as a few groceries since there are no stores nearby, otherwise her neighbors who have to move to the central part of town since they live in an isolated area. Sofia believes she has a good business that generates sufficient income.

With this loan, she will buy soft drinks of all flavors and sizes. In addition, Sofia plans to purchase some sugar, eggs, milk, and powdered soap to sell so that her children can get ahead. She says she feels at ease with her group since they are genuine people who are talented and punctual with their loan payments. Sofia is grateful to Fundacion Realidad and Kiva for giving everyone the opportunity to know her group and supporting them in their continued success.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks & a few grocery items

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia, a resident of Borewala (which is famous for its shrines) Pakistan, is the wife of M. A. and the mother of five children. All of them are enrolled in a school and are getting an education. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over fifteen years.

A very caring and loving lady, Safia operates a cart making (weaving a cart frame with rope) business. Her business provides major support to her family. She fills carts on order and receives income which she uses to pay for the utilities and for the education expenses of her kids.
 
Her husband is involved in a rice selling business. He purchases the rice sacks from the market and supplies them to the grocery shops and generates income.

Safia has completed two loans from Asasah and now is applying for the third time to invest the capital in her husband’s business so he can purchase the rice sacks and expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase rice sacks to sell

loans.name: Paz Y Progreso Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Karla, se constituye en la presidenta del Banco D. Emprendimiento, la señora tiene 34 años y vive en la calle Nataniel Aguirre y tiene como actividad un taller D. bordados, el mismo que se encuentra ubicado en el mismo domicilio.Se encuentra casada con don Mario  que tiene como actividad artesano en bordados con el que tiene dos hijos, los cuales todavia dependen D. ellos. La tienda D. bordados se encuentra ubicado en un lugar estrategíco, es una zona D. Artesanos D. trajes típicos. El negocio lo atienden todos los dias, abren a partir D. 9:00 a 20:00; El crédito solicitado es para la compra D. telas e hilos para la confección D. trajes para la fiesta del Gran Poder.

Doña Gregoria  se constituye en la tesorera del Banco D. emprendimientro, la señora tiene 57 años y vive en la zona D. Villa Nuevo Potosí  y es viuda, sus hijos ya son mayores y por tanto tienen independencia económica, la señora vive sola y tiene como actividad la venta D. flores frente al cementerio en la zona El Tejar, el puesto es fijo y propio el mismo lo tiene 25 años. Doña Gregoria sale a su puesto todos los dias desD. las 4:00 hasta las 22:00 horas. El crédito solicitado es para la compra D. floreros para sus arreglos florales.

Doña Jenny  se constituye en la secretaria del Banco D. Emprendimiento, la señora tiene 28 años, se encuentra casada con don Juan que tiene como actividad junto a la esposa la venta y arreglo D. flores con quien tiene 3 hijos y viven en la zona D. pasankeri. El negocio D. las flores se encuentra ubicado en la zona del Tejar frente al cementerio general, el puesto es fijo y propio con una antiguedad D. 7 años, donD. salen todos los dias a partir D. las 9:00 hasta las 18:00 horas; El crédito  que solicitas esta dirigido para la compra D. vitrinas y floreros para el negocio.
texts.en:
Karla is the president of the communal bank. She is 34, and she lives on Nataniel Aguirre Street. She has an embroidery workshop, which is located in her house. She is married to Mario, who is an embroidery craftsman. They have two children, who are still economically dependent upon them. The embroidery store is in a strategic location in the area of the craftsmen who make typical outfits. She works in the business everyday. They open at 9 a.m. until 8 p.m. The requested loan is to buy fabric and thread to make outfits for the “Fiesta del Gran Poder” (a dramatic religious fiesta). Gregoria is the treasurer of the communal bank. She is 57, and she lives in the Villa Nuevo Potosí area. She is a widow. Her children are grown and economically independent. She lives alone, and she has a business selling flowers. She sells in front of the cemetery in the El Tejar area. Her stand is fixed, and it is her own. She has had it for 25 years. She works in her stand everyday from 4:00 p.m. until 10:00 p.m. The requested loan is to buy flowers for her floral arrangements. Jenny is the secretary of the communal bank. She is 28, and she is married to Juan. She and her husband sell and arrange flowers. They have three children, and they live in the Pasankeri area. Their floral business is located in the Tejar area in front of the general cemetery. The stand is fixed, and it is their own. They have had the stand for seven years. They work everyday from 9:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. The requested loan is to buy display cases and flower pots for the business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Jose Julio

texts.es: Julio tiene 23 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres, el se dedica a la animación de fiestas infantiles desde hace 5 años, se inicio en el negocio ya que su  hermano tambien se dedicaba a este negocio junto con amigos de su barrio, Julio desea invertir el crédito en la compra de sillas para alquilar en fiestas y tambien desea comprar fierros para poder hacer los trabajos de decoración, el sueño de Julio es poder implementar un negocio de piñateria y asi trabajar junta a su hermano.
texts.en:
Julio is 23 years old, and he lives in his parents’ house. He has been working for five years in entertainment for children’s parties. He started the business because his brother worked in this business with friends from the neighborhood. Julio wants to use the loan to buy chairs to rent for parties. He also wants to buy tools to be able to do the decoration work. Julio’s dream is to be able to establish a piñata business. That way he would work with his brother.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Establish a party decoration business

loans.name: Alcatraz De San Marcos Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA ALCATRAZ DE SAN MARCOS YA QUE ES UNA FLOR MUY BONITA QUE LES AGRADA A TODAS Y SAN MARCOS POR QUE ASI SE LLAMA LA COMUNIDAD DONDE VIVEN LA S SIETE INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO Y SUS ACTIVIDADES SON: HERMINIA, LEONCIA,FELICITAS, MARTINA, LIOVA, GAUDENCIA Y ANGELA TODAS ELLAS SE DEDICAN A LA ELABORACION DE ALFARERIA (CAZUELAS,JARROS,OLLAS,LOZA, ETC.)

DOÑA LIOVA ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO DESDE HACE TRES CICLOS ES VIUDA TIENE DOS HIJOS UN HOMBRE QUE YA NO ESTUDIA Y UNA MUJER QUE VA A LA SECUNDARIA. ELLA QUIERE AGRANDAR SU NEGOCIO Y EN UN FUTURO PODER EXPORTAR SU MERCANCIA A OTROS PAISES PARA ASI PODER SACAR ADELANTE  A SUS HIJOS Y A LA QUE ESTUDIA PODER AYUDARLA A QUE VALLA A LA UNIVERSIDAD.

CON ESTE CREDITO QUIERE COMPRAR BARRO POR BULTO, LEÑA POR CARGA, PINTURA Y GRETA PARA ELABORAR CAZUELAS, OLLAS, JARROS, PLATOS DE LOZA, MACETAS , ETC Y PODER VENDERLAS EN LA CIUDAD DE MEXIXO Y ALREDEDORES DE PUEBLA Y MORELOS Y ASI SACAR MAS GANANCIAS PARA APOYAR A SUS HIJOS

DOÑA LIOVA NOS COMENTA QUE SE SIENTE MUY AGUSTO CON EL GRUPO YA QUE ES PURA PERSONA PAGADORA Y PUNTUAL Y COMENTA QUE ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON FUNDACION REALIDAD POR EL CREDITO OTORGADO Y A KIVA ESPERA QUE SEAN BUENOS RESULTADOS LOS QUE OBTENGAN CON ESTE TRABAJO Y PUEDAMOS SEGUIR CONTANDO CON ELLOS MAS ADELANTE.
texts.en:
This loan group is called "Alcatraz de San Marcos" after a very pretty flower that everyone likes and the community of San Marcos, where the seven group members live. The group members work in the following trades: Hermina, Leoncia, Felicitas, Martina, Liova, Guadencia, and Angela are all potters and make casseroles, jars, pots, crockery, etc Liova has been a member of the group for three loan cycles, and is a widow and has two children - one boy who has finished his studies, and one girl who goes to secondary school. She wants to grow her business for the future so she can export her merchandise to other countries. This would let her and her children move forward in life and would enable the girl who is in school to go to university. With this loan she wants to buy clay in bulk, loads of fire wood, and paint in order to make casseroles, pots, jars, china plates, flowerpots, etc and to sell them in Mexico City and around Puebla and Morelos and so to earn more income to support her children. Liova tells us that she feels very comfortable with the group and that she is a very reliable repayer and punctual, and she comments that she is very grateful to the Foundation and Kiva for offering her a loan and she hopes that she will show them good results from her work and that the group can continue working with them in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clay, wood, etc

loans.name: Bredi Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
James is twenty-two years old and single. He lives alone in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial community in the region. He enjoys being a businessman very much and took to this trade after leaving basic school. James has been trading in second-hand clothes for three years. He sells along the streets and also in market squares. Though not yet married, James is hopeful of raising a family and giving his children the best of education. 
He is a hard-working young man and leader of the trust bank group called ‘Bredi’, which literally ‘means suffer or work to eat’. 

There are eight members in this group and the members are mainly petty traders in food, cosmetics, groceries, and household items. They are requesting the loan to procure stock in bulk to scale up their businesses to enable them to better support their kids in school.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes in bulk

loans.name: Nawaz Sabra's Group

texts.en:
Nawaz Sabra, a resident of Borewala (which is famous for its shrines) Pakistan, is the wife of G. M. and has no children. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it for the past 20 years.
 
A very talented lady, Nawaz operates a Parandas (an accessory used by women to tie back their hair) making business. The parandas are a very famous ornament of Pakistan. She can make every type of parandas such as of beaded, colorful and simple as well. Her parandas are very famous in her community. She also loves to wear them.

Her husband is a driver and drives a rickshaw, which is a local three-wheeled motor vehicle. He earns 500 PKR from his driving every day. They both use their income to manage their financial expenses and to improve the living standard of their family.

Nawaz is applying for a loan for the second time from Asasah, to invest the capital in her own business so she can purchase materials (beads and threads) in bulk and expand her business.

She hopes to get profit from this loan and wants to introduce her business on larger scale.

loans.use: Purchase material for making parandas (an ornament to tie-back hair)

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl ,de 42 años, convive con su pareja y tienen tres hijos pequeños.Juntos residen en una comunidad ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su casa que es  propia.Raúl es una persona totalmente exigente. Recuerda que vivía con poco dinero ; y convenció a su esposa, para ampliar  más su terreno agrícola, ya que solo trabajaban en pequeñas parcelas. El dinero que ganaban ,con la venta de sus productos , no les alcanzaba. Es por eso que en la actualidad produce mayor cantidad de cacao, y sus ganancias han mejorado bastante . Siente que todavía hay muchas cosas por realizar en esta vida , es por esta razón que en el futuro tiene pensado comprar más terrenos de cultivo, de otros productores, con la finalidad de sembrar otros productos como café y frutas cítricas. Pero sabe muy bien que debe ir a paso lento , pero seguro , y se esfuerza todos los días en su trabajo, cuida con esmero sus plantaciones para que no sean dañadas por plagas . Trabaja junto a su esposa, durante 10 horas diarias, pero en temporada de sembrío y cosecha contrata a  peones para que le puedan facilitar la extracción de su producto final.Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y  se compromete a cumplir puntualmente con sus respectivos pagos, además está eternamente agradecido con su grupo comunal, por la organización y solidaridad que muestran en el trabajo conjunto.Raúl tiene pensado  invertir el dinero solicitado en brindarle  mantenimiento adecuado a su terreno de cultivo , y para esto comprará abono y fertilizantes, con el propósito de mejorar la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Raul, 42 years old, lives with his partner and they have three small children. They live together in a community located at the edge of the Peruvian jungle, where they have their own home. Raul is a very demanding person. Considering that he lived with little money and convinced his wife to increase the size of their farm land, since they worked in small parcels and the money they were making from the sale of their products was not enough. Currently they produce a larger quantity of cacao and their profits have increased considerably. He still feel that there are many things to be accomplished in this life, and for this reason he is planning to buy more farmland in the future from other producers, with the goal of planting other products such as coffee and citrus fruit. He knows very well that he needs to move at a slow and secure pace, and works hard every day, takes good care of his crops so that they are not damaged by pests. He works together with his wife for 10 hours of every day. At planting and harvest times, he hires laborers to help him get his final product. This is a second loan with MFP and he commits to pay his installments on time. Also, he is eternally grateful to his community group for the organization and fellowship that they show in their team work. Raul is planning to use the loan money to provide adequate maintenance to his fields by buying manure and fertilizer with the purpose of improving the quality of his products.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and supplies for the care of his crops.

loans.name: Tehatsi Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama TEHATSI, porque en otomí significa “buenos días”. Está ubicado en el Estado D. México.  El grupo está conformado por  13 integrantes.

 La Sra. María Elva P. Ramírez  es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 23 años, estudió hasta el 6 año D. primaria, es comerciante  y tiene en total 2 hijos (1 mujer y 1 varón). Ella se dedica a la venta D. tortillas y costura que inició hace 9 años. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en maíz. Sus clientes son vecinos D. la localidad. Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta. Quiere este crédito para comprar maíz. También espera ayudar a su esposo con los gastos.

 Irma es, un integrante del grupo Tehatzi y esta foto fue tomada en su casa donD. tiene su taller, en la foto se ve las diferentes cruces que realiza pues ella se dedica a la venta D. cruces D. tronco D. árbol  que inició hace 4  años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar madera y poder realizar sus Artesanías. Sus clientes comentan que son artesanías muy bonitas, ellos se las compran y las venden en los semáforos del Estado D. Toluca.  
Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta.  Tiene 43 años, estudió hasta el 6 año D. primaria, es soltera y no tiene hijos. También espera que con sus ganancias,   Irma pueda ayudarle a su mama para la escuela D. sus 2 hermanos 

Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
- LETICIA M. M.      VENTA D. ROPA
- TOMASA R. Z.         COSTURAS
- IRMA M. O.          VENTA D. ARTESANIAS
- FRANCISCA R. Z.      VENTA D. PELUCHE
- JOSEFINA O. R.        VENTA D. TORTILLAS
- RUFINA Z. D. J.      VENTA D. DULCES
- HILARIA Z. G.     VENTA D. PELUCHES
- TERESA M. S.        VENTA D. RESINA
- ANGELINA R. Z.       COSTURA
- GLORIA F. G.        COSTURA
- EMILIA G. R.         VENTA TORTILLAS
- MARIA ATILIANO L.          VENTA D. RESINA.
texts.en:
This group is called TEHATSI, because in Otomí that means “good morning”. It is located in the state of México. The group is maD. up of 13 members. Mrs. María Elva P. Ramírez is the president of the group. She is 23 years old and she went to school until 6th graD.. She is a merchant and she has a total of 2 chilen (1 girl and 1 boy). She has sold tortillas and sewing for 9 years. She is asking for the loan to invest in corn. Her clients are the area residents. At this time, asking for the loan, she is content. She also hopes to help her husband with expenses. Irma is a member of the Tehatsi group and this photo was taken in her house where she has her workshop. In the photo the different crosses that she makes can be seen. She sells crosses maD. from tree trunks and she has been doing this for four years. She is asking for the loan to purchase wood to be able to make her artisan crafts. Her customers comment that they are very pretty. They buy them and sell them at streetlights in the state of Toluca. At this time, asking for the loan, she is content. She is 43 years old and has a 6th graD. education. She is single and has no children. Irma also opes that with her profits she can help her mother with her 2 brothers' schooling. The other members of the group are: - LETICIA M. M. CLOTHING SALES - TOMASA R. Z. SEWING - IRMA M. O. SELLING ARTISAN CRAFTS - FRANCISCA R. Z. SELLING STUFFED ANIMALS - JOSEFINA O. R. SELLING TORTILLAS - RUFINA Z. D. J. SELLING CANDY - HILARIA Z. G. SELLING STUFFED ANIMALS - TERESA M. S. SELLING RESIN - ANGELINA R. Z. SEWING - GLORIA F. G. SEWING - EMILIA G. R. SELLING TORTILLAS - MARIA ATILIANO L. SELLING RESIN

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and wood

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es: Benedicta, es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 50 años al igual que su esposo Javier, juntos tienen 4 hijos, pero sólo viven con uno de ellos en su casa propia. Pese a los diversos problemas familiares y económicos, encontró fuerzas para salir adelante, es por ello que hace mas de 3 años empezó con la venta de diversas variedades de refrescos y mates acompañados de sándwich de huevo, quesos y hamburguesas de pollo y carne; mientras que su esposo labora como chófer en moto taxi. De esa manera logran remunerar diariamente S/. 45.00 nuevos soles, con este ingreso cubre los gastos académicos de su último hijo, además puede solventar los gastos domésticos que tienen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es ofrecer los productos que comercializa y como estrategia de venta, ofrece degustación de sus platillos. Por ahora desea priorizar en la compra de productos comestibles y golosinas para abastecer su puesto de venta, ya que este trabajo lo realiza de manera ambulante, siendo los transeúntes sus principales compradores.  Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y siente que su progreso empezó desde que trabaja con los integrantes de su grupo comunal, a quienes respeta  y valora mucho, asimismo su participación es de manera activa. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará dulces, galletas, golosinas, además de bebidas gasificadas.
texts.en:
Benedicta is a hard-working woman who, like her husband Javier, is 50 years old. They have 4 children together, but only one still lives with them, in the house they own. Despite diverse family and financial problems, she found the strength to forge ahead. For this reason, three years ago, she started selling a variety of refreshments along with egg and cheese sandwiches and hamburgers. Meanwhile, her husband works as a moto-taxi driver. With these activities, they manage to bring in 45.00 Peruvian soles each day, and with this income they support the education of their youngest child and pay for their household expenses. The aspect she enjoys most about her work is selling her products. She offers samples of her food as a marketing strategy. For now, she wants to prioritize by purchasing edible products and sweets to supply her stand, since she conducts her business in an ambulatory manner. This is her sixth credit with MFP. She feels her progress began once she started working with the other members, who she respects and values a great deal. She is an active participant in the group. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy candy, cookies, sweets, and sodas.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food and candy to supply her stand.

loans.name: Christ Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
A. Mansah is forty-three years old. She is married to a farmer and has given birth to four children who are between the ages of eight and nineteen. Some of the children are still in basic school. 

A. M. is a hard-working trader. She is into fish-selling. She wants a loan to purchase cartons of fresh fish from wholesalers in bulk to scale up her business. A. has been in business for twelve years and dreams of owning a big cold store in the future. She also aspires to see her children reach higher levels in academia. 

A. M. is the leader of a trust bank group called 'Christ'. There are six members in this group. They are mainly petty traders and food vendors. The group requests the loan to procure goods in bulk to scale up their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase assorted fish in bulk

loans.name: Rosas Preciosas Group

texts.es:
ESTA BANCA D. EMPRENDIMIENTO SE DENOMINA ROSAS PRECIOSAS LA CUAL ESTA CONFORMADA POR 8 CLIENTES D. LAS CUALES 2 SON VARONES Y EL RESTO SON MUJERES INDEPENDIENTES,  ELLAS SE ORGANIZAN MEDIANTE UNA MESA DIRECTIVA  D. LAS CUALES SE DESTACAN LA PRESIDENTA  TESORERA Y SECRETARIA SOBRE LAS CUALES LLEGAMOS A CONFORMAR ESTA BANCA. 

LA PRESIDENTA, LA SRA. CRISTINA VIVE EN EL ALTO Y ES VENDEDORA D. COMIDA EN LA ZONA D. LA BALLIVIAN, TIENE MUCHAS ASPIRACIONES PARA SU NEGOCIO, ACTUALMENTE TIENE SU PUESTO, PERO QUISIERA AMPLIARLO Y ALQUILARSE UNA PENSION PARA ASI TENER MEJORES INGRESOS Y ,MEJORAR LA CALIDAD D. VIDA D. TODA SU FAMILIA. CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MESAS Y SILLAS PARA SU PUESTO D. VENTA.

LA TESORERA, LA SRA. ALICIA REALIZA VENTA D. MIEL OPTIENE SU PRODUCTO VIAJANDO A DIFERENTES REGIONES D. BOLIVIA Y LA COMERCIALIZA GENERALMENTE EN LAS FERIAS D. LA PAZ, ESTAN A SU CARGO DOS NIÑAS D. 12 Y 9 AÑOS D. EDAD,SU MAYOR SUEÑO ES LOGRAR QUE SUS HIJAS SEAN PROFESIONALES, ES UNA MUJER MUY LUCHADORA Y VALORABLE QUE NO SE DEJA VENCER.  

LA SECRETARIA D. ACTAS ES LA SRA. GUADALUPE  VIVE EN ANTICRETICO  EL LA ZONA D. BALLIVIAN, ES PRODUCTORA D. MEDICINA NATURAL, LA CUAL CONSISTE EN MATES, FOMENTOS, PARCHES, Y POMADAS, TODAS EN BASE A PLANTAS  TIENE DOS HIJOS Y SU ESPOSO LA APOYA  EN EL NEGOCIO, SU ANHELO MAS GRAND. ES TENER UN TECHO PROPIO POR ESO TRABAJA TANTO Y NECESITA EL CREDITO PARA VIAJAR A LA DESAGUADERO FRONTERA ENTRE BOLIVIA Y PERU PARA COMPRAR MERCADERIA YA QUE D. ESTE LUGAR SE PROVEE LA SRA. GUADALUPE.
texts.en:
The ROSAS PRECIOSAS community bank has 8 members, 2 men and the rest women. They organized themselves by means of a "mesa directiva", choosing a president, treasurer and secretary from among those who started the group. The president, Sra. CRISTINA, lives in El Alto and sells food in the Ballivian neighborhood. She is ambitious for her business. She only has a single stand now, but she wants to expand it and lease space so that she can increase her income and improve the lives of her family. She will use money from the loan to buy tables and chairs for her food stand. The treasurer, Sra. ALICIA sells honey. She buys her product from producers in various parts of Bolivia and sells it, generally, at markets in La Paz. She has two daughters, 12 and 9, and her greatest hope is to see them land professional careers. She is a courageous woman who strives hard to make sure nothing will hold her back. The secretary, Sra. GUADALUPE, lives in an "anticretico" (a lease-purchase arrangement common in Bolivia) in the Ballivian neighborhood. She makes natural medicines, patches, pomades, etc., all maD. from plants. She has two children and her husband helps her with the business. Her greatest wish is to build a covered structure for the business. She needs the loan to travel to Desaguadero on the Bolivian border with Peru where she buys the product that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sampson Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Dickmond is forty years old. He is married and has nine children who are between the ages of one and seventeen. Most of them are currently in school. Dickmond lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in their community. His wife has a business to help support their family. Dickmond is a storekeeper. He runs a grocery store by the roadside in the community. He has been in business for six years and dreams of growing his business to the level of supplying other provisions sellers.

Dickmond is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Sampson’. There are eight members in this group and they are traders. The members of Sampson group desire to expand their businesses and give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Arrangements for her life partner to upgrade his driver's license to drive a taxi

loans.name: Washington Agustin

texts.es:
Washington de 54 años, vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio de Guayaquil, su esposa es ama de casa, por la falta de oportunidades y la desesperante idea de tener su negocio Washington construyo en la parte delantera de su casa un local para la tienda que tanto había querido. 

Poco a poco con una vitrina y unos cuantos víveres empezó su tienda, trabajando diligentemente ahora tiene una tienda bien surtida trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 00h00pm, vende arroz, legumbres, verduras, frutas, cereales, etc. Para incrementar su tienda quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, azúcar y bebidas y asi asegurar el el futuro de su familia. 

En el futuro quiere que sus ventas aumenten.
texts.en:
Washington, 54 years of age, lives in an urban zone in the suburb of Guayaquil. His wife is a homemaker and, due to a lack of resources and his desperate idea of having a business, Washington built a site for the store he so wanted in the rear section of his home. Little by little, with a display case and a few products, he started his store. He worked diligently, and now has a well-stocked business where he works from 7 am selling rice, vegetables, fruits, cereals, etc. To grow his enterprise, he would like to take a loan to buy rice, sugar and beverages, so he can secure the future of his family and increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, beverages.

loans.name: Reina

texts.es: Reina , de 48 años, es casada y tiene siete hijos. Reside en la selva cuzqueña, en una pequeña comunidad,  donde tiene su casa que es propia .Desde muy joven se dedica al cultivo  de cacao, pues sus  padres vieron que era  responsable y le encargaron una chacra . Pero el sueldo que percibía por las ventas de los productos naturales , no le alcanzaban para tener una vida estable, y con el paso del tiempo ahorró dinero e instaló una tienda de abarrotes, en su comunidad. Desde entonces, tiene buenas ganancias económicas, y confia en salir adelante con los dos negocios que tiene(cultivo de cacao  y la tienda) para lograr mejorar la  calidad de vida de su familia .Y siempre cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo, quien la ayuda y le aconseja . Por lo general su esposo se hace cargo de las chacras, y  ocasionalmente recibe la ayuda de sus peones,durante el  tiempo de cosecha ; y Reina se hace cargo de la tienda . Por lo general el cacao (producto que cosecha) lo vende en los centros de acopio de su comunidad, y su plan a futuro es ampliar sus terrenos de cultivo con la finalidad de producir en mayor cantidad .Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y  se compromete a cumplir puntualmente con sus  pagos, además tiene buen concepto de su grupo comunal, por la responsabilidad y puntualidad que han demostrado  cada uno de sus integrantes.Reina tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de cantidad de  productos de primera necesidad, para  surtir su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Reina, 48 years of age, is married and has seven children. She lives in the jungle of Cusco, in a small community, where she has her own house. Since she was young, she dedicated herself to cultivating cacao as her parents saw that she was responsible and put her in charge of a small farm. However, the income she generated from selling this product wasn’t enough to provide financial stability. Over time, she saved her money and started a grocery store in her community. Since then, she has generated a good income and she is confident she can get ahead with her two endeavors (growing cacao and the store) and manage to achieve a higher standard of living for her family. She can always count on her husband, who helps and advises her. Generally, he is in charge of the farms along with occasional help from laborers at harvest time. In the meantime, Reina tends to the store. For the most part, they sell their cacao at the community’s supply centers. Their plan for the future is to expand their farmlands in order to increase production. This is her second loan with MFP, and she commits to making her payments on time. In addition, she is content with her cooperative since the members have demonstrated their responsibility and punctuality. Reina plans to invest the funds requested into buying basic necessities with which to supply her store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to supply her store.

loans.name: Alfredo Luis

texts.es: El Sr. Alfredo O. de 38 año de edad, es el sosten de su familia con 2 pequeños hijos, hace 2 años atrás fue cesado de sus funciones de la institucion en la cual trabajaba y aun teniendo formacion profesional le fue imposible conseguir un trabajo, motivo por el cual se vio a obligado a encontrar un sustento para su falia y comenzo a dedicarse a la comercializacion de carne de res, actividad en la cual le esta poniendo el 100% de su tiempo para lo cual requiere de un apoyo de capital de trabajo para poder incrementar sus ingresos, puesto que consiguio mercado el mismo que comenzo a demandar de su producto y no pudiendo acceder a la banca tradicional solita el credito KIVA por sus caracteristicas que son de mucha ayuda para el y su familia, y de este modo posionarse en el mercado y reacctivar su pequeña economia.
texts.en:
Alfredo O., 38 years of age, supports a family that includes 2 small children. He was let go by his employer two years ago and, despite having professional training, it was impossible for him to find new work. This was the reason why he saw himself obligated to find a new means of sustenance for his family, and he began to dedicate himself to raising cattle. He currently puts 100% if his time into this activity, which requires help via some working capital in order for him to increase his earnings. He is reaching out to KIVA, since he was unable to access credit through traditional banking avenues. This will allow him to position himself in the marketplace, and reactivate his small enterprise.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital (Purchase of Cattle)

loans.name: Felicidad De Emprender Group

texts.es:
LAS CLIENTES QUE PERTENECEN A LA BANCA FELICIDAD DE EMPRENDER, TIENEN LA CARACTERÍSTICA DE TENER UN MUY BUEN HUMOR, SE LA PASAN ALEGRES Y RIENDO YA QUE EL ESPACIO DE REUNION SE CONVIERTE EN UN ESPACIO DE ENCUENTRO EN EL QUE ELLAS SE OLVIDAN DE LOS PROBLEMAS POR LOS CUALES ATRAVIEZAN, POR ESO ES QUE ELIGIERON EL NOMBRE DE "FELICIDAD".

LA PRESIDENTA LA SRA. SILVIA ES UNA SEÑORA MUY ALEGRE QUE HA PASADO POR MUCHOS PROBLEMAS A LO LARGO DE SU VIDA, ES PAPÁ Y MAMÁ DE SUS DOS PEQUEÑOS QUE ESTAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, SOLA TIENE CUMPLIR LAS DOS FUNCIONES, ELLA SOLA MANTIENE EL HOGAR, TIENE UNA TIENDA DE MUEBLES EN LA FERIA  16 DE JULIO, LOS DIAS JUEVES Y DOMINGO, EL RESTO DE LA SEMANA SE DEDICA A LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE CELULARES A MEDIO USO LOS CUALES LOS REVENDE A MEJOR PRECIO, TIENE CASA PROPIA LA CUAL QUIERE HACER CONSTRUIR PARA VIVIR MEJOR, EL DINERO DEL CREDITO LO UTILIZARA EN LA COMPRA DE CELULARES AL POR MAYOR Y DESPUES VENDERLOS Y TENER MAS UTILIDAD Y ASI PODER MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE VIDA DE TODA SU FAMILIA. 

LA SEÑORA REBECA ES LA TESORERA, ES UNA CLIENTE JOVEN QUE ESTA FORMANDO SU HOGAR, AYUDA A SU TIA EN COSTURA DE PANTALONES Y C. ESTE PRIMER CREDITO COMPRARA TELAS PARA INDEPENDIZARSE EL ANHELO QUE ELLA TIENE ES LOGRAR UN TALLER DE COSTURA PROPIO.

TODAS LAS SOCIAS ESTAN AGRADECIDAS C. EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
The customers that belong to Emprender's FELICIDAD community bank share a characteristic: they are good humored. At their meetings, they tell jokes and laugh, the space where they meet becoming for them a place where they can forget their troubles. That's why they chose the name "Felicidad" (which means "happiness"). The president, Sra. SILVIA, is a happy woman who has had her share of life's problems. She is father and mother to her two children, both school age, and she fills both roles. She takes care of the house and operates a furniture business at the 16 de Julio market on Thursdays and Sundays. The rest of the week, she buys cell phones and sells them for a profit. She owns her own house and she wants to improve it. She will use the loan to buy wholesale supplies of cell phones that she will then resell. Her earnings will help her improve her family's quality of life. The treasurer, Sra. REBECA, is a young woman still making her own way in the world. She helps her aunt make trousers and she will use this loan to buy material so that she can set up her own business. She hopes to have her own tailoring shop one of these days. All the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have shown in extending these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Tlatoani Group

texts.es:
EL grupo del que vamos a platicar se llama “Tlatoani”, que significa guerreros pertenecen al poblado D. Tlayacapan, son 5 integrantes: Humberto Eduardo Martínez Rodríguez el venD. tamales y atoles, Anastasio D. L. R. Santamaría inicia negocio (venta D. revistas y periódicos), Antolina X. F., venta D. Artículos por Catalago (perfumes), Maria Elena O. M., (venta D. Elotes hervidos y esquites), Eutimio Gómez T., (servicio, Albañilería).

     Don tacho como le llaman los demás integrantes del grupo es D. quien vamos a platicar, cuenta con 63 años D. edad, el va a iniciar el negocio D. venta D. revistas y periódico, platica que en el barrio donD. el vive no hay quien tenga un puesto D. revistas, actualmente vive con su esposa L. Sra. Isabel Santamaría Nopaltlali, tienen 4 hijos: Arturo D. L. R. Santamaría D. 39 años, (casado), Macario D. L. R. Santamaría D. 29 años, (casado), Armando D. L. R. Santamaría D. 27 años, (casado), Carlos D. L. R. Santamaría D. 22 es el mas chico y también (casado)

Don Ignacio y su esposa, actualmente viven solos,  me hace mención que le gustaría  poco a poco agrandar su negocio nuevo, comenzar a crecer para poder tener algo mas estable, actualmente,  trabaja en el campo y por esta misma razón y por ser mayor D. edad,  cada día le es mas difícil conseguir donD. trabajar, por esto es  que necesita y desea crecer mas.

El esta contento D. haber obtenido L. oportunidad D. recibir este crédito y agradece D. antemano L. confianza que le otorgan para trabajarlo, gracias a  Kiva y Fundación Realidad,  seguir adelante,  si se pueD., mi esposa Isabel, también les agradece D. todo corazón su apoyo.
texts.en:
The group we are going to talk about is called “Tlatoani”, which means warriors, from a village called Tlayacapan. There are 5 members: Humberto Eduardo Martínez Rodríguez who sells tamales and maize drinks, Anastasio D. L. R. Santamaría who wants to start a business (magazines and newspapers), Antolina X. F., who sells catalog products (perfumes), Maria Elena O. M. (boiled corncobs and corn kernels), Eutimio Gómez T. (services, bricklaying). Don Tacho, as the other group members call him, is who we are going to talk about. He is 63 years old, and is going to start a business selling magazines and newspapers. He tells us that the neighborhood where he lives doesn’t have a magazine stand. Currently, he lives with his wife, Isabel Santamaría Nopaltlali, and they have 4 children: Arturo D. L. R. Santamaría, 39 years old (married), Macario D. L. R. Santamaría, 29 years old (married), Armando D. L. R. Santamaría, 27 yeards old (married), Carlos D. L. R. Santamaría, 22 years old, the youngest, and also married. Ignacio and his wife currently live alone, and he says he’d like me to mention that he wants to slowly grow his new business to have a more stable source of income. Currently, he works in the country and, since he is now older, it is more difficult every day for him to find work. This is why he needs this business, and to be able to grow it. He is happy to have been given the opportunity to receive this credit, and he gives thanks ahead of time for the confidence placed in him. Thanks to Kiva and Fundación Realidad he can try to get ahead. His wife Isabel also thanks you with all her heart for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase magazines and newspapers.

loans.name: Karel Eunice

texts.es:
Karel Eunice L. R., es una joven de  21 años, soltera, que termino sus estudios secundarios y a muy temprana edad comenzó a trabajar, para sustentarse por ella misma, labora como afanadora en la Dirección General de Aduanas de Nicaragua y por el momento desea comenzar sus estudios universitarios.

Una vez terminando los estudios, aplicar para un nuevo empleo o buscar una promoción en su trabajo que le permita un mejor desarrollo profesional  y económico, por el momento desea realizar una inversión en la compra de materiales de construcción y es para este fin que solicita un préstamo, para reparar el techo de su humilde casa, que en la actualidad se encuentra en una precaria situación, dificultando su diario vivir, amenazando con inseguridades  ante la delincuencia que habita en la zona donde radica, y más aun que la temporada de invierno se acerca, esta inversión le brindara mejores condiciones y comodidades de habitad que le aportaran un nivel de vida más digno.
texts.en:
Karel Eunice L. R. is a 21 year old young woman. She is single and a high school graduate. At a very young age, she began to work to support herself. She works as a cleaning lady in the General Office of Customs of Nicaragua. At this tme, she wishes to begin her university studies. After finishing her studies, she will apply for a new job or seek a promotion at her present job that will allow her better professional and economic development. At this time she wants to make an investment in purchasing construction materials. For this purpose, she is asking for a loan, to repair the roof on her humble home. At present, it is in a precarious condition. This makes daily life difficult, especially since winter is approaching. This investment will offer better living conditions which will afford her a more dignified quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the roof of her home

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, es una mujer luchadora y optimista, tiene 35 años, convive en su casa de su madre con Hilar de 38 años, juntos trabajan con mucho tesón para que su único Miguel de 11 años no le falte nada. Hace más de 20 años trabaja para brindarle una adecuada calidad de vida a su único hijo, por ello, durante el día vende helados y en las noches vende golosinas en pequeño puesto de venta, y lo hace de manera ambulante; mientras que su pareja labora como chofer de un moto taxi, vehículo que compraron con mucho esfuerzo. Con los ingresos que perciben ambos pueden cubrir los gastos domiciliarios y la educación de su hijo, asimismo están ahorrando para más adelante poder disponer del dinero en algún proyecto, como el de construir su vivienda propia, asimismo comprar otro moto carro que les genere mayores utilidades. Lo que más le gusta es atender a sus clientes de manera esmerada, sin embargo le desagrada tener que comercializar hasta altas horas de la noche, ya que le resulta cansado, pero vale la pena por que este negocio le es muy rentable y le hace vivir sin preocupaciones económicas. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de trabajar con su grupo comunal, donde recibe charlas educativas que le ayuda a disponer de manera adecuada el crédito que obtiene. Con los tres mil soles  que solicita, comprará otra moto carro, para alquilarlo a diario,  donde asegura que recibirá beneficios económicos.
texts.en:
Carmen, a fighter and an optimist, is 35 years old and lives in her mother's house with Hilar who is 38. Together they work with great determination so their only son, Miguel, will lack nothing. For more than 20 years she has worked to provide a good quality of life to her only son. To that end she sells ice cream during the day and sweets in the evenings from a small sales location and while walking around. Her partner works as a motorcycle taxi driver, using a vehicle he bought through a lot of effort. With the income they both earn they are able to cover the household expenses and the education of their son. At the same time they are saving for the future so they can use the money in a project such as building their own house or to buy another moto-vehicle that would help them earn greater income. What Carmen likes the most is attending to her clients in a careful manner. However, it bothers her to have to work until the late hours of the night, which is tiring, even though it is worth the effort since the business is profitable and allows them to live without economic worries. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she is very happy working with her communal group where she receives educational talks that help her carefully use the loans she receives. With this request for 3000 soles she will buy another moto-vehicle and rent it daily, which will assure them of benefiting economically.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a moto-vehicle

loans.name: Villa Mercedes Group

texts.es:
Banco D. Emprendimiento: VILLA MERCEDES  se encuentra ubicado en el Barrio Villa Mercedes, ubicado en la avenida El palmar, el B.E. esta en su 3er ciclo, compuesto por 11 personas, Se fundo el  16 D.  Octubre  del 2009, a iniciativa D. un grupo D. señoras.

Como PRESIDENTA tenemos a la señora Gabriela, TESORERA la  Sr. Solange y SECRETARIA la Sra. Maria del Rosario; en el grupo hay señoras que se dedican en  mayoría en la  venta D. cosméticos ,ropa ,comida ,  y otros. Las reuniones se llevan acabo los días viernes  a horas 11:00 AM en la casa D. la señora Gabriela. Los nuevos clientes que hemos captados, están conforme D. trabajar con Emprender debido a que dentro D. la capacitación del  B.E. VILLA MERCEDES  ,se les estableció una proyección D. sus ahorros a la finalización  del ciclo  en la cual  aprenderán a ahorrar  y compartir con sus amigas cada 14 días.

La Sra. GABRIELA (Presidenta) venD. D. cosméticos  D. manera ambulante, también desarrolla otro tipo actividad económica, como la venta D. asaditos, empanadas  en su domicilio y  en diferentes mercados populares. En el banco comunal ha aprendido a ahorrar, a quererse y valorarse como persona  se  siente útil con lo que le enseñan en las capacitaciones. El sueño D. la señora  Gabriela   es tener   un pequeño tinglado para su puesto  D. venta, y  progresar en la vida con su negocio con el dinero del credito comprara cosmeticos que se encuentran en promocion.

Todas las socias estan muy agradecidas con Emprender Y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The VILLA MERCEDES community bank is located in the the Villa Mercedes neighborhood on Avenida El Palmar. The community bank is in its 3rd round and has 11 members. It was started by a group of women and formally organized on October 16, 2009. For PRESIDENT, we have Sra. Gabriella, for TREASURER, Sr. Sonange and for SECRETARY, Sr. Maria del Rosario. The majority of the women in the group sell products such as cosmetics, clothes, food, etc. The group's meetings are scheduled for 11:00am on Fridays at Sra. Gabriella's house. Our new customers are pleased to work with us at Emprender because we have helped them to establish a savings program for the round whereby they will learn to save and meet with their fellow members every 14 days. Sra. GABRIELA (President) is a street vendor. She sells cosmetics, but she is also developing a business to sell "asaditos" (grilled meat) and empanadas from her house and at various local markets. The community bank has helped her learn to save. It's also helped her to believe in herself and appreciate her own worth. Gabriella's greatest wish is to build a small structure where she can operate her business. All the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have shown by extending these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gye Nyame Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Juliana is a women’s leader and a role model to most young women in her community. She is thirty-eight years, divorced, and the mother of three children from age 14-18 who are pursuing their education at high school level. She lives together with her children in a town close to MA..

Juliana is a food vendor who sells cooked rice and yams to customers in her community. Operating her trade for the past 16 years, Juliana has amassed good sales experience and made many loyal customers.  

Juliana is currently the leader of a trust bank group called "Gye Nyame," translated as "Except God" in the Twi language, made up of nine members. The other members are also engaged in trades such as food selling, hairdressing, grocery sales, used clothing sales etc. They are the major breadwinners of their respective families and are requesting a loan to support their businesses with the hopes of raising more income to support their families. Their common dream is to be financially self-sustaining and to be able to support their children through quality education.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients like rice, oil and spices in bulk

loans.name: Fredrick Ouma

texts.en:
Fredrick Ouma A. is a sugar cane farmer in Migori. Besides that, he is also a matatu driver on the Kisumu Migori route. Fredrick started farming in 2005, to help in sustaining his family. He is 32 years old, a husband and the father of two children. 

With a dream of buying a piece of land, where he will build his home and raise livestock for economic stability, Fredrick wishes to expand his business to be able to be able to save enough money.

He wishes to obtain a loan worth Ksh. 50,000, which will be used in the farming business.

loans.use: To expand his farming business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 28 años, convive con su actual pareja  y tienen dos hijos en edad escolar. Juntos residen en una comunidad , ubicada en la selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su casa que es propia .Sonia trabaja junto a su esposo, que es su socio ,juntos desde hace un tiempo se dedican a la producción y comercialización , de cacao y  hoja de coca,por esta actividad tienen buenas ganancias económicas que les permiten tener una buena calidad de vida. No siempre gozaron de prosperidad económica, en el pasado pasaron hambre,porque no les alcanzaba el dinero, pero juntos supieron salir adelante . En la actualidad tienen clientes potenciales, y les va bien en la comercialización de sus productos naturales  , debido al sacrificio constante , tanto de ella como de su esposo . Se siente orgullosa y feliz por todo lo que ha pasado, es por esta razón que cada mañana se dirige a sus chacras , para cuidarlas , por lo general trabaja junto a su esposo, pero en tiempo de cosecha contrata a  peones para que le agilicen la extracción del cacao y la hoja de coca, de manera eficiente. Normalmente vende sus productos a los centros de acopio de su comunidad. Su plan a futuro es instalar  una tienda de ropa, ya que en su comunidad existen pocas tiendas de este rubro, y calcula que obtendría buenas ganancias económicas .Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y se compromete a cumplir puntualmente con sus respectivos pagos, además le gusta participar activamente en su banco comunal , por la responsabilidad que tienen todos los integrantes.Tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en brindarle  mantenimiento a su chacra, adquiriendo fertilizantes y abono para sus respectivas plantaciones de cacao y  hoja de coca.
texts.en:
Sonia, 28, lives with her domestic partner and two children of school age. Together they reside in a community located in the Cuzco rain forest, where they own their house. Sonia works with her husband, who is her partner. For some time they have engaged in the production and marketing of cocoa and coca leaf. This activity produces good income that allows them to have a good quality of life. They haven't always enjoyed economic prosperity. There were times when they went hungry because they did not have enough money, but working together they were able to get ahead. Currently they have potential customers, and they are doing well in the marketing of natural products, due to the constant sacrifice of both her and her husband. She is proud and happy for everything that has happened. It is for this reason that every morning she goes to her farm, to care for it, usually working with her husband. At harvest time she has to hire laborers to expedite the efficient picking of cocoa and coca leaf. Normally, she sells the products to collection centers in her community. Her future plan is to install a clothing store, since there are few stores of this type in her community, and she calculates that it should produce a good income. This is her second loan with MFP, and she promises to comply promptly with her payments. Sonia also likes to participate actively in her communal bank, because responsibility is shared by all members. She plans to invest the money requested in providing maintenance for her farm, buying fertilizer and manure for their respective plantings of cacao and coca leaf.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MANURE AND FERTILIZER FOR HER FARM LAND

loans.name: Caleb Otieno

texts.en:
Caleb Otieno B. is a businessman who sells clothes in Migori, Kenya. It's a business he started in 2007, after having a Matatu (taxi) business, to help him generate income to support his family. With the nature of his business, Caleb travels to Nairobi every two weeks to buy his inventory. 

He wishes to expand his business to start selling clothes on wholesale, and it is for this reason that he is applying for a loan worth Ksh. 25,000 to increase his stock of clothing.

He is 30 years old, a husband and the father of three children.

loans.use: Increase inventory of clothing for sale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Reina De La Paz(Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal María Reina de la Paz se encuentra formado por once  socias que siempre están en la búsqueda de oportunidades día a día para mejorar la economía de su hogar y salir  adelante junto a su familia, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca localidad  ubicada a 2.500 metros de altitud sobre el nivel del mar y está asentada en un gran valle dentro de la cordillera de los andes. Está rodeada por cuatro  ríos que nacen en el  nudo del Cajas como son el Tomebamba,  Yanuncay,  Machángara y  Tarqui determinando espacios dentro de la ciudad  desde la existencia de  Guapondelig localidad  Cañari invitando a sus  residentes y visitantes a disfrutar de éstos majestuosos ríos y recrearse en ellos. 

Carmen A. con  37 años de edad,  divorciada hace seis a causa de infidelidad de su cónyuge es madre de cuatro hijos que se encuentran de 23, 18, 15, 13 años, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y ayudan económicamente tanto para los gastos del hogar como para el estudio de sus hijos menores que cursan la secundaria en un colegio de la ciudad, la casa en la que viven es arrendada y su sueño es llegar a tener su vivienda propia.
 
Carmen se dedica al comercio de  edredones, sábanas,manteles,  joyas etc., recorriendo las calles de la localidad dejando a crédito para captar  más clientes nos comenta que  antes laboraba en un bar de su propiedad pero debido a problemas en su salud tubo que dejar este negocio,  es nuestra socia hace cuatro años y los préstamos obtenidos ha invertido en su negocio, con el nuevo  crédito  comprará sábanas, edredones, manteles y algunas joyas para tener un stock suficiente para sus clientes y dar un buen servicio.

La señora  Luisa Solórzano es una socia carismática y con muchas ganas de crecer económicamente en su vida para ayudar a su familia, se encuentra en el  segundo ciclo trabajando con  su  bankito,  ella se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos  en casas ajenas  hace 8 años, labor que realiza  de lunes a viernes de 8 a.m. a  2 p.m. y  el resto del tiempo lo dedica a su familia  mientras que los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de  jugos, espumillas, granizados (hielo con colorantes de varios sabores y leche condensada) recorriendo su sector.
Su nuevo crédito invertirá en la compra de  azúcar, leche condensada, guayabas, conos, unas bandejas  y algo más que necesite para su negocio. Su meta es llegar a tener un bar para trabajar desde allí con su negocio y no tener que recorrer las calles de la urbe.

Luisa tiene 48 años  vive con su esposo que  no trabaja debido a su estado de salud pues sufre de insuficiencia renal y trombosis vascular  y sus cuatro hijos de  21, 19, 13, 11 años, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y  la  última hija estudia en una escuela de la ciudad. 
Viven arrendando porque no tienen casa propia
texts.en:
The María Reina de la Paz Communal Bank is comprised of 11 members who are always looking for daily opportunities to improve the economy of their households. They do this to get ahead with their families. They live in the city of Cuenca, which is 2,500 meters above sea level. It is situated in a great valley within the Andes mountain range. It is surrounded by four rivers; Tomebamba, Yanuncay, Machángara and Tarqui; that start at the Cajas junction. The rivers create spaces in the valley of Guapondelig in the town of Cañari. They invite its residents and visitors to enjoy the majestic rivers and to take pleasure in them. Carmen A., age 37, has been divorced for six years due to her spouse’s infidelity. She has four children; ages 23, 18, 15, and 13. Her first two children work and help economically with the household expenses. They also help with the educational expenses for the two younger children. The two younger children are in the city’s high school. The house they live in is rented, and her dream is to have her own house. Carmen sells comforters, sheets, tablecloths, and jewelry, etc. She sells along the streets of her area giving credit in order to get more customers. She tells us that she previously worked in a bar that she owned. But, due to health problems, she had to leave this business. She has been a member with us for four years. The loans she has received have been invested in her business. With the new loan she will buy sheets, comforters, tablecloths, and some jewelry. She will buy these things to have sufficient stock for her customers, and to give them good service. Luisa Solórzano is a charismatic member with a great desire to grow economically in order to help her family. She is in her second cycle of working with her bank. She has been doing domestic work in other people’s houses for eight years. She does this from Monday through Friday from 8 a.m. until 2 p.m. She spends the rest of her time devoted to her family. On the week-ends she sells juices, “espumillas” (a frothy drink made from beaten egg whites and fruit), and “granizados” (colored ice in various flavors with condensed milk). She sells these traveling her area. She will use the new loan to buy sugar, condensed milk, guavas, cones, some dishes, and other things she needs for her business. Her goal is to have a bar. She could work her business from there and not have to travel the streets of the city. Luisa, age 48, lives with her husband. He does not work due to the condition of his health. He has renal insufficiency and vascular thrombosis. Her four children are 21, 19, 13, and 11 years old. Her last daughter goes to a school in the city. Her first three children attend a different school. They live in a rented house because they do not have their own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheets, comforters, tablecloths, jewelry, sugar, condensed milk, guava, cones, and dishes

loans.name: Elida Angelica

texts.es:
Elida de 52 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, tiene tres hijos su esposo es vendedor. Ella comenzó como vendedora Yambal (compañía de venta de cosméticos por catalogo que ayuda a las mujeres del Ecuador a ser vendedoras potenciales con un porcentaje de ganancia). Por su perseverancia empezó a vender los productos a sus amigas, vecinos y conocidos. 

Poco a poco fue incrementando su numero de clientela pero con esfuerzo y dedicacion ella invitaba a sus amigas para que sean vendedoras, ahora tenia reuniones en su casa y explicaba un poco mas sobre Yambal, por ese gran trabajo que estaba realizando, Yambal la convirtió en Directora de su sector. Ahora ella tiene un grupo de vendedoras a su cargo, hacen reuniones en su casa para ver las fortalezas y debilidades que tienen al vender. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar perfumes y cremas para seguir vendiendo a sus clientes. En el futuro quiere seguir vendiendo productos Yambal y inscribir mas vendedoras para su grupo.
texts.en:
52-year old Elida lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil. She has three children, and her husband is a salesman. Elida also is in sales (for the cosmetics company Yambal which helps Ecuadorean women become sales agents by giving them a percentage of the profits they earn through catalog sales). She started out by selling the products to her friends, neighbours, and acquaintances. Gradually her client base grew, and she also encouraged her friends to become sales agents. She held meetings in her house and explained a bit about Yambal. Because of all this hard work and perseverance, Yambal made her director of her area. Now she is responsible for a group of saleswomen and holds meetings in her home to discuss the strengths and weaknesses of their sales techniques. With this loan Elida wants to buy perfumes and lotions to sell to her customers. Her future goal is to carry on selling Yambal products and enroll more saleswomen into her group.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy perfumes and lotions

loans.name: Vida Silvestre Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Vida Silvestre porque donde ellas se ubican hay un parque llamado así. Las cuatro personas que integran este grupo son; Andrea J. B., María Luisa Carmen Hernández L., Maura Gabriela O. Guzmán y Alma Leticia M. R..  Ellas viven en la comunidad de Ixtapaluca en el Estado de México. Andrea se dedica a la venta de postres y venta de zapatos por catalogo, María Luisa  a  ventas de colchas por catalogo, Maura Gabriela venta de zapatos por catalogo y Alma venta de cosméticos por catalogo. 

Andrea J. B. integrante del grupo de 52 años. Ella esta casada. Tiene cuatro hijos, dos de ellos siguen estudiando el nivel medio superior. Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo y venta de postres desde hace dos años cuando se vio en la necesidad de ayudar con los gastos de su familia ya que su esposo había quedado desempleado, desde entonces ella le tomo el gusto a las ventas hasta el día de hoy, diariamente ella prepara; gelatinas de leche y de agua, flanes, arroz c/leche, duraznos c/crema, fresas c/crema, diariamente tiene que transportar su mesa junto con unos banquitos y su hielera en el cual lleva sus postres, todo en un pequeño diablito, hasta el parque donde ella vende.

Con este crédito quiere comprar más productos básicos como; grenetina, vasos, moldes. Su meta para el futuro es poder darles una mejor vida a sus hijos. Con sus ganancias ella espera que sus hijos puedan ir a la universidad y poder tener su propio local y así poder  tener su mercancía en un lugar fijo.

Andrea se siente afortunada por el apoyo que recibe por parte de Kiva através  Fundación Realidad para poder hacer posible todas sus metas.
texts.en:
This group is called Vida Silvestre (Country Life) because they live next to a park with the same name. The four people in the group are Andrea J. B., María Luisa Carmen Hernández L., Maura Gabriela O. Guzmán, and Alma Leticia M. R.. They live in Ixtapaluca in Mexico. Andrea sells desserts and also shoes from a catalog; María Luisa sells bedspreads from a catalog; Maura Gabriela sells shoes from a catalog; and Alma sells cosmetics from a catalog. 52-year old group member Andrea J. B. is married and has four children, two of whom are in high school. She started her shoe and dessert businesses two years ago when she saw that she needed to help with household expenses since her husband was out of work. Then she started to enjoy selling and now, on a daily basis, she makes milk and regular jellies, caramel custards, rice pudding, peaches and cream, and strawberries and cream. Every day she has to take her table, some stools, and the cool box in which she transports the desserts, on a little cart to the park when she sets up her stall. With the loan Andrea wishes to buy more supplies such as unflavoured gelatine, glasses, and molds. Her goal is to provide a better life for her children in the future. With the money she earns she hopes that her children can go to university, and that she can obtain a permanent location from which to sell her products. Andrea feels very grateful for the help that she has received from Kiva through the Fundación Realidad to realise her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy catalogs, shoes, cosmetics etc

loans.name: Elsa Maria

texts.es:
La señora Elsa Maria M. es madre soltera de 2 hijos mayores de edad, que hace poco consiguieron un sustento de vida, de forma que apoyan a su madre en los gastos en los que ella incurre, ella tiene una pulpería desde hace 9 años los planes son dejarles el negocio a sus dos hijos como herencia para que tengan un sustento mas una vez que ella falte. Ella logro la apertura de su negocio gracias a su ex marido quien solicito un financiamiento con el objetivo de iniciar las operaciones de pulpería, le gusta tener su propio negocio ya qe disfruta de las comodidades de disponer de su tiempo para hacer las compras de su hogar, una mayor intercción con sus vecinos.

Uno de los principales problemas que tiene es la  variaciones de precios que afectan las ventas diarias, la razón por la cual solicita de un préstamo es para la compra de un mayor inventario de mercadería que le permita un aumento en el volumen de ventas, favoreciendo la economía familiar y la posibilidad de que su negocio  progrese día con día.
texts.en:
Señora Elsa Maria M. is the single mother of two adult children. A short time ago they started working at jobs of their own and so were able to help their mother cover her expenses. She has run a small grocery for nine years. Her plan is to leave her children this business so that they have another means of support once she is no longer around. Elsa managed to start the business thanks to her ex-husband who obtained a loan to run a grocery store. She enjoys owning her own business; she likes being able to organise her own time to do the shopping and to interact with her neighbours. One of her main problems is the price variation from her suppliers that affects her daily sales. The reason she is asking for a loan is so she can buy a wider variety of merchandise and thus increase sales This will improve her family’s economic situation and the future prospects of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy stock for her store

loans.name: Ciencia

texts.es: Ciencia, de 57 años, es viuda desde hace dos años, tiene 7 hijos pero sólo vive con dos de ellos en una casa alquilada en una localidad de Santa Ana. Su alegría desbordante hacen que todos las personas que la conocen, le tomen cariño, y valoren a la mujer trabajadora y luchadora que es, pues luego de la muerte de su esposo, se había dejado invadir por la pena y no sabía a donde ir, hasta que hace un año llegó a esta localidad  y empezó a plantar café, plátanos y palta, en terrenos que poseía. La belleza de los cultivos le ayudó a olvidar de su tierra natal y de la pena que la invadía, además cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos y vecinos. Lo que más le gusta es aplicar abono a sus plantaciones, porque sabe que tiene que cuidarlos muy bien para que den una cosecha productiva. Por ahora desea comprar más hectáreas de terreno agrícola y además de construir su vivienda, para que sus hijos se sientan seguros y tengan la tranquilidad que merecen. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y asegura que su palabra vale más que cualquier documento que pueda firmar, por lo que pagará la deuda sin retrasos, asimismo está entusiasmada de trabajar en su grupo comunal, donde todos la recibieron con los brazos abiertos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará quinientas plantas de café y sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Ciencia, age 57, has been a widow for the past two years. She has 7 children, but she lives with only two of them, in a rented house in a neighborhood of Santa Ana. Her exuberant happiness causes everyone who knows her to like her, and they appreciate her hard-working and determined nature. After her husband's death, she was overcome with sorrow and did not know where to go, until a year ago she arrived in this place and began growing coffee, bananas and avocados on lands she owns. The beauty of her fields helped her forget her original home and her sorrows, and she also received help from her children and neighbors. What she likes best is applying fertilizer to her fields, because she knows she must take very good care of them so they will produce a bountiful harvest. For the future, she would like to buy additional hectares of agricultural land and also construct a house, so that her children can feel secure and enjoy the tranquility they deserve. This is her first loan with MFP, and she assures us that her word means more than any paper she can sign, and she will make all of her payments without any delays. She is also very enthusiastic about working with her communal bank, where everyone received her with open arms. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy 500 coffee plants and some sacks of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying 500 coffee plants and some sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Ahomka Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 34-year-old woman who describes herself as simple.  She is married to a cocoa farmer and together they have four children between the ages of 6 and 15 years old.  Elizabeth and her husband hope to eventually own a home.  

For the past 8 years, Elizabeth has operated a business selling plantains and rice.  She will use the loan to buy 8 bags of rice to grow her business. She would like eventually to become the supplier for senior high schools in her area.  

Elizabeth is currently the leader of the trust bank group named "Ahomka".  "Ahomka" means “good for the soul” in Twi, the language most commonly spoken in Ghana.  Elizabeth believes she was elected group leader because she is a good organizer.  There are 7 members in this group.  The other group members are involved in trading and food processing.They hope to grow their businesses to enable them to provide much to their families.

loans.use: To purchase rice and plantains in bulk

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es: Fanny tiene 21 años, convive en casa de su madre, con Wilmer, su pareja, de 20 años y su pequeño hijo Jaime, de apenas un año y los dos comparten la iniciativa de salir adelante para tener una vida cómoda. Su empeño es sorprendente, pues a pesar de ser muy joven para ser madre, asume este rol con entereza y procura que su hijo no le falte nada. Es así que todas las mañanas vende patasca (una comida típica de su zona, que contiene trigo, carne), habas sancochado, chicharrones de cerdo y chicha, en un pequeño puesto que tiene, pero en las noches vende golosinas y dulces en una esquina del parque principal de Santa Ana. De esta manera ha logrado trabajar durante dos años y asegura que le resulta muy rentable, puesto que su objetivo es construir una casa en el terreno que les regalaron. Por otro lado su pareja se dedica a la carpintería, y de sus ganancias le ayuda a cubrir los gastos domésticos y de sus utilidades lo derivan al ahorro para cumplir con su objetivo. En adelante desea instalar una bodega grande que venda al por mayor y menor, además quiere vender comida porque le gusta cocinar. Este es primer crédito con MFP y agradece la confianza que le brinda los integrantes de su grupo comunal, que se caracterizan por ser personas responsables, trabajadores y solidarios. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mercadería (bebidas gasificadas, galletas, chicles, caramelos, dulces) para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Fanny is 21, and lives with her mother and Wilmer, her partner, 20 , and their young son, Jaime, who is just about one year. The two share the initiative to get ahead and have a comfortable life. Her goal is surprising because despite being so young to be a mother, she takes on the role with perserverance and makes sure that her son doesn't lack for anything. That is why every morning she sells “patasca”, a typical food of their area that is made with flour and meat), parboiled lima beans, fried pork skin and chicha (the typical Peruvian drink) in a small stand that she has. But at nights she sells candies and sweets on a corner of the main square of Santa Ana. This is how she has succeeded in working for two years and that her business is profitable, since her goal is to build a house with the land that they were given. On the other hand, her partner works in carpentry and his earnings help cover the household expenses and with his income, they are able to save to fulfill their goal. In the future she wants to build a large store so that she can sell both wholesale and retail. She would also like to sell prepared food because she likes to cook This is her first loan with MFP and she appreciates the trust that the members of the communal group have in her. They are considered to be responsible, hardworking and united people. With the loan that she is requesting she would like to buy items (carbonated drinks, cookies, gum, candies and sweets) to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Sonia Martha

texts.es:
Sonia I. de 24 años, vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, tiene dos hijos de 4 años y otro de 5 meses. Inicio con la tienda hace tres años para poder mantener a su hijo y ya no depender del dinero que el padre de sus hijos le daba. Empezó a vender enlatados, arroz, cereales afuera de su casa, a medida que pasaba el tiempo fue incrementando su negocio con viveres y vitrinas. 

Ahora ella trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 23h00pm todos los días, vende en su tienda arroz, vegetales, granos, bebidas, etc. Aunque Sonia trabaja sola sigue esforzándose para sus hijos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, bebidas para su tienda. 

En el futuro quiere que su negocio crezca y pasarlo a manos de su hijos.
texts.en:
Sonia I., 24, lives in the outskirts of Guayaquil. She has two children: one is 4 years old and the other is 5 months old. Three years ago she started a store so that she could support her son, and no longer depend on the money that the father of her child gave her. She started to sell canned goods, rice, and cereals outside her home. Over time she expanded her business with groceries and glass display cases. Now she works from 7am until 11pm every day. From her store she sells rice, vegetables, grains, drinks, etc. Although Sonia works alone, she continues to exert herself for her children. With the loan she will buy rice, sugar, and drinks for her store. In the future she wants to see her business grow so that she can pass it down to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and canned goods

loans.name: Ahene Mu Hene Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Simon is a cabbage seller who describes himself as hard-working.  He is 38 years old and is married with 5 children between the ages of 2 and 18 years old.  Simon would like to provide his children with a quality future.

Simon has been involved in cabbage selling for the past 5 years.  He will use the loan to purchase more vegetables.  He would like to expand his business so that he not only sells cabbage, but other vegetables as well.  

Simon is currently the leader of the trust bank group named "Ahene Mu Hene", which means “King of Kings” in Twi, the language most commonly spoken in Ghana.  There are 6 members in this group.  The other group members are engaged in selling foodstuff, cosmetics and groceries.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda tiene 43 años, está casada con Rolando de 46 años, ambos tienen 3 hijos y viven en su acogedora vivienda propia, ubicado en una zona comercial de la ciudad de Santa Ana. Su oficio es preparar caldo de gallina (gallina sancochada en trozos con papa, verduras y fideos); panqueques, café y diferentes comidas de la zona que son muy solicitados por sus exigentes comensales.  Por otro lado su esposo trabaja en el transporte público, teniendo como vehículo su moto carro. De esa manera, ambos pueden cubrir con los gastos domiciliarios, la educación de sus hijos y sus necesidades. Ya son 23 años vendiendo comida durante todas las noches en un puesto ambulante, cerca de un paradero de buses, además tiene 3 motocarros que alquila a terceras personas, con todas estas ganancias vive cómodamente, y como ella es una mujer de negocios, quiere instalar un bar en su vivienda. Su mayor anhelo es tener una pollería, en donde lo administraría junto a su esposo e hijos. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y se muestra muy entusiasmada por pertenecer a un grupo comunal muy bien organizado, además está atenta a las decisiones que acuerdan los integrantes de su grupo. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará bebidas gasificadas y algunas golosinas.
texts.en:
Hilda, 43, is married to Rolando, 46, and they have 3 children. They live together in a cozy home that they own, located in a commercial neighborhood of the city of Santa Ana. Her occupation is preparing "caldo de gallina" (chicken boiled in pieces with potatoes, vegetables and noodles), pancakes, coffee and various foods of the area that are much sought after by discerning diners. Her husband, on the other hand, works in public transportation using a motocar (light 3-wheeled passenger vehicle) that he owns. In this way, together they can cover the household expenses and pay for the education and basic needs of their children. She has 23 years of experience selling food in the evenings from a food cart that she positions near a bus stop. In addition, she has 3 motocars that they rent to third parties, and with all of these sources of income they live comfortably. As she is a businesswoman, she wants to set up a bar in her home. Her main wish is to have a pollería (chicken restaurant), that she could run along with her husband and sons. This is the first time that she has had a loan from MFP, and she is very enthusiastic about belonging to a communal group that is so well organized. In addition, she pays attention to the decisions made by the members of her group. With the loan requested, she will buy soft drinks and some snacks.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and snacks

loans.name: El Retoño 2009 Group

texts.es:
Banco de Emprendimiento: RETOÑO 2009  se encuentra ubicado en el Barrio Palmira, ubicado en la avenida Las Ameritas , el B.E. esta en su 2do  ciclo, compuesto por 10 personas, Se fundo el  17 de  Noviembre  del 2009, a iniciativa de un grupo de señoras, 

Como PRESIDENTA tenemos a la Señora Yina , TESORERA la  Sr. Yorgina y SECRETARIA la Sra. Mónica, en el grupo hay señoras que se dedican en  mayoría en la  venta de cosméticos ,ropa ,comida ,abarrote , costurera, transportista, y otros. Las reuniones se llevan acabo los días miércoles   a horas 14:00 PM en la casa de la señora Yina. Los nuevos clientes que hemos captados ,están conforme de trabajar con Emprender debido a que dentro de la capacitación del  B.E. RETOÑO 2009  ,se les estableció una proyección de sus ahorros a la finalización  del ciclo  en la cual  aprenderán a ahorrar  y compartir con sus amigas cada 14 días.

La Sra. YINA (Presidenta) vende de cosméticos  de manera ambulante, también desarrolla otro tipo actividad económica, como la venta de joyas por catalogo, también de manera ambulante en la zona en donde vive y  de   en diferentes mercados populares. En el banco comunal ha aprendido a ahorrar, a quererse y valorarse como persona  se  siente útil con lo que le enseñan en las capacitaciones. El sueño de la señora  Yina  es tener   una vitrina  para la exposición de sus joyas y cosméticos y  progresar en la vida con su negocio.

Todas las socias estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Retoño 2009 Communal Bank is located on Avenida Las Ameritas in the neighborhood of Palmira. The communal bank is in its second loan cycle, and is made up of 10 individuals. The bank was founded by a group of women on November 17, 2009. The communal bank’s president is Yina, the treasurer is Yorgina, and the secretary is Mónica. Most of the women in the group make a living selling cosmetics, clothing, food, or groceries; working as seamstresses; providing transportation; or in other activities. The group meets at 2:00 PM on Tuesdays at Yina’s house.
