Facing the different obstacles that present themselves in life, she decided to start producing and selling cacao. Every day she is improving her sales. She is aware that she needs to increase her production and the quality of her products. That is why she always takes care of her crops. She generally works from seven in the morning until six in the evening. She almost always receives help from her husband. But, during planting or harvesting season she hires laborers to help extract her products in an efficient manner. Her plan for the future is to get a greater quantity of fields in order to produce in large volumes. She knows very well that coffee is a product that is sought after on a national and international level. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she pledges to keep making her payments punctually. Also, she says that she feels satisfied because her communal bank works with responsibility. She will use the money to provide adequate maintenance to her coffee crop. She will buy fertilizer and supplies to improve the quality of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy natural and chemical fertilizers to take care of her crops

loans.name: Josecito De Cumbe( Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Josecito de Cumbe esta formado por mujeres luchadoras, alegres y carismáticas que buscan día a día la manera de salir adelante con sus familias,  viven en la parroquia  del mismo nombre de su banco comunal  ubicada al sur del cantón Cuenca. Cumbe tiene una extensión de 71,4 km²; representa el 2,3 por ciento del territorio cantonal está localizado a una distancia de 24 km desde la ciudad de Cuenca, conectada por la vía asfaltada Cuenca-Loja. Entre sus actividades sobresale la agricultura  que la realizan la gente mayor o mujeres pues el resto de la  población diariamente salen  a Cuenca donde realizan diferentes actividades económicas como: obreros de fábricas, elaboración de artesanías, empleados en actividades de comercio, servicios y principalmente como trabajadores de la construcción.

La señora Teresa G. con 41 años vive en la parroquia  Cumbe con su esposo que trabaja en la construcción y sus seis hijos que oscilan entre los 20 y 3 años, sus tres primeros hijos cursan la educación secundaria y los otros dos la primaria en instituciones de la localidad, mientras que el más pequeño pasa con ella todo el tiempo, la vivienda que habitan es prestado por un hermano hasta que puedan  tener su casa propia para tranquilidad de toda la familia.

Teresa se dedica a la cría cuyes y  pollos que son de pronto crecimiento tanto para la venta como para el consumo en su hogar, es nuestra socia  hace dos ciclos y con su  nuevo crédito comprará más crías de  pollos, cuyes  y alimento para su crianza.

María Sarbelia  C.  tiene 51 años de edad y es una socia  muy alegre y carismática del grupo, este es su  segundo crédito que lo va a invertir en la compra  crías de pollos y alimento para incrementar su criadero de animales actividad a la que  se dedica hace mucho tiempo, también tiene una vaca lechera y su producción la vende en su comunidad.

Nuestra socia  vive en la parroquia  Cumbe con su esposo y cuatro de los cinco hijos que concibió pues la tercera hija se caso y vive independiente, dos de sus hijos  trabajan y ayudan  económicamente con los gastos de  la  casa y los estudios de la ultima hija que estudia en un colegio de la localidad,  mientras que la  segunda hija no trabaja pero le  ayuda en los quehaceres del hogar.

Su meta es incrementar más animales a su corral.
texts.en:
The Josecito de Cumbe Communal Bank is comprised of tenacious, happy, and charismatic women. Day to day they look for the way to get ahead with their families. They live in the parish with the same name as their communal bank. It is located to the south of the Cuenca canton. Cumbe has an area of 71.4 square kilometers and represents 2.3 percent of the territory of the canton. It is 24 kilometers from the city of Cuenca, and it is connected by the asphalt road, Cuenca-Loja. Among its activities, farming stands out. Older people and women farm, and the rest of the population goes to Cuenca everyday to do different economic activities like working in factories, making handicrafts, or being employees in commerce. Some provide services, primarily as construction workers. Teresa G. is 41 years old. She lives in the Cumbe parish with her husband, a construction worker, and their six children. The children’s ages range from 20 to 3 years old. Her first three children are in high school. The other two are in elementary school in the area. The youngest is with her all the time. The house where they live is lent to them by a brother. This is until they are able to have their own home, which will give the entire family tranquility. Teresa raises guinea pigs and chickens, and they grow rapidly. They are for sale as much as for household consumption. She has had two cycles. With her new loan she will buy more chickens, guinea pigs, and food for them. María Sarbelia C., age 51, is a very happy and charismatic member of the group. This is her second loan. She will buy baby chickens and food to enlarge her animal farm. She has been doing this for a long time. She also has a dairy cow, and she sells her production in her community. She lives in the Cumbe parish with her husband and four of their five children. The third daughter got married and lives independently. Two of her children work and help economically with the household expenses. They also help with the educational expenses of her last daughter, who goes to the local school. Her second daughter does not work, but she helps with the household chores. Her goal is to have more animals in her farmyard.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy baby chickens, guinea pigs, and food to enlarge her animal farm

loans.name: Natalie

texts.es: Natalie V. S., tiene la edad de 22 años, está soltera, y vive con sus padres y hermanos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de una motocicleta. La idea es tener un medio de transporte que le permita movilizarse hacia su trabajo y así poder llegar a tiempo al trabajo y poder lograr tener una estabilidad laboral. Ella cuenta con experiencia necesaria para conducir la moto. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Natalie espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona, además de poder alcanzar el logro de sus metas y proyectos.
texts.en:
Natalie V. Sanchez is 22 years old, single, and lives with her parents and siblings. She wants this loan to buy a motorcycle. Her idea is to have a means of transportation that allows her to get to work on time, so that she can hold a stable job. She already has the driving experience necessary for operating a motorcycle, This is the first time she has gotten a loan with FUDECOSUR [the Kiva field partner] and she is very happy with the services they have offered her. In the future, Natalie hopes to offer her family a better standard of living and more financial stability. She hopes to continue growing as a person and to finish the goals and projects she's set for herself.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un padre de familia de 39 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el sector Señor de los Milagros, ubicado en el distrito de Olmos, una zona caracterizada por tener a la mayor parte de su población dispersa en zonas rurales que distan mucho una de la otra, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la elaboración y venta de pan y de diversos productos como empanadas, galletas, rosquitas, entre otros, para lo cual cuenta con un horno artesanal instalado en su domicilio, además de diversos artefactos que le facilitan el proceso (como la mezcladora que nos muestra en la fotografía), los productos que fabrica los vende en su domicilio y debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando y a la calidad con la que los prepara cuenta con una clientela fija que siempre acude a su negocio.

Juan desea captar mas clientes de modo que pueda incrementar sus ventas y percibir mas ganancias con las cuales sacar adelante a su familia, por ello desea adquirir mas insumos que le permitan producir mas pan. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Juan es un hombre honrado y trabajador, su mayor anhelo es poder distribuir sus productos en diversos puntos de la ciudad y del distrito. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Juan, age 39, lives with his family in the Señor de Milargros area, which is located in the Olmos district. This area is noted for having the greatest part of its population spread out in rural zones that are far from each other. It belongs to the Lambayeque province, which is one hour and forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For over five years he has been making and selling bread and various products like empanadas, cookies, and “rosquitas” (thin crusted breads in curved shapes), among other things. To do this he has a handmade oven in his home in addition to various devises that facilitate the process (like the mixer he shows us in the photograph). He sells the products that he makes in his home. Due to the time he spends working and the quality that he uses to prepare his products, he has fixed customers who always come to his business. Juan wants to get more customers so that he can increase his sales and get more earnings. With the earnings he will get his family ahead. That is why he wants to get more supplies that will allow him to make more bread. To achieve this objective, he has seen the need to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 2,000 PEN. Juan is an honest and hard-working man. His biggest desire is to be able to distribute his products to diverse places in the city and the district. He has already previously worked with our institution. He has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with his repayment obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to make bread

loans.name: Lenin Antonio

texts.es:
La fabricación y venta  en punto comercial de monederos, llaveros, correas, bolsos y billeteras en cuero y en cuerina,(tal como aparece en la foto en su punto de venta), conforman  el día a día de  Lenin Antonio Álvarez  Jiménez  de  48 años, residente  en la Ciudadela 20 de Julio, un barrio lleno de negocios y de muchos conjuntos multifamiliares, muy cerca al estadio Metropolitano de Barranquilla, cuna del futbol de Colombia. Él es casado y tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 18 años de edad, familia que lo impulsa a trabajar con dedicación para sacarla adelante.
Lenin Inició su negocio en el año 1995 después de ser por muchos años vendedor en una empresa y de un aprendizaje constante en el  arte de fabricar artículos de cuero, que gradualmente ha ido perfeccionando y le han permitido fortalecer su negocio, ubicado en un espacio de su casa y  en un punto de venta muy comercial,  allí  trabajan su esposa y sus hijos en su tiempo libre. Sus horarios de trabajo  son extensos porque desde la 5:00 A.m. están dedicados a la fabricación en su pequeño taller de su casa y desde las  2:00 P.m. a 9:00 P.m. de lunes a domingo se encuentran en su punto de comercialización,  ubicado en los alrededores de Metro centro, uno de los centros comerciales mas importante del sur de Barranquilla;  la competencia en su área de acción no es mucha,  pues solo él vende a negocios que están en estos alrededores al por mayor  y  también tiene un punto de venta donde vende al detal. 
Este es su cuarto crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y requiere $ 1.300.000 para comprar  al por mayor cuero, similares al cuero y accesorios que adornan su producto terminado, en una  nueva línea que sacará al mercado;  con sus  financiamientos anteriores ha logrado  hacer mejoras locativas  en el espacio físico de sus vivienda para ubicar mejor sus maquinarias y adecuar el techo, el piso y las paredes de su espacio productivo; así mismo con este capital adicional ha incrementar su producción y fortalecer la comercialización con su punto de ventas. Su sueño inmediato es comprar una máquina troqueladora, pues  actualmente alquila este servicio y además seguir educando a sus hijos que aun estudian, la carrera de ingeniería  y el  bachillerato respectivamente.
texts.en:
Lenin Antonio A. Jimenez spends his day-to-day life in the production and commercial sale of change purses, key rings, belts, purses, and wallets made of leather and leather-like material (shown in the photo above). He is 48 years old, a resident of neighborhood 20 in Julio, a place full of businesses and families that is very close to the big city of Barranquilla, the center of soccer in Columbia. Lenin is married and has two children, of ages 15 and 18. His family is dedicated to working hard so that they can achieve a better life. Lenin started his business in 1995 after many years of working as a salesman for another business, an apprenticeship he endured to learn the art of making leather products, during which he slowly perfected his trade and strengthened his business skills. He works near his house in a busy commercial district so that his wife and children can also work in their free time. Their work schedules are extensive, starting production in their small home workshop at 5:00 am, and then selling their products from 2:00 pm to 9:00 pm on Mondays through Sundays. They are located near the metropolitan area in one of the biggest, most important commercial districts south of Barranquilla. There is not a lot of competition in the area, so Lenin sells to retailers at wholesale and also has a shop where he sells retail. This will be his fourth loan with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo and he needs 1.300.000 to buy wholesale products including leather, other leather material, and accessories to decorate his final products, in a new line that he will bring to the market. His previous loans allowed his home and business to be better located, with a ceiling, a floor, and walls for appropriate for a production space. Likewise, with this loan, he will increase production and strengthen his sales. His short-term dream is to buy a stamping machine so that he can rent it out and be able to educate his children, as they would like to study engineering and get their high school diplomas.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Heyd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase leather, leather products, and accessories to decorate his final products at wholesale

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel M. L., tiene la edad de 54 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa y tres hijos, de 28,27 y 8 años de edad, ellos son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de herramienta. para los trabajadores que tiene a su cargo. La idea es facilitarle el trabajo a los trabajadores en la construcción.Don Manuel tiene varios años de dedicarse a la construcción. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Manuel espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona, además de poder alcanzar sus metas y proyectos.
texts.en:
Manuel M. L. is 54 years old, and he is married. He lives with his wife and their three children; 28, 27, and 8 years old. They are his greatest priority. He wants the loan to buy tools for the workers he is in charge of. Manuel has been working in construction for several years. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with the terms of the loan. In the future Manuel hopes to give his family a better quality of life and greater economic stability. He also wants to be able to keep growing as a person and to reach his goals and complete his projects.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools for work

loans.name: Eudosia

texts.es: Eudosia, de 29 años, vive con su conviviente y tiene dos hijos pequeños.Juntos viven en una pequeña localidad ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tienen su casa que es propia y esta echa a base de madera.Eudosia siempre ha priorizado la calidad  de sus productos agrícolas. Siembra cacao , y se preocupa porque sea de calidad , y siempre esta  introduciendo nuevas técnicas de cultivo .De muy joven sus padres le ofrecieron un pequeño terreno donde pudiera  labrar la tierra y sembrar, pero gracias a la ayuda de su pareja sacaron real provecho de la tierra, a su vez era realista que con un pequeño terreno de cultivo no iba lograr cubrir las necesidades  familiares. En la actualidad  tiene un terreno de cultivo más grande y también ha mejorado las ventas de sus porductos con respecto a otras épocas . Eudosia reconoce que  ha dado el primer paso para lograr el éxito y aspira en expandir su cacao  en zonas estratégicas, para obtener mayores ganancias. Por lo general vende sus productos en los grandes centros de acopio de su  localidad, y la  mayor parte del tiempo comparte labores con su esposo, pero en tiempo  de siembra o cosecha contrata la ayuda de peones que le facilitan el trabajo.Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, y asegura cumplirá  responsablemente con los pagos de sus cuotas , además agradece a su banco comunal por la solidaridad que existe entre todos los integrantes.Eudosia tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de terrenos de cultivo, con el propósito de seguir aumentando su productividad .
texts.en:
Eudosia is 29 years old, lives with her husband, and has 2 small children. Together they live in a small village located in the beautiful rainforest town of Ayacucho where they have their own house on a wood foundation. Eudosia has always placed a high priority on the quality of her agricultural products. She grows cocoa beans and stays busy with this responsibility and frequently tries out new methods of agriculture. From a young age, her parents offered her a small piece of land where she could experiment and grow products. Now thanks to the help of her husband, she now gets a lot out of her land, whereas before she could not realistically grow enough to cover the needs of her family. Currently, she has a bigger piece of land and has improved her sales from the past. Eudosia recognizes that she has been given the first step toward achieving success and she aspires to expand her cocoa bean sales to strategic places that will earn her more profits. In general, she sells her products by the bunch in the central market of her town. For the most part, she works with her husband, but during the sowing and harvesting season, she hires laborers to help with the work. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she promises that she will responsibly make all of her payments. Moreover, she appreciates the partnership with the community bank that is there for all community members. Eudosia plans to invest her money in the purchase of more agricultural land with the intent to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Heyd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more agricultural land

loans.name: Yaqueline

texts.es:
La vida de Yaqueline B. Iquinás de 27 años, transcurre entre su trabajo como emprendedora  artesana que elabora a mano, pulseras cinturones, collares y llaveros  y la atención de su familia especialmente de sus tres pequeños hijos, ella es casada y vive en la ciudad de Bogotá. 

Yaqueline proveniente de Neiva donde aprendió e inició el negocio de la bisutería en el año 2002, se instaló en la Ciudad capital de Colombia, ayudada por su hermana quien la promocionó en su arte, mediante referidos con los cual empezó a vender al por mayor en el centro de Bogotá: aretes envejecidos, para luego desde su casa en el barrio Galán designar una habitación como taller de trabajo donde aun elabora hermosos accesorios manuales que vende en espacios comerciales especialmente en Metrocentro.

 Como Yaqueline  conoce perfectamente la forma de hacer un trabajo en  las técnica  de dibujo  llamada pirograbado, quiere fortalecer su negocio agregando valor a su arte, y no tiene la herramienta eléctrica o pirograbador para hacerlo,  está solicitando a  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo un crédito para comprar su pirograbador eléctrico que mejora la calidad del acabado  de sus producto y también quiere invertir en   materias primas  como pedrería para elaborar  sus pulseras y collares;  con esta herramienta sus productos generarán mayor impacto porque consigue intensidades en el quemado variando las tonalidades  del producto. 
  
Su meta para el 2011 es tener diseños innovadores y posicionarse en el mercado nacional especialmente en  las ciudades costeras de Santa Marta y Cartagena, famosas para  los turistas extranjeros por los encantos del comercio de  artesanías y los hermosos paisajes de Colombia.

Su gran desafío es el sacrificio relacionado con el excesivo tiempo que debe dedicar al negocio  que cada día aumenta al tener que hacerlo manual y no encontrar al personal idóneo o mano de obra calificada para hacerlo.
texts.en:
Yaqueline comes from Neiva where she learned and started the business of jewelry in the year 2002. She established herself in the capital city of Columbia through the help of her brother who was in the industry and referred her to places that sold materials wholesale in downtown Bogota, including vintage earrings. Then she made her home in the Galan neighborhood and started her workshop where she now makes beautiful handmade accessories that she sells in the commercial district, especially downtown. Because Yaqueline has perfected the technical skills of sepia tone sketching made though burning paper, she wants to strengthen her sales by increasing the value of the art, but she does not have a electronic machine to do it with. She would like this loan from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo to buy an electronic machine to make these drawings so that they will be higher quality and to invest in basic materials for her bracelets and necklaces. With this tool, her products will make a bigger impression on customers for their higher quality through various intensities of burning that create different tones on paper. Her goal for 2011 is to have innovative designs and to expand to the national marketplace, especially in the costal cities of Santa Maria and Cartagena, famous to foreigners for the friendly craftspeople and beautiful landscape of Columbia. Her biggest challenge is the family time sacrifice because she has to spend a lot of time doing her business, which increases each day because she makes the products by hand herself and she has not yet found the right person or tool to make quality products for her.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Heyd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a paper burning machine and to invest in basic materials for her handmade crafts, including bracelets and necklaces

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel tiene 36 años, es un hombre honesto y trabajador, está casado con Elizabeth y juntos tiene 2 hijos con quienes viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en la selva central del Perú. Es una persona muy enérgica y trabajadora, por algo no le dice “mil oficios”, ya que desempeña con bastante responsabilidad la actividad de la agricultura, construcción e incluso en sus ratos libres, realiza el transporte publico en su moto carro. Son 12 años que viene trabajando de esa manera, por otro lado su esposa le ayuda en el cuidado de los cafetales y platanales. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es ver siempre limpios sus terrenos, sin embargo para conseguirlo, le cuesta mucho retirar la maleza de dichas plantaciones. Refiere además que su mayor anhelo es construir su casa en un terreno que ya tiene disponible, asimismo desea continuar produciendo en cantidad y calidad. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y asegura que le gusta trabajar con su grupo comunal, porque se siente en familia, ya que los integrantes son muy unidos y responsables, además le enseñan a valorar su oficio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono para cuidar sus cultivos, de esa manera evitará que sean atacadas por las plagas o por las variaciones climáticas.
texts.en:
Samuel is 36 years old, an honest hard-working man, married to Elizabeth. Together they have 2 children with whom they live in a rented house located in the central rain forest of Peru. He is a very energetic and hard-working person (it's not for nothing they say “1,000 skills”), since he performs with great responsibility the activities of agriculture, construction, and even in his free time, public transport with his motorcycle-taxi. Samuel has been working like this for 12 years. And in addition, his wife helps by caring for their coffee and plantain trees. What Samuel likes best is to see his land always well cared for. But to achieve this, requires much effort clearing weeds from the fields. His greatest hope is to construct his own house on land he owns. Also, he wishes to continue growing quality produce in quantity. This is his 2nd loan with MFP and he assures us that he likes working with his communal group because it feels like family, since the members are very united and responsible. In addition, they teach him to value his professions. With this loan he will buy various sacks of manure to care for his crops and, in this manner, avoid attacks by diseases and climate variations.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING SACKS OF MANURE FOR HIS COFFEE AND PLANTAIN TREES

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bales of second-hand T-shirts, adult pants, towels and children's clothing

loans.name: Alton Fernando

texts.es:
El  microempresario: Alton Fernando N. H. tiene 77 años de edad es casado con 10 hijos todos mayores de edad, vive con su esposa y desde hace más de 20 años se dedica a la venta de queso y otros productos lácteos. Este producto lo compra en el departamento de Chontales que es donde se consigue mas barato  y parte lo entrega por encargo y otra parte lo vende en su negocio ubicado en el mercado municipal de esta ciudad de Bluefields.

El señor N. ya fue beneficiado con un primer préstamo el cual utilizo para comprar productos lácteos, este préstamo ya fue cancelado en tiempo y forma desde hace un año aproximadamente.

El microempresario N. tiene un tramo en el mercado municipal de esta ciudad de Bluefields, sin embargo dicho tramo se encuentra en mal estado por lo que ya a sido victima de robos, por tal razón esta solicitando financiamiento para reconstruirlo y poder garantizarle seguridad al mismo.

Necesita comprar los siguientes materiales de construcción: 

Diez bolsas de cemento a US 12.00 dólares cada bolsa, dos unidades de playcem de 2x4 a  US 25.00 dólares cada unidad, dos quintales de varillas de hierro de 3/8 a US 10.00 dólares cada quintal, dos quintales de  varillas de hierro de1/4 a US 10.00 dólares cada quintal, cuatro unidades de playcem de 4/8 a US 16 dólares cada unidad y cuatro metros de arena a US 31.50 cada metro.
texts.en:
Micro-businessman Alton Fernando N. H. is 77 years old, is married, and has 10 adult children. He lives with his wife and for more than 20 years has sold cheese and other dairy products. He buys these products in Chontales Department, which is where they are cheapest. He delivers some that have been pre-ordered and sells some at his business located in the municipal market of the city of Bluefields. Mr. N. has already benefited from a first loan, which he used to buy dairy products. This loan was paid off on time about a year ago. This businessman has a stall in the municipal market of the city of Bluefields; however, the stall is in bad shape, and because of this Mr. N. has been a burglary victim. For this reason, he is applying for a loan to rebuild the stall and guarantee its security. He needs to buy the following construction materials: Ten bags of cement at USD $12 per bag Two units of 2x4 Plycem (a type of cement fiberboard laminate building material) at $25 each Two quintals (a quintal is one hundred pounds) of 3/8 inch iron bars at $10 per quintal Two quintals of 1/4 inch iron bars at $10 per quintal Four units of 4x8 Plycem at $16 each Four meters of sand at $31.50 per meter

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement, 2x4 Plycem, 3/8 inch iron bars, 1/4 inch iron bars, 4x8 Plycem and sand

loans.name: Nola

texts.es: Nola,de 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 pequeños hijos.Juntos habitan en una pequeña comunidad ubicada en la selva peruana.Se dedica a la a la producción y comercialización de cacao y sabe que sus productos son de buena calidad con respecto a sus demás competidores, es por esta razón que tiene una buena cantidad de clientes. Ella comercializa sus productos en los grandes centros de acopio de su localidad y obtiene buenas ganancias con las ventas. Su labor empieza cada día a las  6 de la mañana y se extiende  hasta las 6 de la tarde y por lo general trabaja junto a su esposo. Sin embargo, en el  futuro próximo piensa instalar una tienda de abarrotes, ya que por la zona donde vive no tiene competencia y calcula obtendrá buenas ganancias por las ventas.Este es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, y  se compromete a cumplir puntualmente con su obligaciones de pago, además le va bien en su banco comunal, por el respaldo que se prestan entre todos los socios.Nola tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en fertilizantes , y otra parte la destinará en el acabado de su casa, para  mejorar la calidad y comodidad de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Nola, 33, lives with her husband and their 3 small children in a small community located in the Peruvian jungle. Her business is cacao production and sales, and she knows her products are of good quality compared to her competitors. This is why she has a large clientele. She sells her products in large shopping centers in her locale and makes a good profit. She begins her work at 6:00 am every day and works until 6:00 pm, usually alongside her husband. She would like to open a convenience store near her home because there is no competition there and calculates she can turn a good profit there. This is her second loan with MFP and she’s committed to fulfilling her obligations of prompt payment. She does well at her community bank thanks to the support she receives from all of the members. Nola is thinking of investing the money she’s requested partially in fertilizers and in finishing her home so she can improve her family’s quality of life and comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer purchase and home improvement completion

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos, D. 47 años es una valerosa mujer, madre D. 9 hijos D. los cuales sólo vive con tres D. ellos y con su esposo Hermogenes D. 53 años, en su casa propia. Lo que más le gusta es atender a sus clientes, quienes ya conocen la calidad D. los chicharrones D. pollo y cerdo que prepara, ofreciéndolos todos los días, desD. las 5 D. la tarD. hasta las 10 D. la noche. Así han transcurrido 20 años dedicándose a esta actividad, ya que su trabajo consta caminar largos trayectos vendiendo comida. Su consigna diaria es tratar D. vender las 35 porciones que hace diario. Por otro lado su esposo, trabaja en el transporte público, utilizando una moto carro alquilado y D. las ganancias que recibe le ayuda para los gastos D. la casa. Sin embargo Santos tiene que esforzarse mucho para ayudar a su ultima hija que sufre D. retardo mental, es por ello que quiere ampliar su negocio, comprando un triciclo, para evitar cargar bandejas y aprovechar en vender otros productos como refrescos y postres, eso le dará mucha más ventaja en los ingresos. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y es una D. las personas que trabaja con mucho entusiasmo dentro D. su grupo comunal, además confía en ellos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una carretilla que le ayuD. a reducir el peso que carga a diario.
texts.en:
Santos, 47, is a courageous woman, and mother of 9 children, 3 who live with her and her husband Hermogenes, 53, in their own home. What she likes the most is to look after her customers, who already know the quality of the chicken and pork crackling that she prepares, selling it every day, from 5 in the afternoon until ten in the evening. And so 20 years have passed while running this business, her work consisting of walking long distances selling food. Her daily task is to try to sell the 35 portions that she makes daily. On the other hand, her husband works in public transport, using a rented motorbike cart and the profits that he receives helps in the household expenses. Nevertheless Santos has to work hard to help her youngest daughter who is mentally disabled. This is the reason why she wants to expand her business, buying a three wheeled cart, to save herself from carrying trays and take advantage of selling other products like soft drinks and sweets, this will give her a lot more opportunity to earn income. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she is one of the people who works with a lot of enthusiasm within her communal group, in addition she trusts them. With the requested loan, she will buy a cart which will help her reduce the weight that she carries daily.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cart to sell her plates of food.

loans.name: Khandjamts

texts.en:
KhandJ., 40 years old, lives with her husband and four children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Residing with her family in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, KhandJ. currently operates a construction materials trade business out of a rented stall at the largest market in her town. With few competing businesses at this market, her business has seen steady growth since its inception in 2003.

Her children haven't attended secondary school, but KhandJ.' dream is for them to complete their education. A very optimistic and hardworking person, she also hopes to save money to build her own house. KhandJ. is now requesting a loan to purchase more supplies for her construction materials trade business.

loans.use: To purchase more construction materials

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
Melania F. is 44 and married with four children (ages 6 - 16).  She is starting a business, selling pancakes (fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam).  Melania needs a loan of WST $1500 to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Melania joined SPBD. This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Melania's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags

loans.name: Tumuai

texts.en:
Tumuai  S. is 48 and married with four children (ages 14 - 21).  She is starting a business, planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale.  Tumuai needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Tumuai  joined SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Tumuai 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Tamasailau

texts.en:
Tamasailau  P. is 41 and married with three children (ages 7 - 19).  She is starting a business, selling pancakes (fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam).  Tamasailau  needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Tamasailau  joined SPBD.  This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Tamasailau's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es:
Luis Carlos Rodríguez tiene 43 años y vive en Villa Katanga un barrio de Soledad, con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos de 15 y 9 años de edad; en su casa adecuó un local donde tiene 12 computadores en sus respectivas cabinas de madera y maneja 3 planes de celulares, con los que ofrece servicios de internet y telefonía a destinos locales nacionales e internacionales. Como en villa Katanga y sus alrededores son pocos los negocios que ofrecen servicios de Internet, y resulta muy economico hacer llamadas a celulares, el local de  Luis Carlos permanece  muy lleno de clientes que vienen de varios sectores aledaños,  los  muchas veces tienen que esperar a que se desocupen los equipos, para acceder a los servicios ofrecidos; esta es la razón por la que él solicita su tercer crédito, porque quiere comprar un equipo de cómputo con sus  respectivas instalaciones y un par de planes de líneas telefónicas. 
Luis Carlos  se inició como emprendedor en el año 1997 cuando vendía discos puerta a puerta y ya su negocio tenía un nombre,  “Discos Carlos”, fue en ese entonces cuando empezó su relación con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con un crédito de $600.000 y pasó a tener su disquera en su casa, tiempo después  cambió  de actividad, cuando vender disco dejó de ser un buen negocio; asì fue como suspendió sus créditos y  posteriormente  cuando emprendió el negocio que en la actualidad tiene, hace tres años, volvió a  iniciar su relación crediticia con esta organización.  Asì fue como asignó en su vivienda un espacio para su nuevo negocio y desde que recibió su crédito su vida ha cambiado,  porque pudo adquirir su vivienda y comprar activos fijos. Su nuevo sueño es afianzar su negocio y hacerlo un sitio preferido por sus clientes. Su mayor desafío es comprar una vivienda para separar su espacio comercial de su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Luis Carlos Rodríguez is 43 and lives in Villa Katanga, a suburb of Soledad with his wife and his 2 children who are 15 and 9 years of age. His house has been adapted into a store where he has 12 computers, each in their own wooden cabinets and operates 3 mobile phone lines. With these he offers internet and phone services to local, national and international destinations. As in Villa Katanga and its surrounding areas there are few businesses that offer internet services, and it is very economical to make calls to mobiles, Luis Carlos' store is always very full of customers who come from several areas nearby. Most of the time they have to wait for the equipment to become free, so that they can access the services he offers. This is the reason why he is asking for his third loan, because he wants to buy computer equipment and systems and a couple of telephone lines. Luis Carlos started out as an entrepreneur in 1997 when he used to sell records door to door and his business already had a name, “Discos Carlos”. It was then that he started his relationship with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation with a $600,000 loan and he started up a record shop in his home. After a time he changed business, when selling records stopped being a good business. Therefore he suspended his loans and later when he started the business he currently has, three years ago, he began his credit relationship with this organization again. And that was how he allocated a space in his home for his new business and since he received his loan his life has changed, because he was able purchase his home and buy fixed assets. His new dream is to consolidate his business and make it the preferred site for his customers. His biggest challenge is to buy a home to separate his commercial space from his family life.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy computer equipment and systems and a couple of telephone lines.

loans.name: Tekauita

texts.en:
Tekauaita  T. is 30 and married with five children (ages 6 - 19).  She is starting a business, selling local Samoan snacks such as palusami (coconut cream wrapped in taro leaves), cooked taro, yams, and soupo ese (hearty papaya soup).  Tekauaita  needs a loan of WST $1000 to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Tekauaita  joined SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Tekauaita's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags

loans.name: Fao

texts.en:
Fao F. is 55 and married with three children (ages 18 - 25).  She owns a business, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Fao has many years of experience in this business.  Fao needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2003, Fao joined SPBD. This is her fourth loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Fao's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Soloi

texts.en:
Soloi I. is 32 and married with three children (ages 6 - 12).  She owns a business venture, driving a taxi.  Soloi has 3 years of experience in this business.  Soloi needs a loan of WST $1500 to maintain vehicle.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Soloi joined SPBD.This is her second loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Soloi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To maintain vehicle

loans.name: Sajida Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Sajida Parveen, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines) Pakistan, is the wife of A. A. and owns a small house of two rooms where she has been living with her family for over 15 years. A very talented and organized lady, Sajida efficiently manages both her house and her clothes-sewing business, the latter providing financial support for her family. Her husband is a farmer.

Sajida and her husband feel proud when they see their children receiving an education and working hard to make their future bright. They have four children, two daughters and two sons. Their elder daughter is in 12th standard; the next to her is doing FSC, while her elder son reads in 9th standard and the younger is in 3rd standard.

Sajida is now applying for her third loan from Asasah so she can purchase an electric sewing machine to sew more clothes.

Note: In this picture Sajida and Sugran are showing their sewing machines.

loans.use: To purchase an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Hace 30 años Gloria Marie González vive en el barrio las carabelas, D. gente muy cálida y fraternal, donD. la conocen y es un sector con una infraestructura ambiental muy conservada.   Esa es la descripción  del lugar donD. Gloria desarrolla una multiplicidad D. actividades que la han ayudado a salir adelante  en la educación D. sus 3 hijos ya mayores edad, ella tiene  una miscelánea, pero también ofrece servicios D. lavandería, trabaja las manualidades y elabora ropa D. bebe, bufandas sacos, en fin  a todo lo que se le ocurra que es un ingreso  Gloria se le miD. y siempre ha sido asì. Ella empezó a ser negociante  el barrio Galería donD. ganó su amplia trayectoria en el comercio, después se trasladó a su casa, donD. su clientela ha ido en ascenso porque D. un servicio pasan a adquirir otro, D. los que ella misma ofrece.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito hacerle  mejoras locativas  especialmente el techo  donD. está la miscelánea, hacer adecuación D. un canal y tapar  las goteras, previniendo la  humedad para que no se  deteriore su mercancía especialmente en épocas D. lluvia.
Su meta es ampliar su negocio y emplear gente, también  aumentar los inventarios y ofrecer servicios  que ofrezcan solución a sus clientes. Su desafío actual es mantener su familia unida, porque  el ser mama cabeza D. hogar y sacar adelante a sus hijos fue el desafío más granD. que ha tenido en su vida.
texts.en:
For 30 years Gloria Marie González has lived in the Carabelas suburb, with warm and friendly people, where they know her and it is an area with a well maintained environmental infrastructure. This is the description of the place where Gloria developed a variety of businesses that have helped her to get ahead in the education of her 3 adult-age children. She has a small general store, but also offers laundry services, she works with handicrafts and makes baby clothes, scarves and bags. In the end everything that occurs to her that could be income Gloria considers it, and it has always been this way. She became a businesswoman in the Galería suburb where she gained her broad career in commerce, and after she moved to her home her customer base has increased because one service led to adding another that she offers. Currently she needs a loan to make improvements to her premises especially the ceiling where the store is, upgrading the guttering and fixing the leaks, preventing the humity so that her goods do not perish especially in the rainy season. Her goal is to expand her business and employ people, also to increase her stock and offer services that proviD. a solution for her customers. Her current challenge is to keep her family close, because being a mother, the head of the home and for her children to get ahead is the biggest challenge that she has had in her life.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make improvements to her premises especially the roof where the store is, upgrade the guttering and fix the leaks

loans.name: Ashoka Kanthi

texts.en:
Ashoka Kanthi is a 40-year-old woman who is married and living with her husband and three children in the town of Akurassa in the Galle district of southern Sri Lanka.

Ashoka Kanthi  runs a carpet and small items business with some help from her husband. She started this venture twenty-two years ago and has seen success in the growth of her business. She works very hard and also attributes her success to being a very honest woman.

With this loan of 20,000 LKR, Ashoka Kanthi hopes to buy more clothes to sell in her shop, and materials to make carpets to sell.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy clothes and materials for her carpet business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry feed

loans.name: Hajra's Group

texts.en:
Hajra, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines) Pakistan, is the wife of S. S. and owns a small two-room house where she has been living with her family for over 40 years. A very talented lady, Hajra operates a paranda-making business, an enterprise that helps support her family. (A paranda is used to tie back hair as part of an ornament.) Her husband runs a tailoring center, his stitching famous in the community. He learned this skill at the age of 12 and started his own business 10 years ago.

Hajra is now applying for her second loan from Asasah so her husband can purchase an electric sewing machine that will increase his business efficiency.

Note: In this picture Hajra is showing her paranda.

loans.use: To purchase an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Karimkulova Ruzvanhan Group

texts.ru:
Рузванхан является лидером этой группы. Ей 52 года, замужем и мать 3 уже взрослых детей. Из них младшая дочь помогает матери в бизнесе. Она в данное время занимается выращиванием риса. На кредит она закупит 300 кг семян риса, 50 кг удобрений и 10 литров солярки.

Нуржамал, 41, замужем.  У нее трое детей:двум дочерям 21 год и 14 лет, а сыну 19 лет. Старшая дочь рабоает в городе Ош в швейном цехе и получает 100 долларов, сын работает помощником бухгалтера в больнице и получает 50 долларов. Младшая дочь учится в местной школе.  А супруг работает  в лесхозе. Нуржамал занимается сельским хозяйством, 15 лет назад был взят в аренду земельный надел и начат бизнес. Сначала сажали только пшеницу. Цель кредита - закуп 100 кг семян, 500 кг удобрений и 50 литров дизельного топлива.

Алима, 53, замужем. У нее одна дочь.Супруг клиента работает контролером в РЭС с зарплатой около 150 долларов. У алимы есть домашнее хозяйство, где она занимается откормом живности. Цель кредита - закуп 1 овцы и корм для разведения.

'Марату 36 лет. Его супруга занимается сельским хозяйством ( выращивает рис). Сам же работает в больнице в Куршабе, материальным бухгалтером, а также занимается животноводством. Цель кредита - закупа МРС.
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Ruzvanhan is the leader of this group. She is 52 years old, married and is a mother of 3 already-grown children. Out of the children, the youngest daughter helps her mother with the business. Ruzvanhan in currently involved in growing rice. She will use this loan to buy 300 kg of rice seeds, 50 kg of fertilizers and 10 liters of diesel fuel. Nurjamal is 41 years, married. She has three children: two daughters are 21 and 14 years old, and the son is 19 years old. The oldest daughter works at a sewing factory in the city of Osh and earns 100 dollars. The son works as an assistant accountant at a hospital and earns 50 dollars. The youngest daughter attends a local school. Nurjamal's husband works at a forestry. Nurjamal is involved in agriculture. The family leased a plot of land 15 years ago and started this business. At first, they only planted wheat. The goal of the loan is to purchase 100 kg seeds, 500 kg of fertilizers and 50 liters of diesel fuel. Alima is 53 years old, married. Her husband works as a controller at the RES and has a salary of around 150 dollars. Alima has a household business of fattening livestock. The goal of the loan is the purchase of one sheep and livestock feed. Marat is 36 years. His wife is involved in agriculture, growing rice. Marat works as a materials accountant at a hospital in Kurshab and is also involved in animal husbandry. The goal of the loan is the purchase of small livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice seeds, fertilizers and diesel fuel

loans.name: Sultan's Group

texts.en:
Sultan, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines) Pakistan, is the wife of M. I. and owns a small two-room house they have lived in for over 30 years.  A very caring and active lady, Sultan manages the household chores while her husband runs a grocery shop in the main market of Borewala, a highly competitive environment requiring him to keep a good stock of groceries to maintain his customers. 

Sultan is therefore requesting her second loan from Asasah so that M. can purchase groceries in bulk to remain competitive.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay labour costs and buy tools for agricultural activities

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru: Зубайдуллоев Сухроб проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст, 30 лет. Женат, не имеет детей. Живет вместе с родителями. Образование среднее. Более 4 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Suhrob Z. lives near Khuroson. 30 years old, married, no children. His parents live with him. He has finished secondary school. He has been raising livestock for more than 4 years. He does it at his home. He is taking out this loan to purchase large cattle.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing large cattle

loans.name: Mala

texts.en:
Mala is a 27-year-old married woman living with her husband and two sons in Akurassa, part of the Galle area of Sri Lanka. She is a hard-working woman and enthusiastic. Her husband is also helps with the business.

Mala has managed her clothing business for one year. She has requested a 15,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to buy clothes for the business.

Mala is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides to her. Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy clothes for her business

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru: Садыкова Мохира проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст, 29 лет. Разведена, имеет одного ребенка. Живет вместе с родителями. Отец работает в России. Сама Мохира имеет среднее образование. У нее салон свадебных платьев. Она продает и дает напрокат  платье. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 12 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения свадебных платьев.
texts.en:
Mohira S. lives in the town of Qurgan-Tube. 29 years old, divorced with one child. Her parents live with her. Her father now works in Russia. Mohira herself has finished secondary school. She keeps a bridal salon. She sells and rents bridal dresses. She has been in this business for over 12 years. She is taking out this loan in order to purchase a supply of bridal dresses.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing wedding dresses [for resale]

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grocery items for her business

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Рахмонов Дилшод проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст, 32 года. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Дилшод имеет средне - специальное образование, "Механик". По специальности работал 8 лет. Сейчас он занимается торговлей. У него собственный магазин, где он продает велосипеды и запасные части. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 7 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Dilshod R. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. He is 32 years old, married and has 2 children. His wife is a homemaker. Dilshod has a secondary-specialized education as a mechanic. He spent 8 years working in that field. Now he is involved in retail sales. Dilshod owns a store, where he sells bicycles and spare parts. He has been involved in this business for over 7 years. He is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy vegetables from farmers to sell in the market

loans.name: Sodik

texts.ru: Шакиров Содик проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст, 44 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование высшее, "Экономист". Более 10 лет работал по профессии. Сейчас он занимается торговлей. У него магазин, где он в основном продает строительные материалы. В торговле ему помогает сын. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 15 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Sodik S. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. He is 44 years old, married and has 4 children. He has a higher education as an economist. Sodik spent over 10 years working in that profession. Now he is involved in retail sales. He has a store, where he primarily sells construction materials. His son helps him with the sales. Sodik has been involved in this business for 15 years. He is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Construction materials to build a workshop

loans.name: Udeshika Mali

texts.en:
Udeshika Mali is a 39-year-old married woman living in the town of Hikkaduwa, Sri Lanka. She and her husband have two daughters and two sons. Udeshika and her husband run an auto shop where they sell spare vehicle parts and gasoline and motor oils. Every morning Udeshika and her husband go to deliver spare parts and other items for motor vehicles. They started this business in 2000.  

There is high demand for the spare parts, and because of the low competition in the area, she has seen initial success. Now she hopes to further expand.

Udeshika is seeking a 40,000 LKR loan from BRAC to buy spare vehicle parts for her business. Currently she does not have the financial capital necessary to grow her business. She is grateful to BRAC because of the support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy spare parts and motor oils for re-sale

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Through hard work and determination, Mary Grace L.’s loans obtained through her membership in ASHI were never wasted. It has been a great source of financial support to a small business she chose to start and grow. Eventually, her small cashew nuts vending business has grown. Its proceeds have enabled Mary Grace to graduate her eldest child from college just last year. Because she still has three children to take care of and support until they have their own careers in the future, she is enthusiastic about growing her business. She hopes that through the loan she is requesting presently, she will be able to buy and sell a large volume of cashew nuts. Through this, she and her husband can also help one another in selling their products directly to people in the market. She also hopes to deliver to the school and office canteen. 

Mary Grace has various ways to sell her cashew nuts. She makes salted and sweetened cashew nuts to suit her customers’ choice of taste. Some of her customers are tourists in the town. They purchase Mary Grace’s products as a gift for their loved ones.

loans.use: To purchase cashew nuts to make salted and sweetened nuts for sale

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: K. Hellen, a businesswoman of 28 years old, is single with no children. She resides along Wright Road. She owns a stationery shop and has been running this business for over two years. She is using this loan to buy exercise books and ream papers to sell and to offer photocopying, scanning and printing services. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy exercise books and ream papers to sell and to offer photocopying, scanning and printing services

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna A. is from the village of Sta. Filomena, Dipolog City. She is 33 years old. Edna is single and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Edna owns and operates a business selling barbecue in the local community. Edna is just starting this business.

In 2010, Edna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Edna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to support her child's education. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan D. is from the village of Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. She is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Susan owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-five years and earns approximately $144 a month from this activity.

In 2005, Susan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Susan is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 8th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Badenya sont 9 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 3 enfants et vivant dans des  familles polygames à Mamassoni un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de produits alimentaires tels la vente de pomme de terre avec Youma Koné,  des ignames, des condiments alimentaires, de la salade, des  fruits etc.
Youma compte acheter avec son  prêt,  400kg de pomme de terre au grand marché du quartier Médine de la ville de Sikasso et dans les vergers des villages voisins.  Elle les revend au  grand marché de Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Badenya group are nine married women who average 41 years of age, have an average of three children each and live in polygamous families in Mamassoni, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). They are on their seventh loan from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, which they are taking out to satisfy their customers' needs; all their previous loans have been repaid on time. This group of women buy and sell food products, such as potatoes (as is the case for Youma Koné), yams, condiments, lettuces, fruit, etc. With her loan, Youma is planning on buying 400kg of potatoes at the large market in the Médine district of the town of Sikasso as well as in the orchards in neighboring villages. She resells them at the large market in Sikasso and within her family to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 17,500FCFA, of which part will be used to help out her husband with the daily expenses and the rest invested in her business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potatoes

loans.name: Batbaatar

texts.en:
Batbaatar L. is 41 years old and lives with his wife and four teenage children in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest son, Erdenehuu, attends a vocational training center and his other three children all attend a local secondary school.

Batbaatar operates an auto repair service in his town and is a professional mechanic. He has been operating his business since 2000, and has steadily expanded his business over the past 10 years. His services include soldering, painting, scratch removal and other auto repair services. He operates his service in the yard beside his ger. After years of success, he has used his earnings to help his wife start a meat selling business. Batbaabar's dream is to one day to open a large auto repair center. He is a very skilled mechanic and hardworking person. He feels that it is most important to try and provide the highest quality service to his customers. He is requesting a 2,400,000 MNT loan to purchase spare parts and other necessary materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Leonida's Group

texts.en:
Leonida B. is from the village of Magsaysay. She is 56 years old. She is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Leonida is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she sells owned-harvest rice. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $113 a month from this activity.

In 2004, Leonida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for farming. Leonida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies. This will be her 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's standard of lilving. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Tsevegmid

texts.en: Tsevegmid G. is a 56-year-old widow who lives in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. She lives in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent called a “ger”. Tsevegmid's business is called “Oit Hangai” LLC. She operates tree and seed planting, afforestation, and forest maintenance services. She has been operating her business since 2002, and has steadily expanded it over the past eight years. Tsevegmid has been planning to expand her business by opening a lumber processing facility and market. She is a very hardworking person and attributes her success to her strong managerial skills. Tsevegmid enjoys working to better the environment by planting trees and flowers. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to plant tree seedlings and to maintain the forest.

loans.use: To plant tree seedlings

loans.name: Heremakono Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Hérémakono ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans,  4 enfants et  vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Mamassoni, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait en général le commerce d’articles divers tels que les tissus  avec Adjaratou D., les fruits, les condiments alimentaires, le lait etc.
Adjaratou D. qui est la présidente du groupe  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10 pièces de pagnes wax. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso auprès des grossistes et effectue sa vente au même  marché de Sikasso et en   famille, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant en détail et souvent à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Hérémakono group average 38 years of age and have an average of four children each; the majority of them live in polygamous families in Mamassoni, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). They are on their sixth loan from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, which they are taking out in order to satisfy their customers' needs; all their previous loans have been repaid on time. This group of women generally trade in a variety of items, such as fabrics (as is the case for Adjaratou D.), fruits, condiments, milk etc. With her loan, Adjaratou D., who is the president of the group, is planning on buying 10 pieces of "pagne wax" (a West African term for highly decorative and colourful fabric). She gets her supplies from wholesalers at Sikasso's large market and sells them at the same market and within her family to a customer base made up of men and women, on a retail basis for cash and often on credt. She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 23,000FCFA, of which part will be used to help out her husband with the daily expenses and the rest invested in her business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Dashbileg

texts.en: Dashbileg G. lives with her husband and grandchildren in the Chingeltey district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger (a Mongolian nomadic housing tent). They have been living together in their current home for 15 years. With the help of her husband, Dashbileg operates a newspaper selling business at Huchit Shonhor, a local market in the city. She has been operating her business since 2002, and has gained significant experience over the past eight years. Dashbileg's main goal is to find more sales channels to sell her newspapers. She is an open and very hardworking person. Dashbileg is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan to purchase cell phone credits which she will resell to her customers.

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Entente Est Bonne) Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi est un regroupement de femmes de Koury (préfecture de Yorosso région de Sikasso) qui se connaissent bien car elles  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans, sont toutes mariées et mères d’au moins 2 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les cosmétiques  la restauration  et les légumes.  
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a une année. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents  ont été bien remboursés. 
Safoura Cissé, qui  est la présidente du groupe Benkadi,  fait de la préparation et vente des plats alimentaires.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, un stock important de haricot, de riz d’huile et d’autres ingrédients pour la restauration. Elle se procure de ses marchandises au marché de Boura et Koury. Elle vend ces nourritures au carrefour au comptant à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Tandis que Les membres du groupe Benkadi comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 110 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Safoura Cissé compte réaliser 130 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a grouping of women from Koury (in the prefecture of Yorosso in the region of Sikasso) who know each other well because they live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They average 30 years of age, are all married and mother to at least two children. This group of women trade in a variety of products such as cosmetics, products for restauration and vegetables. In order to expand their businesses, the members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program a year ago. They are on their third group loan and all previous loans have been repaid on time. Safoura Cissé, who is the president of the Benkadi group, prepares and sells food dishes. She plans to use her loan to buy a significant stock of beans, rice, oil and other ingredients for preparing food. She gets her goods at the markets in Boura and Koury. She sells her food at the crossroads for cash to a diverse and varied customer base. While the members of the Benkadi group plan on making a monthly profit of 110,000FCFA each during the cycle, Safoura Cissé expects to make 130,000FCFA. Apart from repaying the loans, they use part of their income to cover their families' running costs.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for restauration

loans.name: Benkadi ("good Rapport") Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi est un regroupement de femmes de Koury (préfecture de Yorosso, région de Sikasso) qui se connaissent bien car elles  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans, sont 8 mariées et 2 célibataires mères d’au moins 2 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les habillements,  les parures et la restauration etc. 
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a une année. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents  ont été bien remboursés. 
Rokia D. est un membre du groupe qui vend des habits et parures.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des habits et parures. Elle se procure  des habits et parures qui sont à la mode à Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso). Elle vend ces marchandises en détail et au comptant au marché de Koury, à la douane et en ambulant à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Tandis que Les membres du groupe Benkadi comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 120 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Rokia D. compte réaliser 140 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
"Benkadi" ["good rapport"] is a group of women from Koury (Yorosso prefecture, Sikasso region) who know each other well thanks to living in traditional extended families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They are on the average 30 years old; eight of them are married and two are single, with at least two children per woman. They are engaged in selling various items, such as clothing, fashion jewelry and food. In order to expand their business, a year ago they have decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their third group loan; the preceding loans have been duly repaid. Rokia D. is one of the members who sell clothing and jewelry. She would like to use her loan to purchase a stock of clothing and jewelry items. She purchases fashionable clothing and jewelry in Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso). She resells these articles retail, for cash, at the Koury market, by the Customs office and on the street to a mixed and diverse clientele. While other members of the Benkadi group plan to achieve a monthly income of 120,000 West African Francs, Rokia D. plans to achieve 140,000 WA Francs. Besides repaying their loan, they use a part of the revenue towards everyday family expenses.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing clothing and fashion jewelry [for resale]
