She also raises livestock such as chickens, cows (whose milk is for her family’s personal consumption). She has been working with Ibankito for nine years, and the loans she has received have helped her in her home, as well as her business. With the money she receives from the current loan she’s requesting, she will buy pots, pans, etc. to grow her business. Her goal is to have her own capital to be able to grow her business by adding other household items to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pots and pans

loans.name: Gilmer Romel

texts.es:
Gilmer es un padre de familia de 34 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a su pequeña hija en el distrito de Chepén,  perteneciente a la provincia del mismo nombre, ubicada en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de renovación de calzado desde hace varios años, con este negocio el ha venido trabajando para mantener a su familia, hace un año decidió instalar una bodega en su vivienda con la finalidad de generarse nuevos ingresos que le permtieran sacar adelante a los suyos, allí el ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes, la bodega es atendida por su esposa mientras el se dedica a brindar el servicio de renovación de calzado.

Durante los ultimos meses la clientela que frecuentaba su negocio ha ido aumentando por lo que Gilmer ha pensando en ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas productos que le permitan mejorar la calidad de  atención y por consiguiente poder responder a los requerimientos de su clientela. Para lograr su objetivo el ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Gilmer es un padre de familia responsable y trabajador, su mayor anhelo es poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida arreglando su vivienda y brindándole una buena educación a su menor hija. En la zona donde vive el es bastante conocido y estimado por sus vecinos y clientes.
texts.en:
Gilmer is a 34-year-old father who lives with his wife and their Little daughter in the district of Chepén, which belongs to the province of the same name, located in the La Libertad region, an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. He has been providing a shoe-repair service for several years, and with his business he has been able to work to support his family. A year ago he decided to put a little store in his home with the goal of generating new income that would allow him to provide better for his family. He offers his clients all types of products and groceries. His wife attends to the store while he works on his shoe-repair business. During the last few months, his clientele has increased, and so Gilmer has been thinking about growing his business by purchasing more products that will let him increase the quality of his service and be able to meet the demands of his customers. In order to do this, he has asked for his first loan of 1500 Nuevo soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Gilmer is a responsible and hardworking father. His greatest dream is to be able to give his family a better quality of life, repairing his home and providing a good education to his young daughter. In the zone in which he lives, he is well known and respected by his neighbors and customers.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries to increase merchandise stock

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married with one small daughter. He has a business selling cleaning supplies at a market in Nova Kahovka. Sergei started this business several years ago after he was unable to make enough as a farmer to support his family. He enjoys his business now because inventory sells quickly. Having many repeat clients ensures the sales.

Sergei is requesting a loan of 20,000 UAH to help purchase new inventory to sell. He wants to increase the assortment to be able to increase his sales. He hopes to receive additional income and spend it for his family needs.

loans.use: To increase the assortment for sale

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora  Mariana L. tiene 53 años de edad y  es socia del banco comunal El Cisne    hace 5 años, vive en la comunidad San Miguel del Valle ubicada al sureste de la ciudad de Cuenca colindando con el área urbana de la misma.  La agricultura y  ganadería son las principales  actividades que realizan los pobladores de éste hermoso lugar, la producción de maíz, fréjol, haba, arveja, cebada, papas prácticamente alcanza solo para el autoabastecimiento, pero también realizan otras actividades artesanales como elaboración de muebles y confección de ropa.

Nuestra socia es casada y madre de siete hijos entre los 32 y 11 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos son casados pero sólo uno de ellos vive independiente los otros dos viven en su casa compartiendo con sus dos hermanos solteros los gastos de la casa y estudios de sus dos hermanos menores que aun son estudiantes de primaria y secundaria en instituciones de la comunidad, su esposo labora como albañil y  con el esfuerzo familiar  han  logrado edificar su casa propia.

Mariana se dedica a la cría y venta  de chanchos, cuyes que los  compra en la feria para criarlos y engordarlos luego revenderlos cuando ya están en estado para consumirlos, además  se dedica a la agricultura siembra papas, maíz, hortalizas que utiliza para su consumo y también vende en su comunidad.  Con el  crédito solicitado  invertirá  en la compra de mas crías de chanchos, cuyes y alimento para su crecimiento.

Su meta es adquirir  un terreno para cultivar más productos como frutas y hortalizas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariana L. is 53-years-old and has been a member of the El Cisne communal bank for five years. She lives in the community of San Miguel del Valle, located to the southeast of the city of Cuenca, adjoining the city’s urban area. Agriculture and cattle are the primary activities of the people of this beautiful place, including the production of corn, beans, peas, barley, and potatoes, which provide for the local area, but the areas citizens also work as artisans, making furniture and clothing. Our member is married and the mother of seven children aged 11 to 32 years. Her first three children are married, but only one of them lives independently, while the other two live in her house, sharing the household expenses with the other two single children, and the studies of her two younger children who are still attending primary and secondary schools in the community. Her husband works as a bricklayer, and with the efforts of everyone in the family, they have managed to build their own house. Mariana raises and sells pigs and guinea pigs, buying them at the market to raise and fatten them to later re-sell them when they are ready to be eaten. She also raises potatoes and corn, crops that she uses for her own consumption, and that she also sells in the community. With the loan she’s requesting she will invest in the purchase of more pigs and guinea pigs, and food to help them grow. Her goal is to buy some land to be able to grow more products, like fruits and vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pigs and guinea pigs to raise

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andrés tiene 58 años, es un hombre muy honesto y trabajador, está casado con Julia de 56 años, juntos tienen 7 hijos de los cuales sólo viven con 3 de ellos en su casa propia, construido de material noble. Los cuidados que ejerce sobre sus cultivos siempre le retribuyeron buenas cosechas, por eso procura brindarle a sus cafetales y platanales todo el tiempo que requieren. Así ha logrado trabajar durante 30 años sin descanso, lo que más le gusta es cosechar sus productos naturales porque es para él gratificante ver la calidad de sus productos. Sin embargo lo que más le apena es tener que laborar solo y no contar con la ayuda de sus familiares, por ello contrata operarios. Paralelamente a este trabajo, se dedica también a la oficio de construcción de inmuebles, mientras que su esposa trabaja vendiendo comida en su localidad, pero ahora se encuentra en la capital visitando a sus hijos mayores. Con el tiempo espera ayudar a su esposa, instalando un restaurante en donde desea trabajar y dejar poco a poco el arduo trabajo agrícola. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y está  feliz de trabajar en su grupo comunal, porque sus integrantes son personas solidarias y responsables, además confía en que sus cosechas serán exitosas como hasta ahora y no tendrá problemas para pagar la deuda. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono para aplicar a sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Andrés is 58-years-old, and is a very honest and hardworking man. He is married to his wife Julia, who is 56 years old. Together, they have 7 children, of whom only three live with them at home in their own house, built of quality materials. The care that they take with their crops always repays them with good harvests. That’s why they give their crops all the time they need. In this way, they’ve managed to work for thirty years without a break. What he enjoys most is harvesting his crops, because for him it is very gratifying to see the quality of his products. However, what bother him the most is to have to work alone without counting on the help of his family, and that’s why he has to hire laborers. Along with his job farming, he builds houses while his wife works selling food in their community. Now, however, she is in the capital visiting their adult children. With time he hopes to help his wife by building a restaurant where she would like to work, and little by little leave the difficult task of farming. This will be his third loan with MFP, and he’s happy to work with his group, because its members are responsible and team-oriented. He trusts that his harvests will be successful like they have been all along, and he won’t have any trouble paying back the loan. With the 1000 nuevo soles he is requesting, he will buy bags of fertilizer to use on his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Yana

texts.en:
Yana is married, with two children. She sells clothing at the main open market in Novomoskovsk town. Yana has been in this business for eight years. Her hard-working habits and enthusiasm encourage other market venders to continue their businesses in spite of difficult economic times.

Yana's business goal is to start a second location to increase sales. She would like to borrow 13,000 UAH to purchase more inventory for the coming summer season. Yana has used micro loans before. She finds them very helpful for developing her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa , de 66 años, vive con su esposo Pastor que tiene la misma edad , y su hija  Lidia y su pequeña bebé. Juntos  viven en su casa que es  propia.Desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de joyas, que primero su hija compra de catálogos y revistas a su precio de oferta y posteriormente Rosa los comercializa al precio original. La ventaja de vender de esta manera , es que le permite lograr buenos ingresos económicos por la calidad de las joyas . A pesar de las largas caminatas y cobranzas que debe realizar para captar clientes (que  usualmente son sus vecinas y familiares), gusta mucho de su trabajo pues es tranquilo y comodo  realizarlo en los horarios que tiene disponible , ya que  también debe cuidar a su nieto , pues su hija trabaja . En el  futuro quisiera aumentar su mercadería para así lograr mejores ventas ,pues estas joyas cambian por temporadas y cada vez  salen modelos más novedosos.Es el sexto préstamo de Rosa con  MFP y siempre ha sido muy responsable con los pagos de todas sus cuotas.Tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de  joyas para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Rosa, 66 years old, lives with her husband Pastor (who is also 66), and their daughter Lidia and her little baby. Together they live in their own home. For several years she has been selling jewelry, which her daughter buys first from catalogs at sale prices, and Rosa then sells at the normal price. The advantage of this type of sales is that it allows her to earn good income because of the quality of her jewelry. Despite the amount of walking and the collections she must do to find clients (who are usually her family and neighbors), she enjoys her work very much, since it’s nice and comfortable to do it during the extra time she has available, because she also has to care for her grandchild since her daughter is working. In the future she would like to increase her merchandise to achieve better sales, since the jewelry changes by the season, and there are always newer models available. This is the sixth loan for Rosa from MPF, and she has always been very responsible with her payments. She is thinking of investing the money in the purchase of a larger quantity of jewelry to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of jewelry to increase her sales

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase larger quantities of fresh fruit to make juices and snacks

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor de 37 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, su esposo es ayudante de fotografía ellos tienen una niña de 10 años y un niño de 7 años,  hace dos años atrás para ayudar con los gastos familiares ella empezó a vender CD recorriendo en un triciclo las calles de Paraíso( lugar montañoso con calles de tierra), poco a poco fueron incrementando sus ingresos. 

Por esos buenos ingresos ahora ella trabaja en un local vendiendo CD de películas, videos musicales, juegos etc. En ocasiones vende productos de limpieza, trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 20h00pm. Con el préstamo quiere comprar CD y productos de limpieza para su negocio. 

En el futuro quiere que su negocio aumente con productos, también terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Flor is 37-years-old and lives on the outskirts of Paraíso Guayaquil. Her husband is a photographer’s assistant. They have a 10-year-old daughter and an 11-year-old son. For two years, in order to help with household expenses, she has been selling CDs around the streets of Paraíso (a mountainous area with dirt roads) on a tricycle. Little by little she has increased her income. For this good income, she now works in a stall selling CDs of movies, music videos, games, etc. Occasionally she sells cleaning products, and she works from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. With the loan she’s requesting she wants to buy CDs and cleaning products for her business. In the future she wants to increase the number of products she sells, and also finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of CDs and cleaning products to sell

loans.name: Isaiah Otieno

texts.en:
Isaiah Otieno O. has a chain of motorcycles that operate as taxis in Migori. He started this business in 2009, after quitting selling clothes, to generate enough income to be able to support his family. He is 40 years old, married, and is the father of five children.

Isaiah would like to add another motorcycle that will ensure an increased income as he works towards achieving his dream of owning a vehicle for a matatu (minibus) business. But to achieve this, he needs a loan of Ksh 50,000.

loans.use: To add another motorcycle to his business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is a school teacher. Along with teaching, she runs a small farming business where she grows vegetables in a greenhouse. This business brings additional income to her family and provides her family with good quality vegetables. Natalia enjoys growing vegetables and selling them at the market. She knows that her clients will be thankful for good quality at reasonable prices. 

Natalia and her husband have three adopted children. She teaches them how to work and provide for themselves. Natalia needs to borrow 10,000 UAH to purchase plastic sheeting for her greenhouse and fertilizers for her plants.

loans.use: To purchase plastic sheeting for her greenhouse and fertilizers for her plants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: COMPRA DE PAJA

loans.name: Karubanda Twimukye, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
Hardworking M. Lauben, aged 42, is the married father of six children. He went into a carpentry business venture now close to fourteen years ago. Having a strategically located business in Karubanda, Kihihi town, in western Uganda, he gets many customers, earning him 300,000 Ugandan shillings monthly.

With this loan, Lauben is looking forward to restocking his business with more materials like timber and nails and also doing more advertising to increase the numbers of his customers. This will definitely give his enterprise a new lease of life and also help him improve on his sales and enable him to take good care of his family requirements like school fees, medical care and the like.

loans.use: To restock his business with materials like wood, nails, and more

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pay AgroCapital and operating capital

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: La Sra. Mercedes se dedica a la fabricación D. sombreros para cholita estos sombreros es parte D. la vestimenta tradicional D. la Chola Paceña, tiene mucho tiempo en esta actividad, su esposo le ayuda a elaborarlos y ella los venD. en las ferias D. la ciudad D. El Alto D. La Paz, tiene tambien algunos pedidos dentro D. la ciudad por la zona D. Pampahasi que es donD. ella vive, es muy conocida por la zona, sus hijos ya son independientes, pero no se descuidan D. sus padres; doña Mercedes es una cliente muy puntual  y muy antigua D. la institución. El crédito que solicita ahora es para la compra D. material, en especial para el fuste que la base para realizar el sombrero, comprará el nacional ya que hay D. dos clases el nacional y el brasilero; ella comprará el nacional ya que tiene pedidos D. este material. Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mercedes makes hats for “cholitas” (women of Aymaran or Quechan decent). These hats are part of the traditional clothing for the Chola Paceña (women of Aymaran or Quechan decent). She has been doing this for a long time. Her husband helps her make them, and she sells them at the fairs in the cities of El Alto and La Paz. She also has some orders within the city in the Pampahasi area where she lives. She is well known in the area. Her children are independent, but they do not neglect their parents. Mercedes is a very punctual client, and she has worked with the institution for a very long time. The loan she is now requesting is to buy materiel. She will especially buy the “fuste”, which is the base for making the hat. She will buy the national. There are two types, the national and the Brazilian. She will buy the national because she has orders for this material. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for making hats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital and payment to AgroCapital

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
Rosa N. es una mujer de 53 años,  vive en la comunidad Cruz del Camino en  la parroquia El Valle en una casita de su propiedad gracias al esfuerzo conyugal de su juventud compartiendo  con   su esposo que debido a una cirugía en la  cabeza quedo algo invalido y no puede trabajar,  también la acompañan  cinco de sus  nueve hijos, los cuatro son casados y viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad y una de sus hijas vive en otra ciudad y es quien les ayuda económicamente para su mantención y estudios de su ultima hija de once años que está cursando la educación primaria en una escuela de la localidad, los otros cuatro hijos trabajan pero eso sólo para cubrir sus gastos personales y de estudio en uno de  ellos. 

Rosa es socia del banco comunal  El Cisne hace cinco años invitada por su hermana a formar parte de éste hermoso grupo de mujeres emprendedoras ubicado al sureste de la ciudad de Cuenca colindando con el área urbana de la misma donde podemos disfrutar de la hermosa laguna Cochapamba llena de totoras  crenado un paisaje sin igual,  ella se dedica a la cría y venta de chanchos, gallinas  así como también al cultivo de maíz, ajo, cebolla tanto para el consumo en su hogar como para la venta en el mercado de  Cuenca con el crédito solicitado va a comprar alimento para sus animales como afrechillo, maíz, engorde entre otros.

Su sueño es ver a sus hijos superarse personal y económicamente para que les puedan ayudar en su vejez a ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
Rosa N. is a 53-year-old woman, and lives in the community of Cruz del Camino in the parish of El Vallen, in a house of her own, which she has thanks to her work with her husband. They have been together from a very young age, although her husband, due to some surgery to his head, is unable to work. She is also accompanied by five of their nine children, four of whom are married and live in different parts of the city, and another daughter who lives in a different city and is the one who most helps them economically, as well as school costs for their youngest, 11-year-old daughter who is studying in a primary school in the community. The other four children work, but only enough to cover their own personal expenses and one of their education costs. Rosa has been a member of the El Cisne communal bank, and was invited by her sister for form part of this wonderful group of entrepreneurial women located in the southeast of the city of Cuenca, adjoining the urban area, where they can enjoy the beautiful Lake Cochapamba, its reeds, and its peerless landscape. She works raising and selling pigs and chickens, as well as growing corn, peppers, and onions for her own household´s consumption, as well as to sell in Cuenca’s market. With the loan she is requesting, she will go to buy feed for her animals such as corn, to fatten them. Her dream is to see her children achieve more than she has, so they can help her and her husband in their golden years.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase feed for her livestock

loans.name: Mugume Development Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
100,000 shillings is little enough money to survive on in a fast-driven society like the increasingly affluent Nkonkonjeru suburb in Lugazi. It’s even more hard-pressing when you have six children and two orphans to take care of. As it appears, 46-year-old M. Rebecca finds herself in such a scenario.

With her 30-year-old farming business, one would assume Rebecca earns more than what is aforementioned. That is a far cry, however, from the story of this happily married woman. The underlying reason for her low earnings is principally because she has been more of a subsistence than a commercial farmer. She has for the most part been growing and selling maize and beans on a small scale. To eke out more income, she has also been selling mineral water to add to her meager resources.

Rebecca is a diligently hardworking woman and, with this loan, she wants to buy more land to expand her farming activities. As such she wants to grow more cash crops that she will not only be able to sell in the future but also store as surplus.

loans.use: To purchase more land to expand her farming activities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Okothe Otieno

texts.en:
Okothe Otieno S. is a matatu (minibus) driver with ambitions. Back at home in Awendo, Migori, Kenya, he does sugarcane farming that generates income to sustain his family. He plans to expand his business by buying a motorcycle for a taxi business and would like to obtain a loan of Ksh 50,000 to enable him do that.

S. is 30 years old, a husband, and a father of one child. S. will want to see him, and other children to come, get the best of everything in their lives including an education that will ensure them a bright future.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to start a taxi business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La Sra. Blanca tiene como actividad la venta de pan y de productos de primera necesidad, por mas de 10 años en la zona de El Tejar lugar comercial que queda a dos cuadras del cementerio de la ciudad de La Paz, la comercializacion de pan es su unica fuente de ingreso para ella y su familia ya que con esta actividad pudo brindarles una educacion buena a sus hijos.
El destino del credito  es para ayudar a uno de su hijo con la apertura y equipamiento (muebles y mercaderia)de una tienda en la casa donde el vive, de esta manera la Sra. continua ayudando a su familia en este nuevo emprendimiento, es una señora trabajadora siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia. Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Blanca has been selling bread and basic needs products for over ten years. She sells in the El Tejar area. This is a commercial place, which is located two blocks from the cemetery in the city of La Paz. Selling bread is the only source of income for her and her family. Through this activity she was able to give her children a good education. The loan is to help one of her children open and equip (furniture and merchandise) a store in their house. That way she will continue helping her family with this new enterprise. She is a hard-working woman, and she is always thinking of her family’s well-being. She is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Open a neighborhood store and buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a motor for one of his station wagons

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital and pay the AgroCapital balance

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To restock his business with coffee berries from suppliers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a two door refrigerator for her business

loans.name: Celina

texts.es: LA SR. CELINA VIVE EN LA LOCALIDAD DE EL TORNO DISTANTE A 40 KM DE LA CIUDAD DE SANTA CRUZ, EN EL BARRIO LAS PALMAS, SU ACTIVIDAD ES LA VENTA DE MARCOS Y PUERTAS QUE SU ESPOSO LO FABRICA EN SU CARPINTERIA, LLEVAN VARIOS AÑOS CON ESTA ACTIVIDAD SU ESPOSO ES CARPINTERO Y ELLA TAMBIEN LE AYUDA EN LA CONSTRUCCION DE MUEBLES, TIENE 1 HIJO PEQUEÑO, EL CUAL JUNTO CON SU ESPOSO LO ESTAN CRIANDO, ELLA LE AYUDA EN LA ECONOMIA, SU DESEO ES TENER UN PUESTO PROPIO EN LA CIUDAD PARA VENDER SUS PRODUCTOS, YA QUE TIENEN QUE DISTRUIBUIR ENTRE LOS MAYORISTA LOS CUALES LE PAGAN MUY POCO, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARAN MADERA PARA LA FABRICACCION DE SUS PRODUCTOS, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Celina lives in the Las Palmas neighborhood of the town of El Torno, about 40 km. from the city of Santa Cruz. Her business is the sale of doors and frames, which her husband makes in his workshop. They have been in this business for several years. Her husband is a carpenter, and Celina also helps with the construction. They have one young son. Celina’s wish is to have a place in the city to sell their products. As it is, they have to sell wholesale and so the prices are low. With the money from this loan, they will buy wood for the fabrication of their products. They are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence offered in the granting of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy lumber for carpentry shop

loans.name: Santos Silvia

texts.es:
Santos tiene 42 años de edad, es separada y vive junto a sus hijas y a sus nietos en el distrito de Chepén, perteneciente a la provincia del mismo nombre, ubicada en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la venta de prendas de vestir de primera mano y usadas en un pequeño puesto cercano al mercado de la ciudad, ella compra su mercadería en la ciudad de Trujillo y la ofrece a sus clientes durante todo el dia, también realiza ventas por pedidos. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza en   el sostenimiento de su familia y en solventar sus gastos personales.

Santos desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas mercadería de modo que pueda captar mas clientes y pericbir mas ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Santos es una madre bastante luchadora y que siempre ha dado todo de si para sacar a sus hijas adelante, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y tener una tienda de ropa mas grande. En la zona donde vive ella es bastante conocida y estimada por sus vecinos, los que la consideran una mujer alegre y colaboradora.
texts.en:
Santos is 42 years-old, separated, and lives together with his daughters and his grandchildren in the district of Chepén, belonging to the province of the same name, located in the La Libertad region, and hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. For a year he has been selling articles of clothing, both new and used, in a little stall near the city market. She buys her merchandise in the city of Trujillo and offers it to her clients all day long. She also sells by order. The income she makes she uses in caring for her family and paying her personal expenses. Santos would like to grow her business by purchasing more merchandise “de modo” (currently “in”, “fashionable”), which would earn her more clients and profits. In order to achieve this goal, she has asked for her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 1000 nuevo soles. Santos is a very hardworking mother, and she has always given everything to provide for her children. Her greatest dream is to continue growing as a businesswoman and to have a larger clothing store. In her neighborhood she is very well known and admired by her neighbors, who consider her a very happy and helpful woman.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new and used clothing to grow her business

loans.name: Lola

texts.es: LA SRA. LOLA VIVE EN LA LOCALIDAD DE EL TORNO DISTANTE A 40 KM DE LA CIUDAD DE SANTA CRUZ, EN EL BARRIO LAS PALMAS, SU ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL ES LA VENTA DE ROPA LOS DIAS DE FERIA EN EL MERCADO CENTRAL DE LA LOCALIDAD, EN LOS DIAS PARTICULARES SU VENTA ES AMBULANTE POR EL PUEBLO, SU ESPOSO ES ENCARGADO DE UNA GRANJA DE POLLOS EN LA LOCALIDAD DE JOROCHITO A UNOS 10 KM DE LA COMUNIDAD, SU DESEO ES PODER TENER SU NEGOCIO ESTABLE EN EL MERCADO, EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA COMPRAR MERCADERIA DE INVIERNO; SE SIENTE AGRADECIDA CON LA INSTITUCION POR EL APOYO FINANCIERO BRINDADO."
texts.en:
Lola lives in the town of El Torno, 40 km from the city of Santa Cruz, in the area of Las Palmas. Her main activity is to sell clothes at the town's central market on holidays, and on special days, she moves her business throughout the town. Her husband is in charge of a chicken farm in the town of Jorochito, 10 km from the community. Her wish is to have a stable business in the marketplace. The purpose of the loan is to buy winter clothing merchandise. She is grateful to the institution for the financial support they have offered.

Translated from Spanish by Tania Mazumdar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Kevin Otieno

texts.en:
Kevin Otieno O. is 30 years old, a husband and a father of two children. He lives in Migori, Kenya, and used to be a mechanic before venturing into sugar cane farming in 2002. He wants to boost his business and eventually expand it to owning rental houses.

He would like to get a loan of KES 20,000.

loans.use: To expand his business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es: EL SR. LUIS VIVE EN LA LOCALIDAD DE EL TORNO EN EL BARRIO SAN MARTIN EN LA CASA DE SU PADRE, SU ESPOSA CON LA CUAL TIENE UN HIJO PEQUEÑO, LE AYUDA EN LA CARPINTERIA, SU DESEO ES PODER TENER SU PROPIA CASA PARA CRIAR ADECUADAMENTE A SU PEQUEÑO HIJO PRIMOGENITO, EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO SOLICITADO ES PARA COMPRAR MADERA PARA SU NEGOCIO, SE SIENTE AGRADECIDO CON LA INSTITUCION LA CUAL LE DIO UNA MANO PARA TENER UN CAPITAL PROPIO, Y ASI SEGUIR MANTENIENDO A SU FAMILIA, YA QUE SU TRABAJO ES SU UNICA FUENTE DE INGRESO.
texts.en:
Luis lives in his father’s house in the San Martin neighborhood of the town of El Torno. His wife, with whom he has a young son, helps him with his carpentry. He dreams of having his own home where he can properly raise his firstborn son.
The requested loan will be used to buy wood for his business. His work is his only source of income, so he is grateful to this institution for helping him have capital of his own to provide for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Olga Olalla

texts.es:
Olga de 42 años, vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, esta separada de su esposo pero ella tiene dos hijos de 19 y 6 años, Olga hace 13 años tiene una tienda, empezó con un estudio del mercado en todo su sector para invertir en un negocio, adecuo su casa y compro víveres para una tienda ya que era la mejor opción.  

En la actualidad ella tiene una tienda con víveres y ha implementado ubicar un papelería pequeña junto a la tienda, trabaja desde las 07h30 hasta las 23h00pm, vende enlatados a $ 0.95, detergente a $ 1.10, cuadernos a $ 1.10. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento y bloques para readecuar su negocio. 

En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa, y ampliar mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Olga is 42-years-old and lives in the suburbs of Guyaquil. She is separated from her husband, but she has two children ages 19 and 6 years. For 13 years she has had a store. She started with a study of the local market to figure out what she should invest in, and decided on opening a store selling basic household goods, which was the best option. Today, she has a store with staple goods, and she’s also put in a little office supply store together with her shop. She works from 7:30 a.m. until 11:00 p.m., selling canned goods at $0.95, detergent at $1.10, and notebooks at $1.10. With the loan, she wants to buy cement and cinder blocks to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cement and cinder blocks

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem, a resident of Multan (famous for its sweetmeats), Pakistan and the wife of R. A., owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 23 years.

A very talented lady, Naseem operates a clothes-sewing business. She sews clothes for her neighbors and her relatives as well. She charges them PKR 100-130 for each dress. She uses her income to pay for the utilities.

Her husband is a tailor by profession and runs a tailoring center in the community where he sews specifically gentlemen's clothes. His business earns him a profit of PKR 8,000 per month. They both use their income to improve the living standard of their family.

Naseem is applying for a loan from Asasah, to invest the capital in her husband’s business so he can purchase an electric sewing machine to sew clothes. His manual machine makes him tired now, and it takes a long time to complete the clothes.

loans.use: Purchase an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Lyndis

texts.es: Lyndis tiene 30 años, está casada con Orlando de 39 años, con quien tiene dos hijos, juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la selva central. Hace mas de 6 años, se dedica al cultivo de café, plátano y plata, esta actividad lo realiza en compañía de su esposo, ambos tiene el mismo objetivo de ofrece un mejor beneficio a sus hijos. De es manera se levanta desde muy temprano por la mañana a preparar los alimentos de sus hijos y luego se disponen a ir a los campos agrícolas. Lo que más le agrada hacer es retirar la maleza de sus tierras, sin embargo el tener que colocar trampas para las plagas le resulta muy complicado y peligroso. Por otro lado reconoce que esta actividad le resulta muy rentable porque gracias a eso construyó su casa, vive cómodamente sin preocupaciones, además puede cubrir la educación de sus hijos. Por tal motivo desea aumentar su producción con la compra de más terrenos productivos, asimismo desea dedicarse a la compra y venta de plátanos la por mayor y menor. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y asegura estar entusiasmada de continuar laborando en grupo comunal, quienes le enseñaron a ser responsables y honestos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono para cuidar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Lyndis is 30-years-old. She is married to Orlando, who is 39, and with whom she has two children. Together, they live in their own home, located in the central jungle. For more than 6 years, she has grown coffee and plantains. She does this with her husband, and they both have the goal of offering a better quality of life to their children. She wakes up very early every morning to prepare breakfast for her children, and later goes off to her fields. What she likes best is to weed her fields, however, having to place traps for the pests is very dangerous and difficult for her. On the other hand, she realizes that this activity is very profitable, and thanks to this she has built her house. She lives a worry-free and comfortable life, and she can cover the costs of schooling for her children. For this reason she would like to increase her production by purchasing more productive land, and she would like to concentrate on buying and selling plantains and wholesale and retail prices. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she assures you that she is very enthused to continue working in her communal group, who have shown themselves to be responsible and honest. With the loan she is asking for, she will buy bags of fertilizer to care for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: Leonor, es una mujer ejemplar y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, tiene 48 años y convive con Elías de 56 años, con quien tiene 6 hijos, viviendo solo con dos de ellos en su casa propia. Hace más de 30 años, ella y su esposo se dedica a la siembra de frutos como palta, plátanos, piña y café, por lo que disfruta mucho de la tranquilidad que le transmite su chacras, sin embargo el lograr tener bien cuidado sus plantaciones, le resulta muy pesado ya que tiene que retirar la maleza de sus cultivos. Paralelamente a esta actividad también se dedica a preparar diversos platos de comida, que vende en un espacio de su casa, de esa manera se genera otros ingresos adicionales al de la agrícola. Gracias a las utilidades que recibe, pudo adquirir sus bienes, cubrir la educación de sus hijos y solventar los gastos domésticos. Es por ello que en el futuro piensa terminar de construir su casa e instalar un restaurante, de igual manera desea plantar en mayor cantidad café y plátanos. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y se siente muy agradecida por la confianza que continúan depositando en ella, esto lo motiva para continuar laborado en su grupo comunal de manera activa. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará sacos de abono, además contratará operarios que lo ayuden a mantener limpios sus cultivos e incluso quiere comprar algunos materiales como bambú y clavos para arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Leonor is an exemplary woman with a lot of desire to get ahead. She is 48-years-old and lives with Elias, who is 56-years-old. Together they have six children, and live with two of them in their own home. For more than 30 years, she and her husband have grown crops such as avocadoes, plantains, pineapple, and coffee. She really enjoys the tranquility of her farmhouse, but taking care of her crops can be very burdensome, since she has to weed her fields. Together with her farming, she prepares a variety of dishes which she sells from her house, and in this way she generates additional income, along with what she earns farming. Thanks to that income, she could buy her things, cover the educational costs of her children, and pay her household costs. This is why she is thinking about finishing building her house and putting in a restaurant in the future, and she would also like to plant more coffee and plantains. This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she is very thankful for the trust that they continue to place in her. This motivates her to continue working actively with her group. With the loan she requests, she will buy bags of fertilizer, and also hire laborers who will help her maintain her crops, and she would also like ot buy some materials such as bamboo and nails to fix her house.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer, and hiring workers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying food to sell

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina, a resident of Multan (famous for its sweetmeats), Pakistan, and the wife of M. I. has lived in a small house of two rooms with her family for the last ten years.

She operates a clothes-sewing business in her house. She learnt this skill from her sister-in-law after her marriage. She started this work to spend her leisure time but later she adapted it as a profession when it started giving her good returns in the form of money. Now she can sew both ladies' and gents' garments. She also offers her services for sewing children's clothes. She shares the money to pay for the utilities and to manage financial expenses with her husband.

Her husband is a loader by profession. He loads different items in his donkey cart and delivers it to different places to generates income. He has been doing this work for over six years.

Zarina is applying for a loan from Asasah, to invest the capital in her husband’s business so he can purchase a new donkey cart, because the old cart has become rough and rotten.

Zarina is cutting a dress for sewing in this picture.

loans.use: Purchase a new donkey cart for transporting goods

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa ,de 57 años, vive con su esposo Carlos y su hijo Erick que ya es independiente. Todos habitan en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 11 años, se dedica a la atención de  su tienda de abarrotes , y siempre ha tratado que su negocio este bien implementado con los productos comestibles necesarios para satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes . Su tienda  es muy concurrida  con gran cantidad de clientes, además Teresa se esfuerza mucho por brindar una buena atención, para que las personas regresen en cualquier momento por el buen trato que les brinda . Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque le da la disponibilidad de tiempo ,que necesita para realizar las labores de su hogar, pues mientras deja la reja de su tienda abierta puede entrar en  su casa y organizarla; mientras los clientes optan por comprar. En el futuro Teresa quiere seguir mejorando su negocio  y es por eso que necesita mayor capital.Es el  sétimo préstamo que tiene con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual con los pagos de todas sus cuotas.Teresa tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de golosinas, gaseosas, galletas, entre otros comestibles para de esta manera satisfacer las necesidades de la clientela.
texts.en:
Teresa, 57-years-old, lives with her husband Carlos and her son Erick, who is already grown. They all live in their own home. For 11 years, she has had a grocery store, and she has always tried to make sure that her store is well stocked with the merchandise necessary to meet her customers’ needs. Her store is very busy with a large number of customers. Teresa works hard to give them good customer service, which keeps them coming back again and again. She enjoys her work very much because it gives her enough time to take care of her household chores, and as long as she keeps the door open to her store, she can be at home working, while her clients choose what they’d like to buy. In the future, Teresa wants to continue improving her business, and that is why she needs more capital. This is the seventh loan she has had with MFP, and she has always been very punctual with her payments. Teresa is thinking about investing the money in buying candy, soft drinks, and cookies, among other foods, to satisfy her clientele’s needs.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to stock grocery store

loans.name: Eduardo Miguel

texts.es:
Eduardo tiene 57 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y a un hijo que aun depende de el, su domiciclio se ubica en el distrito de Chepén, perteneciente a la provincia del mismo nombre, ubicada en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de 10 años a brindar servicio de planchado de autos en un pequeño taller ubicado en plena carretera Panamericana (la carretera mas grande del país, atraviesa todas las regiones de la costa), su establecimiento se encuentra estratégicamente ubicado frente a un grifo, por lo que siempre tiene trabajo que realizar. Este negocio le ha servido para solventar los gastos familiares durante todo este tiempo, por lo que se encuentra muy agradecido con su trabajo y planea seguir adelante en esta actividad.

Eduardo desea mejorar su negocio con la compra de mas material y de herramientas que le permitan brindar un mejor servicio y por consiguiente obtener mas clientes, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por pirmera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.	

Eduardo es bastante trabajador y responsable, su mayor anhelo es poder obtener un local propio donde pueda ejecer su oficio ya que el que actualmente tiene es alquilado. Sus clientes y vecinos le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una persona honesta.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 57-years-old, married, and lives with his wife and one dependent child. His home is in the Chepén district, belonging to the province of the same name, located in the La Libertad región, one hour from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque región. For more than 10 years he has provided a auto detailing service in a littel garage located right on the Panamerican Highway (the biggest highway in the country, which crosses all the coastal regions). His business is strategically located in front of a water-tap, which means he always has work to do. This business has helped him pay all his household expenses during the past 10 years, and for this he is very thankful for his work, and he plans to continue on with this job. Eduardo wants to improve his business by purchasing more material and tools that will allow him to provide a better service to increase his customer base. In order to accomplish this, he has asked for his first loan from Edpyme Alternative, in the amount of 1000 nuevo soles. Eduardo is very hardworking and responsible, and his greatest dream is to be able to buy his own spot where he can do his work, since the one he has now is rented. His customers and neighbors admire him very much, and consider him to be an honest man.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials and tools to grow his business

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.es: Rosanna tiene 24 años, es soltera, vive en una casa alquilada con su hijo Johan de 7 años. Ella es padre y madre para su pequeño, es por eso que a diario se esmera en hacer que nada le falte, desde entonces se dedica al cuidado de café, plátano y palta, que son sembrados sobres sus terrenos heredados por su madre. Actualmente no cuenta con la ayuda de algún familiar, por ello contrata operarios, quienes se encargan de dejar limpios sus cultivos. Lo que más le gusta de su labor es cosechar, ya que le resulta divertido recolectar cada grano de café, sin embargo le es difícil trasladar los pesados sacos o canastas. Esta actividad lo considera muy rentable, porque le permite vivir cómodamente y realizar algunos ahorros. Por otro lado tiene una tienda al cual desea incrementarla de productos para dinamizar sus ventas y de las utilidades que reciba empezar a estudiar una profesión. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y se muestra muy entusiasta de pertenecer a su grupo comunal por todos son muy unidas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará productos de primera necesidad para abastecer su pequeña tienda.
texts.en:
Rosanna is 24-years-old, single, and lives in a rented house with her 7-year-old son, Johan. She is both father and mother to her little one, and that’s why every day she makes sure he doesn’t lack anything. She works growing coffee, plantains, and avocadoes, which she raises in lands inherited from her mother. Right now she doesn’t have help from any of her family, so she has to hire laborers, who she charges with keeping her fields weeded. What she likes best about her job is harvesting, and she has fun collecting each coffee bean. However, it is hard for her to carry the heavy baskets or sacks of coffee. She considers this activity very profitable, because it allows her to live comfortably and even save some money. On the other hand, she has a store that she would like to grow by adding more products, to achieve more dynamic sales and, with her earnings, go to school to study a career. This is the first time she’s had a loan from MFP, and she shows herself to be very enthusiastic about belonging to a groups, because they all are very united. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy staple goods to stock her store with.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods to stock her store

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es:
EL SR. FLORENTINO  HIJO DE DON CARMELO  Y DE DOÑA BALERIANA. NACIO EL 26 DE ABRIL DE 1990 EN VILLA TUMAVI A 25 KM DE LIMONCITO, TIENE SU PARCELA Y TRABAJA CON SU ESPOSA MODESTA TIENES 4 HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR Y CUANDO NO VAN A LA ESCUELA LO AYUDAN EN LA SIEMBRA Y COSECHA DE SUS PRODUCTOS, SIEMBRAN MAIZ, PAPA, POROTO, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARAN SEMILLAS PARA LA SIEMBRA DE PAPA YA QUE ES TEMPORADA DE SIEMBRA 
UNA VES COSECHADO LO COMERCIALIZAN EN EL MERCADO DE LA ZONA, ESTAN MUY AGRADECIDOS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACAION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Mr. Florentino, son of Mr. Carmelo and Mrs Balieriana, was born on April 26, 1990, in Villa Tumavia, 25 kilometers from Limonicito. He has a piece of land and works with his wife, Modesta. They have 4 school-aged children, and when they aren’t in school, they help in the planting and harvesting of the crops. They sow corn, potatoes, and green beans. With the money from the loan they will buy seeds for planting potatoes since it is now the season. Once harvested they will sell it in the market of their area. They are very thankful for Emprender and Kiva with the confidence shown them by the issuing of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Maqsoodan's Group

texts.en:
Maqsoodan is a wife of H. B. and is a resident of Multan, which is famous for its sweetmeats. She owns a small, two-roomed house and has been living in it with her family for over 30 years.
A very talented lady, Maqsoodan operates a clothes-selling business. She purchases clothes from different cities, such as Lahore and Faisalabad, and sells them to clothes shops. Now she receives orders from her neighbors as well and earns a good profit from them. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband.
Maqsoodan's husband runs a grocery shop in the community. He has five years of experience and now his shop is renowned among his customers. He earns approximately 15,000 PKR from his grocery shop, which is a big support to his family. Maqsoodan is applying for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to invest the capital in her husband’s grocery shop so he can purchase groceries in bulk and increase his profits.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk for her husband's shop

loans.name: Las Miciones Group

texts.es:
este banco de emprendimieto conformado 11 integrantes los cuales en su gran mayoria son oriundos de santa cruz, tarija, chuquisaca, de los 11 integrantes la gran mayoria tiene negocio propio en la localidad de san jose, todos los socios viven en la zona de san jose en distintos barrios, se conocen y se garantizan entre ellos.

La presidenta es la señora Rosmery y se dedica a la actividad d ela venta de ropa desde hace muchos años, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar es una persona responsable y dinamica y fue elegida como presidenta por la solidaridad que demostro con su compañeras de grupo, el dinero dle credito lo utilizara en la compra y renovacion de mercadeia, ya que esta llegando la epoca de invierno. 

Su sueño de este banco de emprendimiento es llegar a ser el  mejor banco de emprendimiento en el cumplimiento de sus cuotas todos los socios son padres de familia y madre de familias que en muchos casos sacan adelante solas  a sus familias, estan muy agradecidos con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
This communal bank has 11 members, the majority of whom are natives of Santa Cruz, Tarija, and Chuquisaca. Of the 11 members, the majority have their own business in the area of San Jose. All of the members live in the San Jose area in different neighborhoods. They know each other, and as a group they guarantee each member's loans. The president is Rosmery, who has had a business selling clothing for many years. She is married and has 2 children who are school-aged. She is a responsible and dynamic person who was elected president of the group for the solidarity she has demonstrated with her fellow group members. She will use this loan to buy merchandise to renew her inventory, since we are approaching the winter season. Her dream for this communal bank is to become the best communal bank in terms of making its payments. All of the members are parents with families, and in many cases they are single parents who are trying to advance their families on their own. They are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence provided in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise (winter clothing)

loans.name: Amina's Group

texts.en:
Amina is a wife of M. S. and lives in the city of Borewala (famous for its shrines), in Pakistan. She is 41 years old and married, with four children: two daughters and two sons. Her elder daughter completed her education till 12th grade and then started teaching in a school for a monthly wage. The others are enrolled in school and are getting an education.

Amina is a very caring lady. She takes care of her family and manages the domestic chores efficiently. She is always ready to help others. She is famous for her hospitality in her neighborhood. Ladies of the community come to her house to share their problems and to get good advice from her.

Her husband operates a medicine selling business. He completes the orders of medical shops and earns income. He has been in this profession for the last twenty years. Now he has developed a good image and built trust with his customers, and the result is that they give him the orders to get the quality items.

Amina is applying for the second time for a loan to invest the capital in her husband’s business so he can purchase more medicines and expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase medicines to sell

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
El Señor Silvio S. ,cliente Nuevo ,  es  persona  muy responsable y muy trabajador como padre, tiene una niña a la cual la cría solo, se dedica a la atención de su despensa; el sale muy temprano para el mercado de abasto a comprar productos frescos para surtir su  Despensa “Despensa S.” tiene muy buena concurrencia de clientes en especial de los vecinos y los mas recurrentes son  las personas que acuden a un del centro de salud que esta ubicado frente de su casa.
Solicita el crédito para la abastecimiento de su local (verduras, frutas, golosinas, enlatados, embutidos, y otros productos)ya que tiene mucha demanda y no tiene capital para satisfacer dicho pedidos.
texts.en:
Mr. Silvio S., a new client, is a very responsible and hardworking person. As a father, he has a daughter who he raises alone. He dedicates himself to his store; he goes out very early to the market to buy fresh products to stock his store, called “Despsensa S.”. He has a great customer base, especially the neighbors and frequent visitors to the health center that is located in front of his home. He is asking for the loan to stock his store (fruits, vegetables, candies, canned goods, and other products) that are in great demand, but he lacks the capital to buy them at this time.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits, vegetables, canned goods, candies, etc.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La Sra. Silvia, vive en casa propia en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí, tiene 47 años de edad y se encuentra casada con don Victor  con el que tiene 3 hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la universidad; ambos trabajan juntos en la confección de chamarras.

El Esposo de la Sra. Silvia y sus hijos son los que se encargan de la confección de las chamarras y doña Silvia se encarga de la venta de las chamarras, la misma que lo realiza de la siguiente manera, las lleva a vender en los departamentos de Potosí Tarija y Sucre.

El crédito solicitado es para la compra de tela paño por rollos en diferentes colores ya que de esa manera puede reducir el costo del material y por ende incrementar el margen de ganancia por chamarra, la sra. Silvia se encuentra muy contenta ya que toda la familia trabaja en este negocio es una persona muy trabajadora siempre piensa en el bienestar de toda su familia, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sra. Siliva lives in her own home in Villa Nuevo Potosí. She is 47 years old and is married to Don Victor. They have three children who are studying at the university. Her family works together manufacturing jackets.

Silvia’s husband and her children are responsible for manufacturing the jackets, while she is in charge of selling them. She takes her products to the Departments of Potosí Tarija and Sucre to sell.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy rolls of woven fabric in different colors so that she can reduce the cost of the material and increase her profit margin per jacket. Sra. Silvia is very happy that all of her family works in this business. She is a hardworking woman who is always thinking about the welfare of her entire family. Silvia is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in her by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rolls of fabric

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines), Pakistan, is the wife of S.. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 25 years.

A very talented lady, Yasmeen operates a decorative embroidery business. She makes embroidery on dresses and also stitches them. Sewing is an additional service she provides to her customers. She receives orders from her neighbors and from her relatives as well. Her work is becoming renowned in her neighborhood and among her relatives. Her business provides major support to her family.

Her husband operates a clothing selling business. He purchases the clothes from different cities such as (Lahore, Faisalabad and Peshawar), because of the quality and cheap prices. He sells the clothing to different areas of the community and also supplies the clothing shops. He has ten years of experience in this business.

Yasmeen is applying for a loan from Asasah, to invest the capital in her husband’s business so he can purchase more clothes and expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Margarita Amanda

texts.es: La Señora Margarita es cliente nueva, ella y su hermana Silviana se dedican a la comercializacion de libros en distintas zonas de la ciudad de La Paz, el modo en la que ellas realizan su trabajo es comprando los libros por lotes y los distribuyen por unidades en las oficinas y otros lugares a credito.  ella vive en casa de sus padres  con sus hermanos , es una persona joven con ganas de superacion.  el destino del credito esta destinado a la compra de un lote de libros que le estan solicitando y como trabaja a credito necesita un doble capital para poder seguir trabajando es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora y esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Margarita is a new client. She and her sister Silviana sell books in different areas within the city of La Paz. They go about performing their job by acquiring books by the batch and distributing them in specified units to offices and other places on credit. Margarita lives at her parents’ house with her siblings. She is a young woman who desires to succeed.

Margarita needs to double her operating capital so that she can continue working. Her loan will be used to buy a batch of books so that she can fulfill her orders. She is a responsible and hardworking woman. Margarita is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in her by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a batch of books to sell

loans.name: Lidia Estela

texts.es:
La Srta.Lidia Estela Velasquez Nunez es soltera hija única de padres Separados, vive con su madre y se halla cursando el 4to año de una carrera universitaria.
 La clienta inicio sus actividades comerciales para poder hacer frente a los gastos que conllevan los estudios y ayudar a su madre. 
Inicio creando en su casa y para sus amigos y conocidos accesorios y bijuterìa como ser collares, aros pulseras, bordado de vestidos de fiestas con canutillos y lentejuelas, la publicidad se fue haciendo de boca en boca por lo que ella habilito un pequeño show room en la sala de su domicilioparticular lo cual le resulto muy exitoso y recibía diariamente múltiples visitas y pedidos por lo que hoy después de 2 años de seguir con el negocio decidió, además de los accesorios de su creación vender prendas de vestir para damas y otras cosas como carteras y calzados, con el crédito otorgado por la Fundación Paraguaya la misma realizaría la apertura formal de su tienda.
texts.en:
Miss Lidia Estela Velasquez Nunez is the only child of her separated parents. She lives with her mother, and is currently in her fourth year of her degree program at the university. This client began her business to be able to cover the costs involved in studying and trying to help out her mother with household expenses at the same time. She began by making jewelry and accessories for her friends at home, like necklaces, earrings, bracelets, and embellishing party dresses. Word of mouth garnered her a lot of attention, so she now has a little showroom in her room, which is very successful, and she has multiple visits and orders each day. After two years of this, she has decided to, along with her accessories, to sell articles of clothing for women, as well as purses and shoes. With the loan provided by Fundación Paraguaya, she will formally open her boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of handbags, shoes, and clothing for women

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase of building materials

loans.name: Sawran's Group

texts.en:
Sawran, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines), Pakistan, is the wife of A. R.. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it for the last 25 years.

A very skillful lady, Sawran operates a business making embroidered dresses. She receives orders for dresses from her relatives and from the neighbors as well. She charges PKR 500 for each embroidered dress. She has been doing this work for the last six years. Her business provides most of the support for her family. She uses her income to pay for the utilities.

Her husband is a loader by profession. He loads different items on his donkey cart and delivers them to the required places to earn income. He has been doing this work for the past five years. Sawran is applying for a loan from Asasah. She will invest the capital in her husband’s business so he can purchase a new cart because the old cart has become rough and rotted, which makes it difficult for him to load items.

loans.use: Purchase a new donkey cart for transporting materials.

loans.name: Kishwar's Group

texts.en:
Kishwar is the wife of Y. and a resident of the Pakistani city of Borewala, which is famous for its shrines. She owns a small, two-roomed house where she has lived with her family for over 15 years. 
Kishwar is a very caring lady who stays at home, manages the household chores, and prepares food for her family. Her husband is a vegetable vendor. He purchases vegetables in bulk from the vegetable market and sells them in various places in the community and also to vegetable shops to earn a profit. Kishwar is applying for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to invest the capital in her husband’s business so he can purchase seasonal vegetables in bulk and expand his business. They hope to earn profit from this loan so that they can open their own vegetable shop and have their own customers.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal vegetables in bulk to sell

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
La Sra. Agripina tiene  47 años, esta casada con el Sr Luis V., tienen tres  hijos, uno D. ellos es menor D. edad. 
Ella se dedica a la venta D. prendas para damas y niños a domicilio.
Trabaja en esta actividad desD. el año 2004.
Este crédito será D. mucha utilidad para ella, pues necesita comprar prendas para la nueva temporada(invierno) para cubrir los pedidos que ya recibió  e incluir también prendas para caballeros en su stock D. mercaderías, ya que sus compradoras le solicitaron tenga disponible también este tipo D. prendas. 
La Sra Agripina está iniciando el proyecto D. abrir un local D. ventas, en el cual anhela poder instruir D. la mejor forma a su hija para que la misma aprenda a ser una persona emprendedora y pueda ser exitosa en la vida.
texts.en:
Agripina is 47 years old. She is married to Luis and they have three children; one still a minor. Agripina does in-home clothing sales for women and children and has been doing this since 2004. This loan will be of great use to her because she needs to buy clothing for the coming season (winter) in order to satisfy her customers’ requests. She also wants to add men’s clothing to her inventory, because her customers have requested it. Agripina is in the process of opening a shop, where she can also teach her daughter to be entrepreneurial and allow her to excel in life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Abida Nighat's Group

texts.en:
Abida nighat, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines) Pakistan, is the wife of M. S.. She owns a small two-roomed house and has been living in it with her family for over ten years. A very hardworking lady, Abida operates a clothes-sewing business. She selected this work because she enjoys doing this work. She learned this art from her mother, the way she was taught her makes her perfect in her work. Her clientele base are her neighbors. She charges from them 100 to 150 Pak Rupees per dress. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. 
Her husband is involved in a vegetable-selling business. He sells vegetables to vegetable shops and also to various areas of the community on his four-wheeled cart. He has been doing this work for over twelve years. 

Abida is applying for a loan from Asasah, to invest the capital in her husband’s business so that he can purchase the vegetables in bulk and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Letty Yolanda

texts.es:
Letty de 55 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, su esposo es comerciante ellos tienen dos hijos que ya no viven con ellos, ella es vendedora Yambal (compañía de venta de cosméticos por catalogo que ayuda a las mujeres del Ecuador a ser vendedoras potenciales con un porcentaje de ganancia). 

Comenzó a ser vendedora Yambal cuando una amiga la inscribió en una charla, después compro algunos cosméticos para ver como le iba vendiendo a sus amigas, por esa buena decisión ahora ella es vendedora, para tener dinero adicional también vende artículos para hogar y ropa. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar ropa y perfumes para vender a sus clientes, en el futuro quiere tener un almacén de productos varios.
texts.en:
Letty is 55 years old and lives in the urban zone of Suburbio de Guayaquil. Her husband is a businessman and they have two [adult] children who no longer live with them. She is a Yambal sales representatives (a cosmetic company that specializes in catalog sales and who pays commissions to their Ecuadorian saleswomen). She bagan as a Yambal saleswoman when a friend spoke to her about it. She then bought a few cosmetics to see how sales to her friends would go. It turned out to be a good decision. She is a good salesperson and she also sells articles for the home and clothing in order to earn extra money. She will use the money from this loan to buy clothing and perfume to sell to her customers. Someday she hopes to have her own general store.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Shahnaz Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz Akhtar, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines), Pakistan, is the wife of M. M. and the mother of six children: three sons and three daughters. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over thirty-years. 

A very caring lady, Shahnaz stays at home, manages the domestic chores and cooks food for her family. Her husband operates an elastic making business. He makes elastic by machine, by filling the threads in the machine. He supplies the elastics in different shops for the market and also sells by going into different areas of the community on his four-wheeled cart. Shahnaz helps him by selling the elastics to neighbors.  

Shahnaz has successfully completed three loans to Asasah and now is applying for the fourth time to invest the capital in her husband’s business. With the funds from the loan, he can purchase the threads in bulk and sell elastics to more customers and generate a good profit from it.

loans.use: To purchase threads in bulk for making elastics.

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Parveen Akhtar, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shriens), Pakistan, is the wife of A. A. and the mother of two sons. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over ten-years. 

A very talented and hard working lady, Parveen operates a carpet weaving business. Her business is the major source of income for the family. All of her family helps and supports her in weaving carpet. They complete their carpet in one month and get approximately 30 to 40 thousand Pak rupees. 
Parveen has successfully completed three loans to Asasah, and now is applying for the fourth time to purchase the required items (tools and threads) to give expansion to her carpet weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase items for carpet weaving.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: EL SR. FELIX  NACIO EL 21 DE FEBRERO DE 1950 EN CHUQUISACA, CASADO CON DOÑA MARIA  CON 3 HIJOS TODOS MAYORES DE EDAD YA INDEPENDIENTES. HACE 20 AÑOS QUE TIENE SU TIERRA EN RANCHO NUEVO A 10KM DE LA CARRETERA DE TIQUIPAYA DONDE TRABAJA EN AGRICULTURA, EL TRABAJA HACE 3 AÑOS CON EMPRENDER Y TODO SUS PRODUCTOS LO SACA A VENDER AL MERCADO DE EL TORNO SIEMBRA VARIEDAD DE PRODUCTOS PERO ES TEMPORADA DE SIEMBRA DE PAPA Y PARA ESO SOLICITO CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE SEMILLAS, ES MUY TRABAJADOR Y SU ESPOSA LE AYUDA EN LA SIEMBRA Y VENTA DE SUS PRODUCTOS, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Sr. Felix was born on February 21, 1950, in Chuquisaca. He is married to Doña Maria and they have three adult children who are independent. For the past 20 years, he has owned farmland in Rancho Nuevo that lies 10km from the Tiquipaya Highway. Felix has worked with Emprender for three years. He grows a variety of products and sells them at the market in El Torno. The season for planting potatoes has arrived and he is requesting a loan to buy seedlings. Felix is a hard worker and his wife helps with planting and selling their products. He is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in him by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potato seedings

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines), Pakistan, is the wife of M. A. and the mother of five children. They all live together in a small house of two rooms where they have lived for the past thirty years. Her first two sons are involved in a vegetable selling business. Her daughters are enrolled in a school and are getting an education.  
Her husband operates a grocery shop in the community. He selected this business because of his four years of sales experience. He opens his shop in the morning at 8 o’clock and closes it at 9pm. Salma also helps him by spending time in his grocery shop with him. In this way they handle the clients and increase the income. The income helps them to manage the financial expenses and to pay the education fees of their kids. 
Salma is applying for a loan for the second time from Asasah. The funds will be used to invest in capital for the grocery shop so they can purchase the groceries in bulk and increase the profit.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for grocery shop.

loans.name: Remberto

texts.es: EL SR. REMBERTO VIVE EN LA LOCALIDAD DE EL TORNO EN EL BARRIO 6 DE MAYO, EN LA CASA DE SU PADRE, SU ACTIVIDAD ES LA DE ALBAÑIL, SU ESPOSA CON LA CUAL TIENE 1 HIJO, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE JUGO DE FRUTAS EN EL MERCADO CENTRAL EL TORNO, EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE JUGO, LA CUAL LE GENERA UN INGRESO EXTRA PARA MANTENER A SU FAMILIA, SE SIENTEN AGRADECIDO CON LA INSTITUCION POR HABERLE BRINDADO EL APOYO ECONOMICO PARA FORTALECER SU CAPITAL QUE POR TANTOS AÑOS HAN REUNIDO, Y ASI DARLE LA COMODIDAD A SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Sr. Remberto lives at his father’s house in the May 6th neighborhood of the town of El Torno. He is a bricklayer by profession. His wife sells fruit juices at the central market in El Torno. They have one son.

This loan will be used to expand his wife’s juice business so that she can generate additional income to help support their family. He is grateful to Emprender for providing the assistance to strengthen the financial capital that he spent many years to acquire so that he can make life easier for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand his wife's juice business

loans.name: Lourdes Iris

texts.es:
la sra. Lourdes Iris D. G. tiene 33 años de edad, vive en el barrio Suyapa en la ciudad de Nacaome.
Lourdes se dedica a la venta de refrescos y golosinas como ser: tacos, enchiladas, baleadas, tortillas con quesillo, burritas de carne, desayunos, etc.
tiene un par de años de tener su negocio. Lourdes dice sentirse muy feliz ya que su negocio esta creciendo cada dia un poco mas, esto se debe a que lourdes atiende a sus clientes personalmente y les brinda un servicio especial.
es muy querida por muchas personas.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar materiales para fabricar sus golosinas, las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su familia y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 33 years old and lives in the Suyapa neighborhood in the city of Nacaome. She sells soft drinks and snacks such as tacos, enchiladas, baleadas, tortillas with cheese, meat burritos, breakfast, etc. She has had this business for two years. She says that she is very happy that her business is growing a bit more each day. This is because Lourdes provides personal and friendly service to her customers. She is loved by many people. She will use the money from this loan to buy supplies and ingredients to make snacks. She needs the income in order to come out ahead with her family and have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines), Pakistan, is the wife of G. M. and the mother of two sons. The elder son works in a factory on monthly wage and the younger one operates a flower shop where he sells fresh flowers. 
A very caring lady, Khalida stays at home to cook food for her family. She cooks food on time and presents it to her family and manages the household chores efficiently. Her husband is involved in a construction supplies selling business. He specifically sells cement to customers because of the high demand from his customers. He has been doing this work for over twenty years.  
Khalida has successfully completed two loans to Asasah. With the loan profit she bought a color television and a bicycle for her son. Now she is applying for the third time to invest the capital in her husband’s business so that he can purchase the cement in bulk and complete the orders of his customers.

loans.use: To purchase cement to complete the customer's orders.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es:
la sra. Olga Marina H. P. tiene 41 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Abajo de la ciudad de Nacaome, Olga se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad en la cual le ha ido muy bien, tiene muchos clientes, su producto lo reparte por los barrios, colonias y caserios cercanos a su casa de habitacion.
sus clientes la prefieren ya que sus tortillas son de buen tamaño y grosor, ademas que su sabor es exquisito.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar leña, cal, harina de maiz y agua para tener una mayor produccion ya que en estos momentos no cubre con todas las exigencias de sus clientes.
las ganancias las necesita para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Olga is 41 years old and lives in the Barrio Abajo neighborhood in the city of Nacaome. She makes and sells tortillas and has been doing this for several years. Things have gone well and she has many customers. She sells her products around the various neighborhoods and hamlets around her home. Her customers prefer her tortillas because they are large and delicious.
