She will use the money from this loan to buy firewood, salt, corn flour and water in order to increase her production, because she cannot currently meet all of her customers’ demands. She needs the income in order to help mover her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a resident of Borewala, Pakistan, a city famous for its shrines.  She is the wife of M. A. and the mother of three kids: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son works in a factory on a monthly wage and the younger is in the 5th standard at school. Her daughter has not reached school-going age yet. 

A very caring lady, Mumtaz stays at home and manages the household chores very efficiently while taking care of her family. Her husband is a driver by profession. He drives a local bus and earns income on monthly basis, but now the financial demands are increasing day by day, and the income is becoming insufficient to meet the expenses.  Therefore, Mumtaz is applying for her first loan from Asasah, which she intends to use to purchase an auto-rickshaw (local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her husband.  This will allow him to increase his income and do his work with full dedication and enthusiasm.

loans.use: To purchase an auto-rickshaw

loans.name: Basilio

texts.es: EL SR. BASILIO NACIO EL 26 DE ENERO DE 1982 EN POTOSI CASADO CON DOÑA FELIPA TIENEN 5 HIJOS EL SR. SOLICITO UN CREDITO PARA LA SIEMBRA DE MAIZ ES PRIMER AÑO QUE EL ESTA TRABAJANDO CON EMPRENDER EL VIVE EN BELEN A 32KM DE SANTA RITA EL SE ENCUENTRA HACE 12 AÑOS CON SU PARCELA DONDE EL VIVE Y TRABAJA	SU ESPOSA LE AYUDA EN LA SIEMBRA Y EN LA VENTA  DE SUS PRODUCTOS, SON UNA PAREJA MUY JOVEN PERO CON 5 HIJOS TIENEN QUE TRABAJAR DURO YA QUE ES EL UNICO INGRESO CON EL QUE CUENTAN, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DLE CREDITO.
texts.en:
Sr. Basilio was born on January 26, 1982, in Potosi. He is married to Doña Felipa and they have five children. Basilio is requesting a loan so that he can grow corn. This is his first year working with Emprender. He lives in Belen, which is 32km away from Santa Rita, and has owned the parcel of land on which he lives and works for the past twelve years. His wife helps with planting and selling their products. They are a very young couple, but with five children, they have to work hard since this is their only source of income.

Basilio is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in him by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds for planting corn

loans.name: Edilberta Nicida

texts.es:
Edilberta es socia del Banco Comunal Kallpanchik, palabra en quechua que significa Nuestra Fuerza. Edilberta es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos.
Edilberta tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende abarrotes en general y verduras, esta actividad la realiza todos los días de lunes a domingo.
Edilberta necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Los sueños de Edilberta son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y su negocio vaya bien.
texts.en:
Edilberta is a member of the Kallpanchik comunal bank. (Kallpanchik means “Our Strength” in the Quechua language.) Edilberta is 31 years old and has two children. She has a store in a rented location, where she sells general groceries and vegetables. She works seven days a week. Edilberta needs a loan of 1,050 PEN ($375) which she will use to invest in various types of cereal. She hopes that her children will be able to complete their studies and that her business does well.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es:
el sr. Carlos Humberto F. G. tiene 31 años de edad, vive en la colonia Altos del Loarque en la ciudad de Nacaome departamento de Valle.
Carlos se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, actividad que tiene varios años de realizar, todos los dias carga su carro de verduras y frutas y sale a repartirlas en diferentes mercaditos, pulperias, caserios, barrios y colonias de la ciudad de Nacaome.
Carlos dice sentirse muy feliz ya que su producto se vende muy bien y tiene buenas ganancias, pero el quiere expanderse mas y buscar otros lugares en el cual repartir su prodcuto, tiene la facilidad de que posee un vehiulo pickup para cargar los vegetales.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas verduras y frutas.
texts.en:
Carlos says that he is happy that his products sell well and he has a good income, but he wants to expand and look for other places in which to distribute his products. He uses his pickup to transport his vegetables. He will use the money from this loan to buy more fruits and vegetables. dica a la venta de frutas y verduras, actividad que tiene varios años de realizar, todos los dias carga su carro de verduras y frutas y sale a repartirlas en diferentes mercaditos, pulperias, caserios, barrios y colonias de la ciudad de Nacaome. Carlos dice sentirse muy feliz ya que su producto se vende muy bien y tiene buenas ganancias, pero el quiere expanderse mas y buscar otros lugares en el cual repartir su prodcuto, tiene la facilidad de que posee un vehiulo pickup para cargar los vegetales. el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas verduras y frutas.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora es socia del Banco Comunal Kallpanchik palabra en quechua que significa Nuestra Fuerza. Teodora es soltera, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos.
Teodora vende verduras de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Nery García de Huamanga, esta actividad la realiza todos los días.
Teodora necesita un préstamo de 750 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de verduras al por mayor para su negocio.
Los sueños de Teodora son que su negocio crezca y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Teodora is 40 years old single, and has three children. She is a member of the Kallpanchik (a word that means “Our Strength” in the Quechua language) communal bank and sells vegetables in the Nery García marketplace in Huamanga. She works every day. Teodora needs a loan of 750 PEN ($275) which she will use to buy vegetables in quantity, in order to improve her business. She hopes to grow her business and provide a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es:
Zenobia es socia del Banco Comunal Kallpanchik, palabra en quechua que significa Nuestra Fuerza. Zenobia es madre soltera, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos.
Zenobia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, también vende frutas, gaseosas y golosinas, esta actividad que realiza todos los días.
Zenobia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de abarrotes en general al por mayor para implementar su negocio.
Los sueños de Zenobia son tener una tienda de ropa y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Zenobia is 42 years old and a member of the Kallpanchik (a word that means “Our Strength” in the Quechua language) communal bank. She is the single mother of three children. Zenobia runs a grocery store from her home where she also sells fruits, soft drinks, and snacks. Zenobia needs a loan of 1,050 PEN ($375) which she will invest in groceries to stock her business. She hopes to, one day, open a clothing store and that her children complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es: Agustina ,de 44 años, vive con sus dos hijas, Lisbeth (22) y Luz (14) , en su casa propia, pues su esposo viaja constantemente al norte del país, donde tiene chacras de arroz.Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir por pedido, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 2 años, con el fin de generar ingresos extras a los múltiples  gastos familiares . Hace algún tiempo se dedicaba netamente al cuidado de sus hijas, pero vio la oportunidad de generar algunos ingresos extras, y así empezó a trabajar, desde la comodidad de su hogar. Eligió  esta labor porque le  permite  permanecer en casa al cuidado de su hija mayor, que es una joven con leve retraso mental . Agustina se siente contenta con su trabajo y siempre atiende  con gentileza a sus vecinas y amigas , quienes son sus principales clientes; y en el futuro espera aumentar sus ganancias, ya que muchas  veces los clientes no le cumplen puntualmente con los pagos de las  prendas.Es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con  sus pagos y no defraudar a su grupo solidario.Agustina tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de  mayor cantidad de ropa para la temporada de invierno que ya  se aproxima.
texts.en:
Agustina is 44 years old and lives with her two daughters, Lisbeth (22) and Luz (14), in her own home. Her husband constantly travels to the north part of the country, where he has rice plantations. For the past two years she’s been taking orders for and selling articles of clothing in order to earn extra income to help with the family expenses. Some time ago she only cared for her daughters, but she saw the opportunity to generate some extra income and began working from the comfort of her home. She elected this work because it allowed her to work from her home and continue to care for her oldest daughter, who is also mentally handicapped. Agustina is happy with her work and always serves her friends and neighbors, who are also her main customers, with generosity. In the future she hopes to increase her income. Many times her customers are late on their payments. This will be her first loan through MFP and she is committed to making her payments on time and not to defraud the group. Agustina plans to invest the money in large quantity of winter clothing, as winter is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Alexis

texts.es:
el sr. Alexis B. L. tiene 29 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Suyapa de la ciudad de Nacaome departamento de Valle. Alexis se dedica a la venta de verduras, tiene poco tiempo de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
todos los dias se levanta temprano para cargar su carro pickup de verduras y salir a venderlas en diferentes barrios, colonias y caserios en donde no llegan muchas personas que venden verduras, es por eso que tiene muchos clientes y le gustaria llegar mas lejos ya que este es un buen negocio, las personas consumen muchas verduras todos los dias porque son muy nutritivas.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas verduras y asi poder tener mejores ventas.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con todos los gastos de su hogar y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Alexis is 29 years old and lives in the Suyapa neighborhood in the city of Nacaome, located in the Valle department. She sells vegetables, but has not been doing this for very long. She rises early every morning in order to load her pickup truck with vegetables, and then sell them in various neighborhoods and homes where few people go to sell vegetables. This is why she has many customers. She would like to be able to travel farther, as this is a good business. People eat many vegetables daily because they are nutritious. She will use the money from this loan to buy more vegetables so that she can increase her sales. She needs the money in order to pay for household expenses and help to move her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel es socia del Banco Comunal Kallpanchik palabra en quechua que significa Nuestra Fuerza. Maribel es casada, tiene 33 años y 5 hijos.
Maribel tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende discos, CD, actividad que realiza todos los días junto a su esposo. Además Maribel vende ropa.
Maribel necesita un préstamo de 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de discos. Maribel sueña con ampliar su negocio y dividirlo a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maribel is a member of the Kallpanchik (a word that means “Our Strength” in the Quechua language) communal bank. She is 33 years old, married and has five children. Maribel has a store in a rented location, where she sells records and CDs. She does this every day alongside her husband. She also sells clothing. Maribel needs a loan of 900 PEN ($325) which she will use to buy records. She hopes to be able to expand her business and divide it up among her children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CDs and Records

loans.name: Rossini

texts.es:
Rossini es socia del Banco Comunal Kallpanchik, palabra en quechua que significa Nuestra Fuerza. Rossini es conviviente y tiene 22 años.
Rossini tiene una tienda en la casa de sus padres en donde vende abarrotes en general, además Rossini vende chicharrones en el mercadillo de su distrito.
Rossini necesita un préstamo de 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de abarrotes. Rossini sueña tener su negocio surtido de productos.
texts.en:
Rossini is 22 years old married, and a member of the Kallpanchik (a word that means “Our Strength” in the Quechua language). She runs a grocery store from her parents’ home and also sells fried pork rinds in her district’s marketplace. Rossini needs a loan of 900 PEN ($325). She will use the money from this loan to buy more groceries. She hopes to be able to offer a wider assortment in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es:
Gisela es socia del Banco Comunal Kallpanchik que significa Nuestra Fuerza en quechua. Gisela es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 3 hijos.
Gisela tiene mototaxis que da en alquiler diariamente, actualmente tiene 4 unidades, Gisela se encarga de la administración.
Gisela necesita un préstamo de 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de seguros para su moto.  Los sueños de Gisela son comprar carros y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gisela is 33 years old and a member of the Kallpanchik (a word that means “Our Strength” in the Quechua language) communal bank. She has three children. Gisela has four mototaxies which she rents out daily. She needs a loan of 900 PEN ($325) which she will use to buy insurance for her motorcycle. She hopes to one day be able to buy cars and help her children to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Insurance

loans.name: Leyla Marina

texts.es:
la señora Leyla Marina A. tiene 26 años de edad, vive en el barrio San Jose de la ciudad de San Lorenzo Valle. vive en union libre con el Sr. Edwin N., el se dedica al negocio de transporte de personas.

la señora Leyla tiene una pulperia en su casa, esta ubicado en un buen lugar, muy transitado.
el credito lo utilizara para poder comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir su nagocio mas, ya que cada dia que pasa su negocio esta creciendo igual sus clientes y tiene que tenerlo bien surtido para complacer todas las exigencias de sus clientes.
su sueño es tener un mercadito bien equipado.
texts.en:
Leyla is 26 years old and lives in the San Jose neighborhood in the city of San Lorenzo Valle. She lives with her partner, Edwin, who is in the business of providing personal transportation. Leyla runs a general store from her home. It’s in a good, well traversed location. She will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise to be able to better stock her business. It grows more each day, as does the number of her customers, so she needs to provide a wider assortment in order to meet her customers’ demands. She wants to have a well equipped market.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: William Antonio

texts.es:
William es socio del Banco Comunal Musuq Rumi, palabra en quechua que significa Nueva Piedra. William es soltero, tiene 25 años y vive con sus padres.
William tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García de Huamanga en donde vende carne, ella compra los animales para la venta de las ferias, actividad que realiza todos los días.
William necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en al compra de ganado. Los sueños de William son comprar una casa y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
William is a member of the “Musuq Rumi” (a word that means “new rock” in the Quechua language) communal bank. He is 25 years old, single, and lives with his parents. He has a stall in the “Nery García de Huamanga” market, where he sells meat. He buys the animals daily at fairs. William needs a loan of 1,000 PEN ($375) in order to invest in livestock. He would someday like to buy a house and improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es:
La familia de Nancy  tiene un negocio de confecciones  fabrican sabanas y cortinas  ella  trabaja  en la sección corte y a la vez dirige al personal que allí labora, las ganancias que obtiene por su trabajo las ahorra por que su mayor anhelo es  comprarse un terreno para construir su propia casa  y acondicionar un lugar para dedicarse a la venta de comidas con su propio restaurante.
Nancy  es la presidenta del grupo “SANTA ROSA” ya lleva en el cargo 2 años, son 10 socias todas  vecinas del mismo lugar, su préstamo  reciente  lo usara para empezar a vender  algunos platos típicos  y así  emprender su  sueño de tener su restaurante ella sabe que en futuro le ira muy bien por que tiene muchas amistades que disfrutan de su sazón. 

*La Sra., Nancy es la primera de las sentadas esta con buzo negro
texts.en:
Nancy’s family owns a business that manufactures bed linens and curtains. She is responsible for cutting the material as well as managing the staff who work there. Her greatest wish is to use her savings and the revenue generated from her business to buy a plot of land for building her own house and opening a restaurant where she can sell food.

Nancy is the President of the “Santa Rosa” Group and was elected to this position two years ago. The group has ten members who are all neighbors from the same area. Her most recent loan will be used to start selling traditional dishes since her dream is have her own restaurant. She knows that she will do well in the future because she has many friends who enjoy her cooking.

*Sra. Nancy is the first person seated wearing a black pullover.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies to start a food business

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ms. Ramona I. M., 41 years old, is a native of the city of Carapeguá and has been married for 23 years to Mr. José María Lopez Galeano, who is a 46-year-old native.  They have 4 children, 2 of whom are school-aged while two are adults.

Ms. Ramona got married very young and together with her husband went to work abroad for many years, so that they could gather a little capital to construct their house.  Moreover, they also set up a small sewing shop.

Today, Ramona manufactures all types of clothes. It has been more than 10 years since she decided on this line of work and thanks to her efforts, two of her children are in college.

She wants to buy a sewing machine and this is the reason she has approached our institution to request a loan.

loans.use: A sewing machine, as well as fabrics, thread, and zippers

loans.name: Kaniz's Group

texts.en:
Kaniz, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan, is the wife of M. I. and owns a small house of two rooms where she has been living with her family for over twenty-five years. 

A very talented lady, Kaniz operates her clothes-sewing business. She sews clothes for her neighbors and after seeing her steadily progress, her relatives have also started giving her orders. The best part of her work is that she takes good measurements and stitches well so that people feel good when they wear the outfits. She charges 100 to 150 Pak Rupees from her clients. 

Kaniz is applying for a loan from Asasah, to invest the capital in her own business so she can purchase an electric sewing machine and sew more clothes in a timely fashion.

loans.use: Purchase an electric sewing-machine

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Mr. Cesar Benitez, 30 years old, is single and lives with his parents in a neighborhood called Aguai`y in the city of Carapeguá. 

Coming from a humble family and having the desire to study and become a professional led Cesar to start his own small business.  He started selling clothes and shoes in the urban areas of his city and in no time he was able to earn more money, enabling him to buy more types of products to sell in the capital and to form a steady clientele. Thanks to his job and his efforts, he was able to buy a motorcycle, which he uses to complete his sales and to satisfy his clientele’s needs. 

He is requesting this loan so that he can buy hammocks, blankets, men’s belts (fajas) and sheets.

loans.use: to buy blankets, bedcovers, tablecloths and sheets

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.en:
Mr. Gustavo C. C. lives in the city of Roque González in his own home. For several years now, he has been dedicated to selling artisan products such as bedcovers, hammocks and tablecloths in other cities. 

With many orders to fill, Gustavo approached Fundacion Paraguaya to request a loan that would allow him to satisfy the demands of his clients.

loans.use: operating costs to run his business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Héctor

texts.en:
Héctor O., a 47-year-old native of the city of Roque González, has been married for 23 years to Petrona Fleitas, who is 50 years old. They have five children; their two youngest are in school and their three oldest are professionals. 

Twenty years ago with help from Petrona, Héctor started his own small store in his home. At the same time he was studying to finish his teaching degree. Now, aside from his business, Hector receives a wage that helps him attain a higher household income.

Thanks to the great location of his business, his store is usually very busy with customers. He would like more capital to buy more products so that he can satisfy the needs of his clientele. He came to Fundacion Paraguaya  to ask for a loan so he can buy flour, rice, noodles, bread products, dairy products, meat and other necessary products.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, noodles, bread products, dairy products, meat and other necessary products

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.en:
Mr. Ignacio B., 27 years old, is single and lives with his mother in the city of Carapeguá. 

From a very young age, he began to weave with his mother and to sell their products in surrounding cities. Today he is self-employed and has a large, formal base of clients. Thanks to his work he was able to buy his own vehicle and can also help his mother with her bills. 

He is requesting a loan to buy hammocks, blankets, and bed sheets as he has many orders for these types of products.

loans.use: to purchase quilts, blankets, tablecloths, and bed sheets

loans.name: Julio Carlos

texts.en:
Mr. Julio O. is from the city of Carapeguá. For many years he has owned a bookstore in Carapeguá in which he also makes many photocopies. It is located in front of an educational institution. 

The business has a strong clientele, thanks to its location and the great customer service offered. 
 
Mr. Julio O.  is requesting a loan so that he can make the improvements in his store that will provide more comfort for his customers.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and other materials to make improvements in store

loans.name: Lucio

texts.en:
Mr. Lucio G., 54 years old, lives in the neighborhood of Tajy Loma in the city of Carapeguá where he is a traveling merchant with more than 10 years of experience selling blankets.  He is married to Ms. Sonia Santacruz, who weaves the blankets. 

Ms. Santacruz weaves the blankets according to the orders she receives. 

Mr. G. comments that he has more than 200 formal clients, thanks to his good quality products, and because weekly he conducts his sales in the Nemby and Villarrica zones. 

Due to the great quantity of orders, he has asked for a loan to buy different types and colors of thread to make more blankets, which he can then sell.

loans.use: To buy various colors and types of thread, like wool, for making blankets

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines) Pakistan and the wife of A. R., owns a small two-room house where she has been living with her family for over ten years. A very caring lady, Najma manages the household chores and prepares food for the family, always keeping a smile on her face which gives her husband the motivation to move ahead to improve their circumstances. She has given birth to four children: two sons and two daughters, all attending school.

For over six years Najma's husband has been selling fruits on his four-wheeled cart to various areas of the community, and hopes one day to have his own fruit shop. Najma is applying for a loan from Asasah so he can purchase additional fruits and increase his business income.

loans.use: To purchase fruits to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Materials and supplies

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad tiene 40 años, está casada con Senobio de 48 años, con quien tiene cinco hijos, juntos viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en la ciudad de Santa Ana. Hace mas de 10 años se dedica al cultivo de plátanos y café, asimismo  compra y vende plátanos en un lugar disponible dentro de su domicilio; mientras que su esposo trabaja como operario en los fundos de la zona, ganando S/. 20.0 soles diario. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es tener tiempo suficiente para recolectar leña y preparar los alimentos de sus hijos, pues le gusta que ellos estén bien atendidos y sobre todo que aprendan de este oficio y más adelante puedan ayudar a crecer sus ventas.
De las ganancias que perciben esta pareja, podrán construir su casa e instalar una bodega en donde pueda vender bananas. Para soledad esta actividad le será de importancia para que pueda ofrecer a sus hijos una adecuada calidad de vida. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y como ya conoce la metodología de trabajo de su grupo comunal, se siente muy a gusto laborar con los integrantes, quienes siempre están pendientes del progreso de cada uno de ellos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de plátanos para dinamizar su negocio.
texts.en:
Soledad is 40 years old and is married to 48 year old Senobio. They have five children and live in a rented home located in the city of Santa Ana. For the past ten years, Soledad has been raising bananas and coffee. She also buys and sells bananas from her home, while her husband works as on an estate, earning only 20 PEN a day. What she likes the most about her business is that it gives her enough time to gather firewood to be able to cook for her children. She wants them to be well cared for and to later learn this trade and help to grow the business. With the income this couple is expecting, they will be able to build a home of their own and open a store where they can sell bananas. For Soledad, this is important because it will allow her to give a better quality of life to her children. This will be her fifth loan through MFP and since she is already familiar with how the communal group works, she feels comfortable working alongside its members, who always look out for each other. She will use the money from this loan to buy more bananas, in order to be able to diversify her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bananas

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines), Pakistan, is the wife of N.. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for the past 20 years. 

A very caring and talented lady, Nazia manages the domestic chores and prepares food for her family, then she goes to the grocery shop of her husband and helps him by dealing with the customers. They are in this way helping each other in order to generate good income.
  
They have four children, three sons and one daughter. All of them are enrolled in school except the younger son, who is not of school-going age yet. 
 
Nazia is applying for a loan from Asasah, a Kiva partner, to invest the capital in their grocery shop so they can purchase groceries in bulk, maintain their customers and generate a good profit.

loans.use: Purchase groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is a resident of Boreawla, Pakistan, which is famous for its shrines. She is the wife of S. A.. She owns a 3-room house, which she has lived in with her family for more than 30 years. 
 
A very talented lady, Sakina operates a business selling vegetables. She sells the vegetables at her home. She places them in the corner of the garage, and her neighbors come to her to purchase the vegetables. She has been doing this work for more than three years. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband.
 
Her husband is a rickshaw driver. A rickshaw is a local three-wheeled motor vehicle. He has been in this profession for the past five years. He generates an income of PKR 500 per day. They both use their income to manage their family's financial expenses and to save some money for rainy days.
  
Sakina is applying for a loan from Asasah so that she can invest in her vegetable selling business by purchasing more vegetables. Expanding her business will help her generate a good income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela , de 37 años , vive con su pareja y sus 2 pequeños hijos. Todos juntos viven en su casa que es propia.Se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral (pollos), lo cuales compra cuando estan  pequeños (por su bajo precio) y los alimenta hasta engordarlos.Cuando los pollos ya estan crecidos  los vende a un precio mucho mayor. En esta pequeña empresa esta asociada con su cuñada con quien trabaja para sacar su negocio adelante, pues deben estar pendientes de los pollos recien salidos del cascarón, que son delicados y necesitan mayor atención. En las jaulas que tienen han habilitado  bebederos de agua y comida,  para orden y comodidad de las  aves.  Graciela se siente muy contenta y espera ampliar sus criaderos, además quiere comprar más cantidad de pollos , para lograr los ingresos necesarios para el bienestar de su familia.Es su primer préstamo con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual con sus pagos ya que  no quiere  defraudar a su grupo solidario.Tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  una nueva parvada, para de esta manera  aumentar sus ventas y ganancias .
texts.en:
Graciela is 37 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband and two small children. She raises and sells poultry. She buys chicks, raises them and sells them at a profit. She runs this small company along with her sister-in-law and they work together to move the business ahead. They must pay special attention to the newly hatched chicks, as they are delicate and need lots of attention. They have installed food and water dispensers in the chicken coops, for the birds’ comfort. Graciela is very happy and she hopes to expand her operation and would also like to buy more chicks in order to be able to earn enough income to be able to provide for her family’s well being. This will be her first loan through MFP and she is committed to making her payments on schedule, so as not to defraud the group. She will use the money from this loan to buy more feed in order to be able to increase her sales and income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Chickens

loans.name: Sara Concepcion

texts.es:
la sra. Sara Concepcion C. O. tiene 32 años de edad, vive en la Aldea Lazaro de la ciudad de San Lorenzo departamento de Valle.
Sara se dedica  a la compra y venta de lacteos como ser: quesillo, queso y mantequilla., tiene poco tiempo de realizar este tipo de actividad, la cual es muy buena ya que los lacteos son un producto que se venden muy bien, por motivos de falta de capital no puede comprar lacteos al por mayor.
en esta zona de San Lorenzo se producen buenos lacteos, tienen muy buen sabor.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de lacteos al por mayor y asi tener mejores ventas y mayores ganancias, las cuales las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Sara es una mujer con muchos deseos de superacion.
texts.en:
Sara is 32 years old and lives in the Lazaro hamlet in the city of San Lorenzo, in the Valle department. Sara buys and sells milk products, such as cheeses and butter. She’s been doing this for a short time, but milk products sell very well. The milk products produced in this area are of very good quality and have a good flavor. She is unable to buy larger quantities because she lacks sufficient working capital. She will use the money from this loan to buy milk products in bulk and be able to increase her income, which she needs in order to cover her household expenses and provide a better quality of life for her family. Sara has a great desire to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Milk products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Doña Susana, de 50 años, está casada con Felipe de 66 años, juntos viene en su casa propia, ambos tienen 9 hijos, quienes ya trabajan y viven de manera independiente pero habitan cerca en la localidad Dos de Mayo. Hace más de 25 años, se dedican a cuidar los cultivos de café, plátanos y palta que están sobre sus propios terrenos y en época de cosecha, su esposo la ayuda en la recolección de su producción e incluso puede calcular cuanto de ganancias obtendrá al comercializarlos, sin embargo lo más pesado es tener que cargar y transportar su cosecha al punto de venta. Para ella la agricultura le es rentable, gracias a eso ha podido educar a sus hijos y brindarles una adecuada calidad de vida, asimismo pudo comprar el espacio donde viven actualmente y son muy felices. Con el tiempo espera comprar chacras para plantar café y así incrementar su productividad, ya que esto le asegurará una vejez tranquila al lado de sus queridos hijos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y está feliz de ser parte de un grupo tan bien conformado, donde todos sus integrantes se dan la mano ante cualquier dificultad, por eso le agrada laborar a lado de ellos. Con el crédito que solicita, acopiará café de sus vecinos, en donde los hará secar para luego revenderlo.
texts.en:
Susana is 50 years old. She is married to 66 year old Felipe and they have nine adult children who live near the “Dos de Mayo” neighborhood. For the past 25 years she has been raising coffee, bananas, and avocados on their own land. Her husband helps her with the harvest and figures out how much they will earn from the sale. The most difficult part is transporting the harvest to the point of sale. For her, farming is profitable, and she has been able to provide an education and provide an adequate quality of life for her children. It also allowed her to be able to buy the space in which they currently live and they are very happy. Eventually she would like to buy fields where she can raise coffee and increase her production and help to ensure that she can live comfortably in her old age, alongside her children. This will be her second loan through MFP and she is happy to be able to be a part of such a well formed group, where all of its members lend a hand during any difficulty. She will use the money from this loan to buy coffee from her neighbors, which she will dry and resell.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Coffee for resale

loans.name: Eriberto Antonio

texts.es:
Don Heriberto es un hombre trabajador, desde su juventud ayudaba a sus padres a trabajar,  tiene la edad de 57 años y labora para el ejército de Nicaragua como mecánico. Vive junto a su esposa sus hijos son independiente, con los financiamiento ha logrado hacer las mejoras de su casa lo que para el es una sastifaccion el bienestar familiar.
 Con el crédito mejorara la parte de atrás de su casa que aun la tiene parte forrada con zinc viejo ya que no logro terminarla por falta de dinero. Lo que espera cerrarla para mejor seguridad. Me beneficia en el solar que mi vecina tiene un muro lo que a futuro cerrara el otro lado de su terreno para reguardar su propiedad.
texts.en:
Heriberto is a hard worker. He’s been helping his parents since he was a child. He is now 57 years old and works as a mechanic for the Nicaraguan army. He lives with his wife. His children are fully grown. He has been able to make improvements to his home through the loans he has obtained, which makes him happy because it helps provide for the well being of his family. He will use the money from this loan to improve the rear portion of his home, which is formed in part with old zinc sheet metal. He was not able to complete it due to lack of funds. He wants to close it off in order to make it more secure. He benefits from his neighbor’s wall and in the future he will close off the rest of his property.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Benicio Alcidez

texts.es:
el sr. Benicio S. vive en la Aldea Lazaro en la ciudad de San Lorenzo Valle, Benicio tiene 30 años de edad.
el se dedica a la crianza de cerdos para venta, tiene poco tiempo de realizar este tipo de actividad, Benicio es una persona muy activa y tiene muchos deseos de salir adelante. dice sentirse muy feliz ya que este tipo de actividad le gusta mucho hacerla, espera que para fin de año tener muchos chanchitos para la venta, la epoca de fin de año es muy buena para la venta de cerdo.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de cerdos y alimentos para cerdos.
texts.en:
Benicio lives in the Lazaro hamlet of the city of San Lorenzo Valle. He is 30 years old and raises hogs. He has only been doing this for a short time, but he is very active and possesses a great desire to get ahead. He says that he is very happy because he likes doing this. He hopes that he will have many piglets to sell by the end of the year. The end of year season is a good time for hog sales. He will use the money from this loan to buy hogs and feed.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hogs and feed

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es:
María de 63 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, tiene 6 hijos, por la falta de oportunidades y la idea de tener su propio negocio decidió vender productos alimenticios como Quaker, aliños, granos etc. Pero por el sector donde vive ya habían muchas tiendas, y tuvo que terminar con las ventas. Pero María no se rindió y compro carne de chancho para hacer un plato típico del Ecuador es la “Fritada” ( el plato tiene carne de chancho, mote, cebollas).

Ahora María vende de lunes a sábado “Fritada” desde las 13h00 hasta las 20h00, en ocasiones su esposo le ayuda. Tiene un pequeño puesto afuera de su casa para vender la “Fritada”. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, bloques para arreglar su casa. En el futuro quiere tener un restaurante y poder construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
María is 63 years old and lives in urban part of a suburb of Guayaquil. She has six children. Because of a lack of other opportunities, she decided to start a business selling Quaker brand food, grains, etc. Even though there were already many other stores in her area, and she had to terminate this venture, María did not give up. She bought some pork in order to cook “fritada,” a typical Ecuadorean dish. Now María has a small stand outside her home where she sells fritada Monday through Saturday from 1:00 pm to 8:00 pm. Her husband also helps her. She will use the money from this loan to buy cement and cinder blocks to fix up her home. Someday she would like to open a restaurant and make more improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Lourdes Yaquelin

texts.es:
la sra. Lourdes Yaquelin E. O. tiene 43 años de edad, vive en la aldea Lazaro de la ciudad de San Lorenzo departamento de Valle, Lourdes se dedica a la produccion y venta de pan casero como ser rosquillas, quesadilla, torta. tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
este pan es bien vendido en su comunidad, en estos momentos no se da abasto para cubrir con todas las necesidades de sus clientes.
necesita el credito para comprar mas materiales para la fabricacion de los panes.
su pan se caracteriza por tener un buen sabor.
las ganancias las necesita para sacar adelante a a su familia.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 43 years old and lives in the Lazaro hamlet of the city of San Lazaro, in the Valle department. She makes and sells homemade bread and also rosquillas, quesadillas, and tortas. She has been doing this for several years and her bread is very tasty and sells very well within her community. At the moment she does not have the necessary stock to meet all of her customers’ demands. She needs this loan in order to buy additional bread-making ingredients and supplies. She needs the income in order to be able to provide for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and ingredients

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 39 años, vive con su pareja y sus 4 hijos pequeños.Juntos viven en su casa que es propia.Esta trabajadora mujer se dedica desde hace algún tiempo a la venta de ropa, actividad que realiza en  su casa. Su negocio lo maneja  de la siguiente manera : entrega  pedidos a la clientela, que usualmente son sus amigas y vecinas de barrio , pues la zona por donde vive es de dificil acceso , es por esta razón que a todas sus vecinas se les hace muy difícil salir a comprarlas al mercado del lugar . También destina una parte de su mercadería al norte del país donde tiene  familiares,  para que ellos mismos realicen las ventas en ese lugar . A María  le gusta mucho su trabajo pues puede realizarlo en los ratos libres y así puede dedicarse a su familia. En el  futuro  tiene pensado seguir mejorando su negocio e instalar una  tienda estable de ropa o un bazar.Es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual con sus pagos y no quiere defraudar a su grupo solidario.Tiene pensado destinar el dinero del crédito en la compra de  ropa para de esta manera aumentar sus ingresos y seguir progresando.
texts.en:
María is 39 years old and lives with her partner and their 4 young children in their own home. This hardworking woman has been selling clothing out of her home for some time now. Her business is driven by orders from customers, who are usually her friends and neighbors. Her neighborhood is not easy to access and, for this reason, all her neighbors have difficulty going out to buy products. She also sends part of her merchandise to the north of the country where she has relatives that can carry out her sales in this area. María really enjoys her work as she can accomplish it in her spare time and still take care of her family. In the future, she is thinking about improving her business and installing an established clothing store or a variety store. This is the first loan she has had with MFP and she promised to be on time with her repayments as she doesn’t want to disappoint her solidarity group. She is thinking of using the money from the loan to buy clothing in order to improve her earnings and continue to develop.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing in order to stock up her business.

loans.name: Oreine Rebeca

texts.es:
Oreine de 59 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, es viuda pero tiene un hijo. Ella empezó con un puesto de comida, pero como no tenia mucha clientela tuvo que cerrarlo su negocio, y empezar otro. Invirtió lo que le quedaba de dinero en vivieres, y en la adecuación de su casa para construir un local para la tienda. 

En la actualidad ella tiene 5 años con la tienda, trabaja todos los días sola, vende las bebidas desde $ 1.60, detergentes a $ 1.10, aceites a $ 2.3. Una de las dificultades que tiene para atender el negocio es que a veces se enferma y como trabaja sola pierde esos días dinero. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas, jabones, aceite para su tienda. En el futuro quiere ampliar y darle una mejor presentación a la tienda.
texts.en:
Oreine is 59 years old and lives in a suburb of Guayaquil. She is widowed and has one son. She began with a food stand, but as she didn’t have many customers, she had to close her business and start another. She used what was left of her money to improve her home making it suitable to build an area for a store. Currently, she has owned the store for 5 years. She works alone every day. She sells drinks from $ 1.60, detergent from $ 1.10, oils from $ 2.30. One of the difficulties that she has is attending to the store when she is sick. As she works alone, she is forced to lose a days earnings. With the loan, she would like to buy drinks, soap and oil for her store. In the future, she hopes to expand the store and improve its appearance.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drinks, soap and oils.

loans.name: Iveth Ondina

texts.es:
la sra. Iveth Ondina A. G. tiene 27 años de edad, vive en la aldea Agua Caliente en San Lorenzo.
Iveth se dedica al comercio, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion, la cual tiene desde hace poco tiempo.
en este momento Iveth necesita capital para poder surtir su pulperia ya que los tiempos han mejorado y las ventas estan siendo mucho mejor.
todos los dias se levanta muy temprano a atender a sus clientes y cierra de noche, sus clientes la prefieren ya que ella misma los atiende y les da un servicio especial a cada uno de ellos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia y asi poder surtir mas su pulperia.
ella es una mujer joven y tiene muchos deseos de superacion y de sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Iveth Ondina A. G. is 27 years old and lives in the village of Agua Caliente in San Lorenzo. Iveth is a businesswoman. For the past little while, she has owned a small store which she runs out of her home. Currently, Iveth needs capital in order to restock her store now that times have improved and sales are up greatly. Every day, she gets up very early to attend to her customers and doesn’t close until night. Her customers prefer her to attend them personally and she gives each of them individual service. The loan will be used to buy merchandise in order to resupply her store. She is a young woman and she has a great drive to improve and help her family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a type of fritter, drinks, candy, rice, sugar, coffee, tortillas, corn flower, wheat flower, toilet paper, sanitary napkins, soup, powdered drinks, tooth paste, sauces, chilies, salt, condiments, cookies, eggs, batteries, candles, matches.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dominga Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Dominga es una mujer trabajadora, madre de tres hijos. Su esposo es albañil y de noche trabaja como guarda de seguridad para lograr mejores ingresos,  juntos han logrado apoyar a sus hijos. Su negocio es la venta de tortilla lleva varios años vendiendo, comenzó con dinero propio y con poco las ventas. Con los años ha invertido más ya que palmea tortillas los tres tiempos. Con el crédito anterior logro embaldosar su casa y con este financiamiento terminara de cerrar un porche pequeño que ya esta haciendo la obra, muy contenta por lograr las mejoras de su pequeña casa con esfuerzo de sus hijos, su esposo ya que todos cooperan para el bienestar común.
texts.en:
Dominga is a hard working woman, the mother of three children. Her husband is a bricklayer and he works night as a security guard to obtain more income. Together they have been able to support their children. Her business is selling tortillas. She has been doing this for several years. She started with her own money and with few sales. Through the years she has invested more since she palms the tortillas three times. With the previous loan, she was able to put flooring in her home and with this loan she will finish closing in a small porch that is already under construction. She is very happy to make these improvements on her small house with the hard work of her children and her husband, since allof them cooperate for their common wellbeing.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will finish buying construction materials to finish a small porch and make the improvement

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora tiene 48 años, es una mujer muy emprendedora y caritativa, está casada con Jorge de 64 años, juntos tienen 8 hijos pero sólo vive con 6 de ellos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la carpintería, empezando desde muy temprano, en donde su esposo realiza los diseños, cortando la madera y dar forma a los muebles, mientras Teodora se dedica a dar el acabado necesario, lijando puertas, ventanas, ropero, armario, escritorio, cama, entre otros. Lo que más le agrada es trabajar en compañía de su esposo, pues afirma que esta convivencia como compañeros de trabajo y pareja los ha unido más, compartiendo logros y derrotas. Esta oficio le es muy rentable porque con las ganancias pudieron pagar la educación de sus hijos, comprar terrenos, construir su casa, además adquirieron un moto carro que alquilan y les facilita otros ingresos adicionales. Es por ello que se siente muy entusiasmada, en ampliar su carpintería, además espera terminar de construir más habitaciones en su vivienda. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y se muestra muy entusiasta de continuar laborando en su grupo comunal, en donde es presidenta de la junta directiva de su grupo. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará madera para continuar fabricando muebles.
texts.en:
Teodora is 48 years old. She is a very enterprising and charitable woman. She is married to Jorge, who is 64. Together they have 8 children but she only lives with 6 of them in her own home. She works in carpentry. She starts very early. Her husband makes the designs, cutting the wood and giving form to the furniture, while Teodora does the necessary finishings: sanding doors, windows, dressers, desks, beds, among others. What she likes the most is working in her husband's company. She affirms that being co-workers has united the couple more, sharing accomplishments and failures. This profession is very profitable because with the earnings they were able to pay for their children's education, buy land, build their house, and buy a motorcycle cab that they rent and which brings in extra income. This is why she is very enthusiastic about growing the carpentry shop; she also hopes to finish building more rooms in her residence. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she is very enthusiastic about continuing to work in her community group, where she is president of the board of directors. With the loan she is asking for, she will buy wood to continue making furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more wood

loans.name: Lina Marcela

texts.es:
Lina Marcela A. es una joven diseñadora de 24 años vive en Bogotá, su negocio es diseñar bolsos, calzados que manda a fabricar y luego promociona mediante su guía especializada. 

Hace 2 años   incursionó en el medio para el cual se había preparado e inició  su propia línea de sandalias y zapatos, que actualmente distribuye en las ciudades de Barranquilla, en el departamento del Atlántico, Valledupar y el Municipio de Codazzi en el departamento del Cesar, así fue como con  la ayuda de su familiares y amigos de confianza en Septiembre del 2009  viajó a Bogotá a vivir en casa de una hermana y desde ese momento abrió su venta de bosos y zapatos por catálogos, con su propia marca “LinA.”   dándole buenos resultados  en su negocio que es el diseño, la distribución y venta de calzado. En la actualidad está solicitando su primer crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, pues quiere mayor apertura de su mercado y necesita comprar en volumen materia prima especialmente cuero, para la fabricación de  bolsos y zapatos en su nueva colección.
 
Lina es una joven que sueña  con  crecer profesional y empresarialmente mente para ayudar a su familia, además quiere  tener su propio taller y  tiendas  de calzado con empleados. Pues en algunas ocasiones  enfrenta el desafío de incumplimiento en la fabricación de sus diseños.
texts.en:
Lina Marcela A. is a young 24-year old designer who lives in Bogotá. Her business involves designing handbags and shoes that she then has made and promotes through her specialized catalog. It has been 2 years since she entered into the arena that she prepared for, and started her own line of sandals and shoes. She currently distributes these in the city of Barranquilla, in the Atlántico department, Valledupar, and the Codazzi municipality in the Cesar department. This is how, with the help of trusted family and friends, she traveled to Bogotá in September of 2009 to live with her sister. Since that instance, she started selling bags and shoes by catalog from her own line called “LinA.”, with good results. Her business includes the design, distribution and sale of footwear. Currently, she is requesting her first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, as she would like greater access to her markets. She needs to buy a greater quantity of raw materials, especially leather, in order to make the handbags and shoes in her new collection. Lina is a young woman who dreams of growing as a professional and entrepreneur in order to help her family. In addition, she would like to have her own workshop and shoe stores staffed by employees. In some instances, she has faced the challenge of her designs not being fabricated.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy prime material in volume, especially leather, for making the handbags and shoes in her new collection.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro es un padre de familia de 65 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el caserío Mondragón del distrito de Olmos, una distrito agrícola y comercial caracterizado por tener a la mayoría de su población concentrada en pequeñas áreas rurales dispersas, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años al cultivo de maracuyá, un cultivo con bastante acogida en la zona, los agricultores se han empezado a agrupar hace años para colocar sus productos en el mercado con mas facilidad, ahora existen unas pequeñas asociaciones de agricultores que se apoyan entre si y que cosechan las frutas varias veces al año, sobretodo en época de producción, que es cuando se extrae varias veces por mes.

Pedro desea aplicarle a su cultivo algunos nutrientes y fertilizantes que mejoren su producción, de modo que pueda asegurarse buenas ganancias con las cuales pueda sacar adelante a su familia, es por este motivo que ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.	

Pedro es un agricultor que gusta mucho de su trabajo y que se ha valido de el para sacar adelante a su familia, su mayor anhelo es llegar a incrementar su producción y convertirse en agricultor exportador. Sus vecinos y compañeros del trabajo le consideran una persona honrada y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 65-year old father who lives with his wife and children in the village of Mondragón, located in the Olmos district. Olmos is an agricultural and commercial region comprised of residents who live in small, dispersed rural areas. It belongs to the Lambayeque province, located more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo. For more than five years, he has dedicated himself to cultivating passion fruit, a popular crop of that region. Farmers have started to join forces in order to more easily position their products in the markets. Small agricultural cooperatives exist presently that support each other and harvest their fruit several times each year. This is especially true at harvest time, when fruit might be picked several times per month. Pedro would like to apply some nutrients and fertilizers to his crops in order to improve his production. This will help him ensure a good income to help his family get ahead. This is why he has solicited his first loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Pedro is a farmer who enjoys his work a great deal, and it has helped him support his family. His greatest wish is to increase his output and become an exporter. His neighbors and workmates consider him an honest and hard worker.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase nutrients and fertilizers to maintain his passion fruit crop.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.es: Estrella M. P., tiene la edad de 49 años, está casada, tiene 1 hijo que son su mayor  prioridad. Vive con el esposo y su hijo. El crédito lo quiere para comprar un lote en el cual desean construir la casa, ellos anhelan tener el lote propio con su casa. El lote cuenta con buenas condiciones para vivir y construir. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Estrella espera poder desarrollar una vida tranquila en su lote propio y tener una mejor calidad de vida y  seguir creciendo como persona.
texts.en:
Estrella M. Portugeuz is 49 years old, married, and has a son who is her highest priority. She lives with her husband and son. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a plot of land so that she can build a house. Both she and her husband desire their own land for their house. This plot will provide good conditions on which to live and build.

This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR and she is very happy with the services that have been provided. Doña Estrella hopes to establish a peaceful life on her own land, have a better quality of life, and continue growing as a person.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a plot of land

loans.name: Reina Luz

texts.es:
la sra. Reina Luz S. S. tiene 52 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Buenos Aires de la ciudad de San Lorenzo Valle, Reina se dedica a la fabricacion de arreglos florales, tambien vende flores por unidad y al por mayor.
tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, la cual es muy buena ya que muchas personas compran arreglos para varias ocaciones como ser cumpleaños, bodas, fiestas, reuniones, arreglos para regalos de parejas.
en estos momentos necesita comprar mas jarrones, maseteras grandes y pequeñas para hacer arreglos, tambien comprar mas variedad de flores, es para eso que utilizara el credito.
texts.en:
Reina Luz S. S. is 52 years old. She lives in the neighborhood of Buenos Aires in the city of San Lorenzo Valley. Reina dedicates herself to making floral arrangements. She also sells flowers individually and at wholesale. She has dedicated herself to this type of activity for several years, which is very good since many people buy arrangements for various occasions such as birthdays, weddings, parties, reunions, and as gifts for couples. At this time, Reina needs to buy more vases and both large and small flowerpots for the arrangements. She also needs to buy a larger variety of flowers. It is for these purchases that she will use this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flowers, vases, ribbons, glue, and flowerpots

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Azucena Altagracia

texts.es:
la sra. Azucena Altagracia D. tiene 44 años de edad, vive en la Aldea Corinto a la par de la refinadora de Sal INSAL. San Lorenzo, Valle.
Azucena se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia, en estos momentos la pulperia esta mejorando en las ventas, pero se esta quedando corta de producto, es por eso que necesita el credito para comprar mas productos y asi poder surtir bien la pulperia. Azucena dice sentirse muy contenta ya que la situacion se esta mejorando y las ventas estan creciendo, espera que para fin de año su pulperia cambie completamente y este bien surtida.
texts.en:
Azucena Altagracia D., 44, lives in the village of Corinto near the INSAL salt refinery in San Lorenzo, Valle. Azucena sells popular consumer products; she has a small grocery store. Recently the grocery store has been seeing improved sales, but this has left her short of products, and for this reason she needs a loan to buy more products so that she can restock her grocery store. Azucena says she feels very pleased that the situation is improving and her sales are growing. She hopes that by the end of the year she can change her grocery store completely and have it very well stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy beans, butter, rice, sugar, milk, coffee, bread, cookies, corn and flour tortillas, margarine, toilet paper, sanitary napkins, salt, condiments, eggs, soap, soup and grains

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, de 78 años , vive con su esposa Yolanda (64). No tuvieron hijos , y es por eso que habitan solos su casa que es propia.Desde hace 16 años ,se dedica  a la venta de comestibles junto a su esposa , su negocio esta ubicado en uno de los mercados de la zona donde vive. El trabajo es tranquilo, pues la experiencia de tantos años ha hecho que conozcan las necesidades de la clientela abasteciendo su puesto de surtida mercadería. Lamentablemente no puede exhibir todos sus comestibles, pues los  ladrones que a veces ingresan por  las noches a este mercado sustraen lo que encuentran. Es por esta razón que guardan sus productos en su casa , y en el negocio solo tienen lo indispensable . En el futuro desean  seguir mejorando sus ingresos, además que quieren reforzar  la seguridad de su puesto y comprar más productos comestibles  para mejorar  la ventas.Es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual con todos sus pagos y no defraudar a su grupo solidario.José tiene planeado invertir el dinero del crédito en comprar  mayor cantidad de productos comestibles para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Jose, 78, lives with his wife, Yolanda, 64. They have no children and live together in the house that they own. For 16 years, along with Yolanda, Jose has made a living selling grocery products. The business is located in one of the markets in their neighborhood. The work is fairly easy because the experience of so many years has taught them what their customers want and what products they have to stock to satisfy demand. Unfortunately, they can't stock all of their products at the market because thieves sometimes break in there at night and steal whatever they find. Consequently, they keep most of their products at their house and only leave at the business what they have to. They hope to improve the security of their market stall in the future, as well as improve the incomes they pull from the business. This is Jose's second MFP loan and he is committed to repaying it on time so that his community group doesn't suffer a default. He plans to use the loan to buy larger supplies of products so that he can increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Sandra Patricia B. Rodríguez es una mujer muy creativa, fabrica  artesanías en madera Country, tejidos, lencería y  todo lo que se refiere a decoración. Ella es casada y madre de 4 pequeños entre los 4 y 10 años de edad, comenzó dictando clases en madera y pinceladas  a las que luego agregó bordado, lencería y decoración;  desde  hace 2 años inició su negocio de fabricar lo que elabora, esto ha dado muy buenos frutos y en la actualidad algunos productos son fabricados por los estudiantes del curso aprovechando toda su infraestructura y así puede ofrecer mejores precios a sus clientes. En la actualidad  solicita su primer crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo porque necesita comprar materias primas, especialmente madera y  también necesita dinero para mejorar la entrada de su local.  

Sandra Sueña con que su negocio siga creciendo, se convierta en una gran tienda de artesanías, donde las personas tengan la oportunidad de aprender técnicas especiales usadas en las manualidades y extenderse a muchas ciudades de Colombia, así generaría  mayores ingresos y su familia tendría mejores oportunidades, porque tiene el propósito de  brindarle una educación de calidad a sus hijos. Sus desafíos se hacen visibles en la época de  baja temporada porque se disminuyen las ventas, entonces ella debe ingeniárselas para impulsar sus productos. 

Sandra Patricia vive en un barrio  con una combinación especial que favorece la estructura de venta de su negocio, es muy comercial y al mismo tiempo residencial, goza de instalaciones seguras por eso se torna tranquilo y además tiene grandes almacenes y supermercados cercanos.
texts.en:
Sandra Patricia B. R. is a very creative woman. She operates a business selling craft products made from wood, textiles, linens, etc. She is married and the mother of 4 children who are between 4 and 10 years old. She began by offering classes in woodworking and painting and, later, embroidery and decoration, as well. She started a business making products from her designs 2 years. The business is now a success. Her students make craft products using her tools and supplies and she then sells the products on at an attractive price. Sandra is applying for a loan from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo because she needs to buy basic supplies, especially wood, and improve the entrance to her shop. Sandra hopes her business will continue to grow and ultimately become a large store selling traditional craft products, but also a place where people can come to learn to make traditional crafts. She would like to expand to other cities in Colombia, as well, so that she can increase her income and provide her family with opportunities that they wouldn't otherwise have. The challenges that she faces are most apparent during the low season when her sales fall and she has to apply all of her genius to press sales of her products. Sandra Patricia lives in a neighborhood with a good mix of businesses that support her type of business. It's very commercial and, at the same time, residential, quiet and safe, but also close to large stores and supermarkets.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for crafts business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma de 46 años, es una mujer valiente y risueña, casada con Alejandro de 55 años, ambos tienen 6 hijos pero sólo viven con 3 de ellos, en su vivienda propia. Hace mas de 25 años se dedica a plantar piña y café sobre sus propios terrenos, en donde su esposo lo apoya, pero en temporada de limpieza y cosecha contrata peones, ya que demanda de mucho esfuerzo realizar esta actividad, ambos esperan mejorar la calidad de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su labor es aplicar abono a sus plantaciones, porque está segura que con buenos cuidados obtendrá una excelente cosecha, pese a las variaciones climáticas ni las plagas echarán a perder su producción. Orgullosa afirma que la agricultura es su fuente principal de ingresos con el cual pudo construir su casa y ahora vive tranquila sin pasar necesidades. Por eso desea incrementar sus cosechas y sus ventas en el mercado de su ciudad, ya que no percibe lo que debería en los acopiadores de su localidad. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y asegura que no defraudará la confianza que le brindan los integrantes de su grupo comunal, con quienes disfruta gratos momentos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de fertilizantes para proteger sus cultivos de piña.
texts.en:
Vilma, 46, is a friendly and courageous woman, married to Alejandro, 55, with whom she has 6 children. They live in their own house with the 3 of their children who still live at home. She started, more than 25 years ago, planting pineapple and coffee on land that she owns, a business that she operates with help from her husband. During harvest season, she also hires laborers who help with the very difficult job of harvesting the crops. She and her husband would like to improve the quality of their products. What she most likes about farming is spreading manure on the land because taking care of the land ensures a good crop even when weather and disease cut into her output. She proudly says that farming is her main source of income, an income that has made it possible for her to build a house and live without having to give up basic necessities. She would like to increase her harvests and her sales in the local market, the town's market being her outlet for sales since she doesn't want to sell to the local farm collective. This is Vilma's first MFP loan and she assures us that she won't violate the trust of the other members of her community bank with whom she enjoys a good relationship. She will use the loan to buy sacks of fertilizer to protect her pineapple crop.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for farming business.

loans.name: Marbel Petrona

texts.es: La joven Marbel de 22 años de edad, es muy emprendedora, y trabajadora, desde hace cuatro años  comenzó a trabajar como domestica, y con sus ahorro logro afiliarse con la Avon para vender cosméticos y poder mejorar sus ingresos ya que son bajos, casada, su esposo trabaja como guarda de seguridad y han logrado hacer una pequeña división propia en la casa de su mama. Su anhelo es lograr llegar a comprar su propio terreno. Con este financiamiento lograra levantar las paredes para construir el baño y lograr una mejor higiene y privacidad en el hogar. A futuro quiere invertir más en cosmético, ropa, zapatos y solo dedicarse al comercio por completo.
texts.en:
Young Marbel, 22, is hard-working and entrepreneurial. She started working as a cleaner four years ago and has now saved enough to start a business selling Avon products. She'll buy and sell Avon cosmetics, a business that will allow her to increase the small income she collects now. Marbel is married and her husband works as a security guard. They've managed to set up a space of their own in the house of Marbel's mother. Marbel would ultimately like to have her own place. With this loan, though, she will build the walls for a bathroom, a project that will give the couple more privacy in the house. In the future, Marbel would like to buy more cosmetics, clothing, shoes, etc. and commit herself to her business full time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for bathroom project.

loans.name: Ever Ronal

texts.es:
Ever es un padre de familia de 29 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a su hijo en casa de unos familiares ubicada en el sector San Antonio, una zona urbano marginal que queda próxima a la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros), el brinda su servicio en la periferia de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que es por donde suelen circular estos vehículos, debido a que es el único ingreso con el que cuenta para solventar los gastos de su joven familia el siempre trata de brindar un buen servicio.

Debido al constante uso de su vehículo, este ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento, es por ello que ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que también piensa utilizar en la compra de nuevas llantas y demás accesorios que le ayuden a brindar su servicio de una mejor manera.

Ever es un joven bastante trabajador y que siempre da todo de si para sacar adelante a su familia, en la zona donde vive el es bastante estimado y conocido por sus vecinos quienes lo consideran alguien honrado y que siempre está dispuesto a ayudar a los demás.
texts.en:
Ever, 29, lives with his wife and son in the house of a relative in San Antonio, an urban area on the outskirts of the city of Chiclayo. For three years, Ever has operated a mototaxi business, carrying cargo and passengers on a mototaxi, a motorized vehicle common in these parts. He offers mototaxi services on the outskirts of Chiclayo where these kinds of vehicles are very common. It's the only source of income that Ever has been able to count on and he needs it to support his young family. He works hard to provide a good service. Because Ever's vehicle has been in constant use for the business, it's suffered from various mechanical problems that now require a fix. He's applying to Edpyme Alternativa for his first loan, a request for 1200 new soles that he will use to buy new tires and the other parts that will help him to properly service the vehicle. Ever is a hard-working young man, always concerned about the well-being of his family. He's well regarded in his neighborhood and known by his neighbors who consider him honest and always willing to help others.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mototaxi parts and repairs for taxi business.

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es: Lisbeth, de 28 años, vive con su hija y su madre en su casa que es propia. Desde su niñez ha estado muy ligada a la tarea de fabricar ladrillos y desde que constituyo su familia decidió que sería la forma de ganar dinero para mantenerse. En la actualidad  tiene su fabrica que administra junto con su madre, y le va bien en el negocio pues obtiene considerables ganancias que le permiten tener una buena calidad de vida. El proceso de administración y venta de sus ladrillos que produce, durante  la época de verano , es mucho más rentable porque el buen clima le permite producir en poco tiempo. Para más adelante comprará otros terrenos para que su fabrica se extienda.Es la 12ava vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo, pues  le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.El dinero lo invertirá en la compra de materiales  como una camionada de aserrín, arena y ramas de árboles que son los materiales utilizados en la fabricación de ladrillos.
texts.en:
Lisbeth, 28, lives with her mother and her daughter in her own home. Since childhood she has been linked to brick making and when she formed her own family decided this would be a good way to support herself. She has a factory that she runs with her mother; she does well with this business because it generates considerable profits that allow her to have a good quality of life. The bricks that are produced in summer are the most profitable because climate allows for quick production. In the future, she wants to buy more land to expand her factory. This is her 12th loan with MFP and she promises to be very punctual with her repayments. She is also grateful to the people that made the loan possible because it will be very useful for her business’ progress. She will use the funds to buy supplies like a truckload of sawdust, sand and tree branches which are the raw materials for brick making.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for brick making.

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es: La señora Claudia es una mujer de metas en su vida, desde su juventud se ha esforzado para sobresalir adelante con sus estudios, con ayuda de su esposo y sus padres lo logro aunque con muchas dificultades económicas, trabaja como docente en un instituto. Tiene un hijo y junto con su esposo ahorrar para poder lograr las mejora de su vivienda, el trabaja como conductor. La casa la han ido construyendo poco a poco ya que todo esta muy caro, y hay que cubrir educación, alimentación y salud para su hijo. Con este financiamiento comprara: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro para hacer una ele en su casa para terminarla de cerrarla de concreto ya que la tiene con madera ya vieja lo que es preocupante para la seguridad de su familia.
texts.en:
Claudia is a woman with life objectives. Since her youth she has made the effort to get ahead with her studies and, with help from her husband and parents, she managed to do so although with many economic difficulties. She works as a teacher in an institute. She has a son; she and her husband save in order to make improvements to their home. He works as a driver. They have gradually built their house because everything is very expensive and they have to pay for their son’s schooling, food and health needs. This financing will be used to buy stone, sand, cement and iron to build an ell onto their house thus completing it and closing it off with concrete because it currently is made of old wood and this is a concern for the family’s security.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone, sand, cement and iron to build a concrete wall for family security.

loans.name: Yoli

texts.es: Yoli, es una mujer muy alegre y luchadora, tiene 45 años, está casada con Hernán de 52 años, juntos tienen 5 hijos pero solo viven con 2 de ellos en su vivienda propia, mientras que los demás ya son independientes. Hace más de 10 años se dedica al cultivo de café, plátanos, fréjol y palta, frutos que posee en sus propios terrenos, ella y su esposo comparten el anhelo de tener una mejor calidad de vida, además de continuar apoyando a sus hijos. Es conciente de que los esfuerzos que realiza por cuidar sus plantaciones siempre tienen como recompensa una buena producción, por eso le gusta mantener limpios sus terrenos, sobretodo proporcionarles fertilizantes para nutrir la tierra. Sin embargo le desagrada comercializar sus productos a bajos precios, pero eso no la desanima y casi siempre hace respetar el valor real de sus productos. Yoli, afirma que la agricultura es muy rentable si sabes trabajar y aprovecharlo, gracias a ello pudo cubrir la educación de sus hijos, comprar bienes y solventar sus gastos domésticos. En adelante desea comprar más terrenos agrícolas y contar con mayor cantidad de producción. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y agradece a los integrantes de su grupo comunal por el respaldo que le brindan, asimismo se compromete a trabajar de manera responsable. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono, pues quiere aplicar abono a sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
