Yoli, 45, is a cheerful and tenacious woman. She’s married to Hernán, 52, and they have 5 children, only two of whom still live with them in their own home; the rest are all independent. For over 10 years she has farmed coffee, bananas, broad bean and avocados, on her own farmlands. She and her husband share the dream of having a better quality of life as well as continuing to support their children. She is aware that her efforts to care for her crops always have the reward of a good yield. Because of this, she likes to maintain her fields clean and provide proper fertilizers to nourish the soil. She dislikes having to sell her products for low prices but she doesn’t become discouraged, however, and usually manages to have the real value of her products respected. Yoli affirms that farming is very profitable if you know how to work and take advantage of it. Thanks to farming, she was able to pay for the education of her children, buy assets and cover household domestic expenses. In the future, she would like to buy more farmlands to produce increased crop yields. This is her 1st loan with MFP and she thanks her fellow communal bank members for the support they provide and she also commits to work responsibly. She will use the requested funds to buy several sacks of manure to apply to her coffee crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Yvonne Patricia

texts.es:
Yvonne tiene 32 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su familia en el sector Campodónico, un sector situado en la periferia de la ciudad de Chiclayo, conocida a nivel nacional por su movimiento comercial.

Yvonne cuenta con dos mototaxis (vehículos motorizados utilizados en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) que alquila a choferes para que brinden servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en la ciudad de Chiclayo, lleva mas de tres años en el negocio y con estas actividades solventa sus gastos personales y ayuda a la economía de su familia. 

Yvonne desea comprar otra mototaxi con la cual pueda ampliar su negocio y percibir mas ingresos, ella ya ha estado ahorrando el monto que necesitaba para adquirir su nueva unidad pero aún le faltan 1000 nuevos soles los cuales desea obtener en calidad de préstamo, por ello se encuentra solicitando por pirmera vez un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa.

Yvonne es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, su sueñon es llegar a tener una empresa de transporte con varias unidades y siente que ya lo esta logrando, lo que la pone muy contenta y orgullosa. En la zona donde vive ella es muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos que la consideran una mujer honrada.
texts.en:
Yvonne, 32, is single and lives with her family in Campodónico, an area on the periphery of the city of Chiclayo, a city known nationally for its commercial activity. Yvonne has two mototaxis (motorized vehicles used to transport cargo and passengers) that she leases to drivers so that they can provide cargo and passenger transportation services in the city of Chiclayo. She has been in business for over 3 years and these activities provide for personal expenses and to help with the family finances. Yvonne wants to buy another mototaxi to expand her business and receive more income. She has been saving up for it but still lacks 1000 new soles which she hopes to get through a loan. Thus she is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for the first time. Yvonne is a hard-working, enterprising woman. Her dream is to someday have a large transportation company composed of several vehicles; she feels she’s already well on her way to achieving this, something that makes her very happy and proud. She is very well-known and liked by her neighbors where she lives; they consider her to be an honest woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: In order to have enough money to buy a new mototaxi.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan D. L. P. C. desea instalar protecciones en su vivienda para brindar a su familia seguridad. Juan C. es padre D. familia D. tres pequeños D. los cuales le preocupa el bienestar, su esposa es ama D. casa que se queda al cuidado D. ellos. Pero el señor teme que les pueda pasar algo cuando el sale a trabajar ya que L. delincuencia esta cada día mas grave.
texts.en:
Juan D. L. P. C. wants to install protections on his house to give his family security. Juan C. has three little one, and he is concerned about their well-being. His wife is a housewife, and she takes care of them. But, he is afraid that something could happen to them when he leaves for work. The delinquency is more severe each day.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install protections

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco de 48 años, comparte su vida con su esposa Marina de 48 años, juntos tiene 5 hijos de los cuales vive con dos de ellos en su casa propia. Está familia trabaja duro y parejo para vivir cómodamente. Hace más de 10 años que trabaja ofreciendo el servicio de transporte público, ya que la trayectoria al pueblo de San pedro es muy difícil por lo que las personas escogen camiones para trasladarse, de esa manera Francisco vio una fuente de ingresos, por ello opto utilizar su camioneta como una vehiculo más de transporte. Paralelo a este trabajo, se dedica a cuidar sus plantaciones de café, actividad que lo viene realizando desde hace 20 años. Lo que más le agrada hacer es el de transportar a las personas para que lleguen a su destino, sin embargo corre el riesgo de malograr su camión. Él asegura que sus actividades son bastante rentables porque percibe ingresos económicos diarios y puede vivir sin preocupaciones. En adelante espera comprarse un terreno agrícola más para aumentar la productividad de sus frutos, ya que considera de mucha rentabilidad. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y está contento de trabajar con su grupo comunal porque incentivan siempre a ahorrar. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de fertilizantes para proteger sus cultivos de las plagas.
texts.en:
Francisco, age 48, shares his life with his 48 year old wife, Marina. They have five children, and they live with two of them in their own house. This family works hard and together in order to live comfortably. He has worked providing public transportation service for over ten years. The path to the town of San Pedro is very difficult. That is why people choose trucks to go there. That is how Francisco saw a source of income. He chose to use his light truck as another transportation vehicle. Along side of this work he takes care of his coffee crops. He has been doing this for 20 years. What pleases him the most is transporting people so that they arrive at their destination. However, he runs the risk of his light truck breaking down. He assures us that his activities are quite profitable because he receives daily income and is able to live without worries. Later he plans to buy another piece of farming land to increase the productivity of his fruits. They are very profitable. This is his third loan with MFP. He is happy to be working with his communal bank because they are always motivated to save. With the loan he is requesting he will buy various sacks of fertilizers to protect his crops from pests.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Ndathé

texts.fr: Ndathé T. est une femme de 37 ans, elle est célibataire et mère d'un enfant en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DIAMAGUENE dont elle est la trésorière depuis le 22 octobre 2007 et y a eu de bonnes expériences avec le crédit pour en avoir bénéficier 5 fois de suite. Elle développe un petit commerce de produits cosmétiques depuis plus de 5ans, cette activité lui procure des bénéfices qui lui permettent d'équiper sa chambre, de satisfaire ses besoins personnels et ceux de son enfant. Son objectif est de renforcer son petit commerce et d'augmenter sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Ndathé T. is a 37-year old single mother, and has been a member of the Diamaguene credit association, of which she is now Treasurer, since the 22nd of October 2007. She has received 5 loans from them. For the past five years she has sold cosmetics for a living, and this business generates profits which have enabled her to furnish her bedroom, and to see to her own needs and those of her child. Her aim is to boost her business and increase her customer base.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Boost her cosmetics business

loans.name: Seeseei

texts.en:
Seeseei H. is 37 and married with two children.  She owns a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community.  Seeseei has many years of experience in this business.  Seeseei needs a loan of WST $1500 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 700 talas or US $292 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Seeseei joined SPBD.  This is her second loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Seeseei's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa Lô est âgée de 25 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DIAMAGUENE depuis le 20 octobre 2007. Elle a eu 5 fois de suite a recevoir de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problèmes de remboursement. Elle est coiffeuse de profession et son nouveau prêt lui permettra de mieux s'équiper en matériels et produits de coiffure. Son objectif est d'aménager son salon, de le rendre plus accueillant et attrayant afin d'attirer la clientèle, mais tout en soutenant son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Awa Lô is a married 25 year-old woman with one child. She has been a member of the Diamaguene credit association since the 20th October 2007 and has received 5 loans, all of which have been successfully repaid. She is a hairdresser by trade and this new loan would enable her to purchase new hairstyling tools and products. Her aim is to equip her salon, make it more welcoming and attractive in order to bring in more customers, and support her husband with the costs of looking after their family.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop her hairdressing business

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
Mussarat, a resident of Lahore (famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods), is the wife of M.. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 20 years. 

A very talented lady, Musarat operates a clothes-sewing business. She started her business four years ago. Earlier, she sewed clothes for her family and by seeing the perfectly stitched dresses, her neighbors came to know her skills. They also started giving her orders for sewing. She charges them from 100 to 150 rupees for each dress and her customers give it to her without any argument.
 
Her husband runs a grocery shop in the community. He started his shop two years ago after seeing a need because there’s no other grocery shop in the community and people went to the market for purchasing. Now they come to his shop and purchase the groceries from him.  

Musarat is applying for a loan from Asasah, a Kiva partner, to invest in her husband’s business so he can purchase groceries in bulk and expand.

loans.use: Purchase groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina, a resident of Lahore, famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods, is the wife of M. J.. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for the last 25 years.
  
Her husband operates a movie-making business. He offers his services at functions such as weddings and birthday parties. He gets work by phone call and earns income. He has been in this profession for over 10 years. He has two workers in his shop and he pays them on a monthly basis. 

Zarina is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest the capital in her husband’s business so he can purchase a digital camera and improve the quality of his work.

loans.use: To purchase a digital camera for movie making business

loans.name: Kaniz's Group

texts.en:
Kaniz, a resident of Lahore, famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods, is the wife of W. and the mother of two kids: one daughter and one son. Both are enrolled in school and are getting an education. She owns a small house with two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 20 years.

A very talented lady, Kaniz operates a quilt-selling business. She sells the quilts in her community and in the market. She purchases the quilts from different cities (Islamabad and Peshawar) in bulk. Her business increases in the winter season especially. She uses her income to pay off the utilities and to manage the education expenses of her kids.

Her husband is a mechanic by profession and runs his own motor workshop in the market. He is very talented and can repair every type of vehicle from motorbike to four-wheeled car. He started learning this skill at the age of 12. Earlier he worked for someone else but he started his own motor workshop four years ago.
 
Kaniz is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest the capital in her husband’s business so he can purchase repair tools and improve the quality of the workshop.

loans.use: To purchase repair tools

loans.name: Azeem's Group

texts.en:
Azeem, a resident of Lahore, famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods, is the wife of M. I. and owns a small house of two rooms in which she has been living with her family for over 30 years. 

A very caring lady, Azeem manages her domestic chores and takes care of her family very efficiently. Her husband operates a DVD selling business. He sells the veritable DVD and movie tapes. His variety in items helps him to approach more customers in his shop. He is very active in his work. He writes the demands of his customers in a notepad and arranges them on an urgent basis, which gives a nice impression to its customers. He has been doing this work for over 10 years. 

Azeem is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest the capital in her husband’s business so he can purchase  more DVDs and movie tapes and complete the order of his customers.

loans.use: To purchase DVDs and Movie tapes

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah rakhi, a resident of Lahore (famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods), is the wife of S. A.. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 20 years
. 
A very talented lady, Allah rakhi operates her clothes-sewing business. Her work makes her unique among other sewing centers because of her nice measurements and good sewing techniques. She feels enjoyment while sewing clothes because this is her favorite work to do and she has is expert in it. 
Her husband operates a spare parts business in the market. He sells spare parts for different vehicles such as motorbikes & bicycles. He has 15 years of experience in this business. He purchases the spare parts from the area of “Bilal ganj”, which is famous for the spare parts in Lahore. Once in a month, he travels to that area and purchases the stock.
 
Allah rakhi is applying for a loan from Asasah, to invest the capital in her husband’s business so he can purchase his stock in bulk and meet the urgent demand of its customers
. 
Note: "In this picture Allah rakhi is doing measurement of the suit".

loans.use: Purchase vehicle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Asheer's Group

texts.en:
Asheer is a resident of Lahore (famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods). She is the wife of A. and owns a two-room house where she has been living with her family for over 20 years. 

She is a very caring and good-natured lady who always has a big smile on her face. She is very strong too and handles all problems with maturity. Asheer operates a clothes-sewing business from her house. She sews clothes for her neighbors and earns income which helps her to manage her family's financial expenses. 

Her husband is a butcher by profession. He operates a butcher shop in the community and has been selling meat for the past five years. Asheer is applying for a loan from Asasah, to invest the capital in her husband’s butcher shop so he can purchase animals and sell the meat to his customers and increase the profit.

loans.use: To purchase animals in order to sell the meat

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia is a resident of Lahore (famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods). She is the wife of S. and has been living in this city with her family for the past 15 years. A very talented lady, Asia operates a business selling decoration pieces. She sells the decoration pieces in gift shops and earns profit. She utilizes her income to pay for the utilities. 

Her husband operates an electronics repairing business. He can repair every kind of electronic equipment and transform it into working condition. He has been in this profession for the past five years. Asia is applying for a loan from Asasah, to invest the capital in her husband’s business so he can purchase the repairing tools and improve his quality of work.

loans.use: To purchase repairing tools for an electronics repair business

loans.name: Sailia's Group

texts.en:
Sailia is the wife of S. and lives in a city named Lahore (famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods) in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it for over 30 years. A very talented lady, Sailia operates an embroidery business. She makes embroidered dresses for her neighbors and earns 500 Pak rupees on each dress from them. She completes each dress in two to three days. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. 

Her husband is a fruit vendor. He sells fruit in different areas of the community on his four-wheeled cart and generates income. He is very hard-working because his selling depends entirely on him going to work and if he misses one day he loses 350 or 450 Pak rupees. Therefore, Sailia is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest the capital in her husband’s business so he can purchase the fruit in bulk and increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase fruit in bulk to sell

loans.name: Venus' Group

texts.en:
Venus is the wife of W. and lives in a city named Lahore (famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods) in Pakistan. A very talented and supportive lady, Venus helps her husband in his grocery shop. She stays with him and deals with the customers. In this way, they manage the large number of customers at once and leave a good impression on them. 

Venus is applying for a loan from Asasah, to invest the capital in the grocery shop so her husband can purchase the groceries in bulk and increase the profit.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk to sell

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal B. is a National Authority employee and a father of a nine-year-old twins, Massara and Mustafa, a seven-year-old, Shahd, and a five-year-old,  Muhammad. Nidal owns an accessories and cosmetics booth in Rafah City which is located in front of a girls' college in the city.

Nidal has been running the booth for the last five years in order to provide better living conditions for his wife and four children. Having the store in front of a girls' college is helping it to prosper.

Nidal thought of expanding his work and purchasing a wider variety of accessories and goods to attract more customers and meet their needs. He came to FATEN to take out a $1500 loan and is hoping to be able to afford a store in the near future.

Nidal stands in front of his booth in the picture above.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sweets to sell in her grocery store

loans.name: Julius Odwar

texts.en:
Julius Odwar O. is a businessman in Migori who sells secondhand clothes. He started this business in 2004 after quitting a printing and stationery business due to its low income.

Julius buys his stock in Kisii and sometimes travels to Nairobi on a weekly basis. He wants to expand his business by increasing his stock and would like to obtain a loan of Ksh 20,000 to be able to do this.

Julius is 30 years old, a husband, and the father of three children. His future plan is to open a computer school where youths who have finished high school but have not managed to go to college can learn some basic computer skills.

loans.use: To increase his stock to expand his business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mourice Odhiambo

texts.en:
Mourice Odhiambo K. is 45 years old, a husband, and the father of five children. He lives In Migori Kenya where he sells shoes and stationery, a business he started in 2002 after quitting his job.

Mourice travels to Nairobi twice a month to purchase his stock. He is looking forward to expanding his business by increasing his stock. He wishes to obtain a loan of Ksh 50,000 to achieve this and to be able to earn considerable income in order to educate his children.

loans.use: To increase his stock to expand his business

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a single young man from Rafah City in the Gaza strip, Palestine. Muhammad is 28 years old and runs a fruit and vegetable store in the city. He started the business four years ago and has earned his living from it for the past four years. The store is located in Rafah market.

Muhammad decided to take a $2000 loan from FATEN to purchase a larger quantity and variety of vegetables and fruits. Since his store is well-known and has established a good number of clients, Muhammad would like to expand his business.

Muhammad stands in his store in the picture shown above.

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Preparing and serving food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Selling electronic goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying manure and farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and rental of tractors for labo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sale of generic pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of wheat flour, sugar and oil for the sale of fritters

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sale of generic pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sale of plastic kitchenware

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Preparation and sale of food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for motorcycles

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es: Jacqueline es una joven de 29 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos con estudio en primaria, su esposo trabaja en un zoológico, y junto han logrado la construcción de su casa, aunque falta por hacerle mucho, lo importante es que han logrado el objetivo de un techo para sus hijos, Jacqueline se dedica a la venta de ropa, cosmético y los que los cliente le encarguen, lleva cinco años en las ventas el cual comenzó con ahorros y dinero que su esposo daba, pues esta difícil la citación económica por eso trabajo para poder cubrir los gastos y para hacer las mejora a la casa, con este financiamiento pondrá piso a su casa ya que aun es de suelo y repellara las paredes para una mejor higiene y una  mejor estructuración de la casa. Su meta es lograr aumentar el inventario de su negocio en la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is 29, married, and has two children who attend elementary school. Her husband works at a zoo. Together they have built their house, even though there is a lot left to do. The important thing is that they have achieved their objective of a roof over their children’s heads. Jacqueline sells clothes, cosmetics, and other things that customers order from her. She has been in sales for five years. She started with savings and money that her husband gave her. The economic situation is difficult, so she works to be able to cover the expenses and to make improvements on the house. With this loan she will put down a floor in her house because it is still a dirt floor. She will plaster the walls for better hygiene and to improve the structure of the house. Her goal is to increase the inventory in her business of selling clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sand, cement, and bricks to put down a floor and plaster the walls of her house

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
La joven Dina habitante de colonia Talolinga, desde  su pequeñez se ha dedicado ala actividad pecuaria junto a su familia ya que ella viene de una familia campesina, actualmente esta laborando como docente de primaria en la Escuela Rafael Salmeron en colonia Talolinga, solicita este financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcciòn y asi construir una habitacion, el cual la ayudara a mejorar sus condiciones de vida en el hogar.                                                                                                          

Dina es una joven que todavia no tiene hijos su esposo se encuentra en Costa Rica Trabajando para asi mejorar sus condciones de vida,  ella vive con su ancianita madre a la cual la ayuda con los gastos del hogar, es una joven con muchos deseos de superacion, espera ser beneficiado con el fondo KIVA, según referencias de su comunidad la consideran por ser responsable,  honesta y de buenos valores morales.
texts.en:
Dina is a young lady who lives in the Talolinga neighborhood. Since she was small, she has worked together with her family in livestock raising since she comes from a rural family. Currently she is working as a primary school teacher in the Rafael Salmeron School in the Talolinga neighborhood. She is asking for a loan to buy construction materials to be able to build a house. This will improve her standard of living. Dina is young and doesn't have children yet. Her husband is working in Costa Rica to improve their living conditions. She lives with her elderly mother who she helps with the household expenses. She is a young lady with many goals of getting ahead and she hopes to receive a loan from KIVA. According to what people say about her in her community, she is responsible, honest and has good moral values.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a house

loans.name: Jetinah

texts.en:
Forty-eight-year-old Jetinah is a married mother of three children aged 18, 22 and 26 years old. All of the children, including one grandchild, are currently attending school. Jetinah, from Western Kenya near Kitale town, has been farming for 29 years and has only one employee, her main challenges being competition, high production costs and poor prices for her products. Her main crops are maize, beans, bananas, vegetables, soybeans and potatoes, all of which she sells to the local market. She also earns income from a tailoring shop that she owns in the area.

Jetinah has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES.31,200 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income arising from the loan will enable her family to access good education and health care. In future, Jetinah wants to have a modern dairy unit with five quality dairy cows and be able to practice pure zero grazing.

She says,"Juhudi has given me the urge to work hard."

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Aura Lilliam

texts.es:
Aura Lilliam de 31 años de edad, es habitante de la colonia Rio Plata a 5 km de Nueva Guinea, labora como docente de primaria en la Escuela Vigarmy Flores, es madre soltera de 2 niños, el mayor de 6 añitos estudia su primer grado y un bebe de un añito de edad. Cuenta con el apoyo de su mamá que le cuida los niños cuando se va a trabajar.

Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar materiales de construccion y asi lograr acondicionar la habitacion y hecharle el piso al mismo, con el objetivo de tener mejores condiciones para sus dos bebes, se caracteriza por ser una joven muy responsable, honesta y muy trabajadora, a pesar que no tiene la ayuda de su familia ella siempre a luchado para que a sus hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Aura Lilliam is 31 years old and she is a resident of the Rio Plata neighborhood, 5 km from Nueva Ginea. She works as a primary school teacher in the Vigarmy Flores School. She is a single mother with 2 children. The oldest is 6 years old and is in first grade. She also has a one year-old baby. She can count on the support of her mother, who cares for the children while she is at work. She is requesting a loan to buy construction materials so that she can improve her room and put in a floor at the same time. The goal is to have better living conditions for her two children. She is a very responsible young woman, honest and hardworking. Though she does not have help from her family, she has always worked hard so that her children have everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Francias Alicia

texts.es: La profesora Francis Alicia habitantante de la zona # 1 de Nueva Guinea,  es madre de 2 hijos varones y una mujer todos trabajan y son profesionales su mayor necesidad que se le presenta es construir una cocina ya que le urge  por que ya viene el tiempo del invierno y se encuentra en mal estado de modo que le permita vivir en mejores condiciones en su casa de habitacion, no cuenta con los recursos economicos necesarios para realizar esta actividad por esta razon solicita refinanciamiento a la intitucion de AFODENIC, se caracteriza por ser una mujer luchadora la cual se ha esforzado para que sus hijos sean unos excelentes profesionales, los cuales coloboran en las actividades del hogar y con los gastos familiares ya que son una familia cristiana y bien unida.
texts.en:
Francis Alicia is a teacher and she lives in Zone #1 of Nueva Ginea. She is the mother of 2 sons and one daughter. All work and are professionals. Her greatest necessity is to build a kitchen because the rainy season is about to start and her current kitchen is in bad shape. She needs one that will allow her to have better living conditions in her house. She doesn’t have the necessary funds to build, and this is why she is requesting a loan from AFODENIC. She is a very hardworking woman who has worked hard so that her children could become excellent professionals. They help her out at home and with the family expenses because they are a Christian family and are very close.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kitchen

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es: EL joven José  de 24 años de edad, vive en el barrio Rene Cisneros junto a su esposa y tres hijos. Su trabajo es la venta de  atol y arroz de leche ambulante, desde horas temprana sale aveder, este oficio lo logro ya que su mama también se dedica a la venta de atol, su inversión es poca, por eso quiere el financiamiento para lograr la compra de paca de ropa usada el cual se vende mucho por su calidad y precios accesibles. Lo que se beneficiara para mejorar la economía de su familia ya que le es difícil cuando las ventas bajan. Su objetivo es lograr ventas altas, invertir en la venta de atol, con el propósito de ahorrar y poder ofrecer a sus hijos una buena educación para que sean hombres de bien, ya que la delicuencia asecha al pais debido a la falta de empleo y educacion.
texts.en:
José is 24 years old and he lives in the Rene Cisneros neighborhood along with his wife and three children. He sells atol [a cornmeal-based beverage] and rice pudding as a street seller, starting very early in the morning. He started in this line of work because his mother also sells atol. He doesn’t have much capital to invest, and so he needs the loan to buy a bale of used clothing, which sells well because of its good quality and affordable price. This would be beneficial for his family’s economic state because it’s difficult for him when sales go down. His goal is to achieve high sales and invest in his atol business, with the goal of saving and being able to provide his children a good education so they can be good citizens, since delinquency is a big problem in the country due to the lack of employment and education.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Jose Dolores

texts.es: Don José es un hombre de negocio, tiene la edad de 43 años, casado y con dos hermosos hijos estudiantes, su negocio lo administra desde hace cuatro años, pues día a día sale al campo a vender sus producto el cual comenzó solo con venta de productos plásticos, con poco dinero, ahora ha invertido en electrodoméstico, ropa, productos plástico en mayor cantidad, lo cual vende al contado y al crédito, con el financiamiento logro la inversión a mayores productos y mayor captación de clientes lo que se siente sastifecho por que ha logrado mejores beneficios al mejorar su casa. Su esposa lo apoya con las ventas en su casa, con este préstamo comprara electrodoméstico como: plancha, abanico, licuadora, dvd, sillas plásticas, pana, entre otros ya que para estos días festivos del día de la madre aumentan las ventas lo que espera lograr vender a mayor cantidad y reponerse ya que las ventas han estado bajas. Debido ala economía del país.
texts.en:
José, 43, is married and has two beautiful children who are in school. He has had his business for four years; he goes out daily to sell. At first, all he merchandised was plastic items and had little money to invest. Now, he has invested in home appliances, clothing and larger amounts of plastic items that he sells both for cash and on credit. Financing allowed him to invest in larger quantities of merchandise and to acquire more customers which make him very satisfied because he has attained better benefits to improve his home. His wife supports him with his home-based sales. He will use this financing to buy home appliances like: iron, fan, blender, DVD, plastic chairs, corduroy, among others whose sales increase for Mother’s Day. He hopes to sell more and recover from the diminished sales lately caused by the country’s economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy home appliances: fan, blender, iron, dvd, etc.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.es:
Melissa es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Melissa es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, estudia informática en un instituto, Melissa vende zapatos que reparte a domicilio a amigos y familiares, productos que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Melissa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatos.
Los sueños de Melissa son terminar su carrera y ejercer.
texts.en:
Melissa, 23, is a member of the "Las Gaviotas" (The Seagulls) communal bank. She lives with her life partner and their son and is studying information techology at an institute. Melissa sells shoes door-to-door to friends and relatives; she buys her stock in Lima. Melissa needs 1000 soles to buy shoes. Her dream is to finish her professional preparation and start her career in her field.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Ana es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hija, Ana se dedica a la venta de Mercería, como cepillos, crema dental, entre otros, productos que reparte a tiendas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Ana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de bolitas, cepillos y cintas.
Los sueños de Ana son tener local propio y casa propia.
texts.en:
Ana, 25, is a member of the "Las Gaviotas" (The Seagulls) communal bank. She lives with her life partner and their daughter. Ana sells general merchandise like brushes and toothpaste; she sells to stores every day. Ana needs a loan of 1000 soles to invest in little balls, brushes and laces. Ana's dream is to have her how store and her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy little balls, brushes and laces.

loans.name: Guissela Ivania

texts.es: Guisela es una señora de 39 años de edad, madre de tres hijos estudiantes que junto a su esposo trabajan para lograr una mejor economía. Su esposo ya esta en el país y trabaja como conductor con los ahorros que trajo de su trabajo en el extranjero logro hacer mejoras a su casa. Doña Guisela se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, pues anteriormente vendía ropa de segunda mano, cuajada, y leche que le dan unas vacas que tiene y así se ayuda para pagar gastos básicos. Con este crédito comprara: ropa para dama, caballero, niños para aumentar las ventas y la captación de clientes nuevos. contenta por su pequeño negocio ya que esta logrando la inversión y se siente útil  para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Guisela, 39, and her husband have three children who are students; she and her husband work in order to have an improved economic status. Her husband is back in the country and works as a driver; he used savings he was able to acquire abroad to make some home improvements. Guisela sells new clothes; she used to sell used clothing, cuajada (a cheese-like product) and milk from a few cows she has thus helping to meet basic expenses. She will use this loan to buy clothing for women, men and children to increase her sales and acquire new customers.. She is happy with her small business because she's recovering her investment and she feels she's doing something useful for her family's wellbeing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for women, men and children to increase sales and win over more customers.

loans.name: Enriqueta Juana

texts.es:
Enriqueta es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Enriqueta es soltera, tiene 45 años y 1 hijo, Enriqueta tiene una bodega llamada Multiservicios Keta, en donde vende abarrotes en general, licores, actividad que realizara todos los días, Enriqueta tiene proyectado viajar a distintos lugares en donde venderá mercería.
Enriqueta necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de tarjetas telefónicas y mercería.
Enriqueta sueña con tener un negocio surtido.
texts.en:
Enriqueta, 45, is a member of the "Las Gaviotas" (The Seagulls) communal bank. She's single and has a son. She has a store called "Multiservicios Keta" where she sells general groceries and liquor every day. She is planning to travel to various locations to sell merchandise. Enriqueta needs a 3000 sol loan to buy telephone service cards and general merchandise. Enriqueta dreams with having a well-stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy telephone service cards and general merchandise.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
Brigida es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Brigida es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 5 hijos, Brigida se dedica a la venta de golosinas de manera ambulatoria en el parque principal de la ciudad, actividad que realiza todos los días por las tarde.
Brigida necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas.
Los sueños de Brigida son comprar un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Brigida, 37, is a member of the "Las Gaviotas" (The Seagulls) communal bank. She lives with her life partner and has five children. She sells sweets in the city's main park every afternoon. Brigida needs a loan of 800 soles loan to buy sweets. Her dream is to buy a lot on which to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweets.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Justina es soltera, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Justina tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras. Además Justina viaja a Lima llevando quesos para comercializarlos.
Justina necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abarrotes.
El sueño de Justina son comprar una moto para que su hijo trabaje.
texts.en:
Justina, 33, is a member of the "Las Gaviotas" (The Seagulls) communal bank. She's single and has two children. Justina has a grocery store set up in her home where she sells general groceries and vegetables. In addition, she takes cheeses to Lima to sell. Justina needs a 1600 sol loan to buy groceries. Her dream is to buy a moto so that her son can work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries.

loans.name: Guadalupe Rolando

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Guadalupe Rolando D. H. le esta haciendo falta la barda alrededor D. la vivienda.
Pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara D. realizar la mejora. Ya que desea la seguridad D. su familia cuando el no se encuentra en su casa. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el  sueldo que recibe D. su trabajo que tiene en una compañía D. trasportes en el área D. exportación, quien se encargara D. los gastos familiares será su esposa la señora Videncia Garcia quien es maestra D. una escuela.
texts.en:
Guadalupe Rolando D. H.' house still needs a wall around it. However, he lacks funds to buy materials and pay labor costs to make this home improvement. He wants his family to be safe when he's away from home. He plans to repay the loan with the salary he earns working in the export area of a transportation firm. His wife, Videncia García, who is a teacher, will take care of household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall around her house.

loans.name: Nelya

texts.en:
Nelya is married with a grown daughter. She used to work at the Pavlograd mechanical factory. However, her salary was held back most of the time while the work itself was very hard. Therefore, Nelya resigned and launched her small enterprise in the central city market. Today she is an entrepreneur who sells a variety of retail items. Nelya owns 3 vending locations and sells plastic bags, napkins, tissues, toilet paper, etc. Nelya has been in this business for 12 years. She is an experienced market vendor who has gained loyal clientele. Currently, she has 50,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. Her net profit amounts to 4,000 - 7,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Nelya is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional plastic bags in bulk for further retail sale in her kiosks. This business is the main source of income for Nelya's family. It sustains Nelya's family as well as her daughter and granddaughter who currently live with her. Nelya has an outstanding credit history with no loan delinquencies. We believe the current loan will also be repaid on time.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise to resell

loans.name: Valeria

texts.es:
Valeria es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Valeria es viuda, tiene 51 años y 4 hijos, Valeria tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende zapatos, zapatillas, productos que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Valeria necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatos.
El sueño de Valeria es tener un terreno para la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Valeria, 51, is a member of the "Las Gaviotas" (The Seagulls) communal bank. She is a widow and has 4 children. Valeria has a stall in the 12 de Abril market where she sells shoes and sandals that she gets in the city of Lima. Valeria needs a 3000 sol loan to buy shoes. Her dream is to own a lot on which to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is divorced with a grown son. She lives and runs her venture in Novaya Kahovka. Tatyana sells women's clothing items in one of the local malls. She has been in this trade for 19 years. Presently, her turnover capital amounts to 50,000 Grivnyas. Income is about 15,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Tatyana is requesting a 20,000 Grivnya loan to diversify assorted merchandise she offers for sale in her vending outlet. Financial assistance will help Tatyana increase her income, thus providing for her family needs and giving her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to diversify assorted clothing merchandise

loans.name: José Juan

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor José Juan C. le está haciendo falta la impermeabilización del techo ya que esta en muy malas condiciones, también los acabados del exterior de la casa. 
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar el material ya que el se encargaría de realizar la mejora, el se dedica a la construcción desde hace mas 10 años. Desea que su familia este en un buen lugar donde no les pueda pasar nada ya que tiene tres hijos pequeños y no quiere que se le enfermen por la humedad que hay en la casa. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de ingreso que tiene de sus trabajas en la construcción.
texts.en:
José Juan C.'s house's roof is still not waterpoof; it's in very poor condition. Also, the exterior finishes of the house's are also in poor state. He is asking for funds to buy materials and supplies and he, himself, will do the work; he has been a construction worker for over 10 years. He wants his family to be in a place where no harm will come to his three small children; he doesn't want them getting sick due to the dampness in the house. He plans to repay the loan with part of his income from construction jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To complete exterior finishings and waterproof the roof.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva.
Teofila es casada, tiene 54 años y 8 hijos, Teofila se dedica a la siembra de verduras y flores que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad, además alquila terrenos de donde cosecha tuna y cochinilla.
Teofila necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abono.
Los sueños de Teofila son mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Teofila, 54, is a member of the "Agua Viva" (Living Water) communal bank. She is married and has 8 children. She is a vegetable and flower farmer. She sells her products in the city's wholesale foodstuffs market. She leases farmland where she farms prickly pear and cochineal. Teofila needs a 1250 sol loan to buy manure. Her dreams are to improve her business and provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is a married mom of two children and a successful entrepreneur, too. She sells women's clothing merhandise in one of Novaya Kahovka malls called "Central." Svetlana has assorted inventory and always tries to introduce unique items to her selection of products to keep a stable position in atmosphere of market competition. 

Svetlana has been in this business for 10 years. Presently, she has 16,000 Grivnyas in working capital. Her net profit amounts to 7,000 Grivnyas. Svetlana is very energetic. She finds time for family, business and personal growth. This time she is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofia es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva.
Sofia es casada, tiene 42 años y 5 hijos, Sofia venD. leña a diferentes comercios, productos que elL. misma elabora , además Sofia los días sábados viaja a L. ferias D. donD. compra papa que luego venD. en el mercado mayorista.
Sofia necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. árboles para hacer leña.
Los sueños D. Sofia son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sofía, 42, is a member of the "Agua Viva" (Living Water) communal bank. She is married and has 5 children. She makes firewood that she sells to various businesses. In addition, on Saturdays she travels to farmers' markets to buy potatoes that she then resells in the wholesale market. Sofía needs a 3000 sol loan to buy trees from which to make firewood. Sofía's dreams are that her children complete their schooling and that her business grows.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy trees for making firewood.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married with a son and a daughter. She and her family live in Berdichev. Olga owns a vending facility and sells men's outerwear, like sweaters, pullovers, T-shirts, etc., in the local central marketplace. Her merchandise is affordable and good quality. Olga has 24,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. Her income is about 11,000 Grivnyas.  

Olga is very focused and determined. Lending assistance has helped the expansion of her business. Today Olga is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase summer merchandise. The loan will be beneficial for Olga's business by keeping it competitive and promoting further growth so that it will continue to provide necessary income for her and her family. Moreover, profits generated will give Olga a chance to further expand her business by adding new vending locations to the existing ones.

loans.use: to increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva.
Sonia es casada, tiene 31 años y 6 hijos, Sonia junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura de flores, papa, productos que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad.
Sonia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abono.
Sonia sueña con mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia, 31, is a member of the "Agua Viva" (Living Water) communal bank. She is married and has 6 children. She and her husband grow flowers and potatoes that they sell in the city's wholesale foodstuff market. Sonia needs a 1000 sol loan to buy manure. Her dream is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with a son. She lives and works in Novaya Kahovka, Kherson region. She sells sportswear in one of the local markets of her home town. She began this business 10 years-ago. Her business has grown to 30,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital and her income amounts to 8,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Svetlana has a reputation as a goal-oriented, hard-working, but pleasant merchant. She enjoys her work and is known to respond to economic opportunity. Svetlana is seeking a loan of 14,400 Grivnyas to increase her assortment of sports clothing for further retail sale at her kiosk at affordable prices.  This will attract customers and increase her profits.

loans.use: To purchase sportswear.

loans.name: Heydy

texts.es:
Heydy es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva.
Heydy es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos, Heydy junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de artículos de ferretería, productos que almacena en local alquilado y reparte por mayor a las diferentes tiendas. Además Heydy se dedica a la veta de libros.
Heydy necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de candados y hachas.
Heydy sueña con tener un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Heydy, 32, is a member of the "Agua Viva" (Living Water) communal bank. She lives with her life partner and their three children. She and her husband sell hardware; they store their wares in a rented locale and sell most of their merchandise to stores. Heydy also sells books. Heydy needs a 2000 sol loan to buy locks and axes. She dreams with owning a lot on which to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy locks and axes.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva.
Paulina es casada, tiene 38 años y 6 hijos, Paulina vende cereales y verduras en diferentes mercados de la ciudad, actividad que realiza todos los días de manera ambulatoria, en algunas oportunidades también vende leña.
Paulina necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Paulina sueña con construir una buena casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Paulina, 38, is a member of the "Agua Viva" (Living Water) communal bank. She is married and has 6 children. She sells cereals and vegetables in an itinerant manner in various city markets every day; sometimes she sells firewood. Paulina needs a 750 sol loan to buy cereals. Paulina dreams with building a good house and provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is unmarried. He is a small entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. Alexander sells lamps and batteries wholesale. He works in one of the largest city markets called "Angolenko". Some of the biggest attractions of his small venture are competitive prices and the variety of products in his storage depots. Alexander has been in this trade for 1.5 years. 

Currently, Alexander has about 50,000-60,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. He is requesting a loan of 9,000 Grivnyas to increase his working capital. One of his plans is to expand his business and reach out to clientele in the whole Zaporozhye region.

loans.use: To increase his working capital.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva.
Alejandrina es soltera, tiene 48 años y 4 hijos, Alejandrina se dedica a la venta de golosinas de manera ambulatoria en una avenida concurrida, actividad que realiza todos los días por las tardes, y por las mañanas trabaja en una casa cocinando. Además se dedica a la crianza de animales menores.
Alejandrina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cuy y golosinas.
Los sueños de Alejandrina son tener casa propia y brindar una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Alejandrina, 48, is a member of the "Agua Viva" (Living Water) communal bank. She is single and has 4 children. She sells snacks in an itinerant manner along a very crowded avenue every afternoon; during the mornings she works as a cook in a private home. In addition, she raises small farm animals. Alejandrina needs a 1000 sol loan to buy guinea pigs and snacks. Alejandrina's dreams are to have her own home and provide her son with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and snacks.

loans.name: Nazareo

texts.es:
El señor Nazareo D. es padre de familia y tiene dos hijos pequeños que desea lo mejor para ellos y la seguridad. 
Es por eso que solicita el préstamo ya que le está haciendo falta el portón al frente de la casa para que sus niños puedan jugar sin peligro. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe del su trabajo como empleado de una agencia aduanal en el área de tramitador.
Nazareo D. ya ha tenido dos créditos con FVP los cual pago puntualmente.
Desea que su familia tengo una mejor casa donde puedan vivir y estar seguros.
texts.en:
Nazareo D. is father to two small children; he wants the best for them and to keep them safe. He needs a loan, therefore, to install a front gate in the entrance to his property so that his children can play danger free. He plans to repay the loan with the salary he earns employed as an expediter at a customs agency. Nazareo D. has had two previous loans with PVP which he repaid punctually. He hopes his family will have a better house in which to live and be safe.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a front gate on his property.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva.
Julia es casada, tiene 53 años y 8 hijo, Julia se dedica a la agricultura de flores y verduras en sus terrenos y también compra de otros productores, la venta de sus productos lo realiza en el mercado de abastos. Además Julia junto a su esposo se dedican a la compra y venta de ganado.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado.
Julia sueña con mejorar su casa y su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia, 53, is a member of the "Agua Viva" (Living Water) communal bank. She's married and has 8 children. She farms flowers and vegetables on her own farmlands and also buys from other producers. She sells her products in the wholesale foodstuffs market. In additon, Julia and her husband buy and sell cattle. Julia needs a 1000 sol loan to buy cattle. Her dream is to make improvements to her home and business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Volodymir

texts.en:
Volodymir is married with a son and a daughter. He runs a small construction services business in his home town of Stryi. Volodymir offers high quality services quickly. Presently, construction is growing in Ukraine and this means high demand for the type of services Volodymir is offering. He has been working in this field for 12 years and he has gained a great deal of experience. 

Volodymir is seeking a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to increase his turnover capital and purchase additional construction supplies. He can be characterized as a determined and enterprising businessman who is always ready to invest maximum effort and energy into this venture. Volodymir is highly respected in his town as an entrepreneur of integrity. We believe he will repay the current loan without any delinquencies.

loans.use: To increase his turnover capital.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva.
Beatriz es casada, tiene 38 años y 4 hijos, Beatriz tiene un puesto en el mercado Grau en donde vende medicina natural, que ella misma prepara, sus productos los compra de la ciudad de Lima.
Beatriz necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicina natural.
Los sueños de Beatriz son tener casa propia y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 38, is a member of the "Agua Viva" (Living Water) communal bank. She's married and has 4 children. Beatriz has a stall in the Grau market where she sells natural remedies that she prepares herself; she buys her products in Lima. She needs a 1000 sol loan to buy natural medicines. Beatriz's dreams are to own her own home and to educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural remedies.

loans.name: Takku Liggeye Group

texts.fr:
Le Groupe de solidarité du nom de TAKKU LIGGEYE, qui signifie "se ceindre les reins et travailler" est créé le 22 octobre 2007 lors de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois de DIAMAGUENE dont il fait parti. Il est composé de 10 femmes toutes mariées à l'exception de Amy D. et Fatou D. qui sont veuves depuis moins d'une année. Elles sont toutes issues du même quartier qui porte le même nom que le Banc Villageois. Elles sont d'ages différents variants de 34 à 60 ans. Leurs activités sont variées mais le petit commerce est dominant, elle font la vente de produits halieutiques, de produits cosmétiques, d'effets vestimentaire et la coiffure. Et ce nouveau crédit leur permettra de renforcer le niveau d'investissement en s'approvisionnant en quantité suffisante en marchandises.

Quant à la présidente Sokhna D., apparemment la plus jeune du groupe est âgée de 34 ans, elle est divorcée et vit avec son enfant de 8 ans qui fréquente l'école depuis 2 ans. A cause de son dynamisme, de son assiduité et de son sérieux dans le travail le groupe a eu confiance en elle pour élire responsable dudit groupe de solidarité. 
Elle est coiffeuse de profession, elle a commencé à pratiquer son métier chez elle pour ensuite, au bout de 3 ans ouvrir un salon de coiffure ou elle travaille avec une équipe de deux autres personnes. Dans le salon de coiffure elle y vend également de des effets de toilette. Son objectif est de renforcer son niveau d'épargne, d'assurer la scolarisation de son enfant et de satisfaire ses besoins personnels. Par ailleurs, elle paye chaque mois 5000 francs CFA pour des cours de renforcement à son enfant?

Le groupe, en plus des remboursements réguliers des crédit qu'il reçoit, utilise une partie de leur revenu faire face aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group by the name of TAKKU LIGGEYE, which means "to take hold the reins to work" was established on October 22, 2007 at an inauguration of the Banc Villageois de DIAMAGUENE to which it belongs.  The group is composed of ten women, all married except for Amy D. and Fatou D. who have been widows for less than a year.  The women are all from the same district with the same name as the Banc Villageois.  Their ages range from 34 to 60. Their businesses vary, but small-scale commerce is dominant, involving seafood products, cosmetics, clothing and accessories, and hairdressing.  This new loan will enable them to strengthen the level of investment by stocking up on sufficient supplies of merchandise.  As for the president, Sokhna D., aged 34, who is apparently the youngest in the group, she is divorced and lives with her 8-year-old child who has been attending school for two years.  Because of her energy, constancy, and seriousness with work, the group is very confident in Sokhna, having elected her as the head of this solidarity group.  Sokhna is a hairdresser by profession and started working in this trade at home.  And then, after three years, she opened a hair salon, where she works with a team of two others.  In this salon, she also sells grooming and bath items.  Her goal is to bolster her savings, to ensure schooling for her child, and to support herself.  In addition, she pays 5,000 francs CFA each month for enrichment courses for her child. In addition to the regular loan payments received, the group uses part of the revenues to cope with day-to-day family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing the level of financing for their businesses

loans.name: Méry

texts.fr: Méry W. est une femme de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants en charge. elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 28 mars 2008 et a eu 3 expériences avec le crédit. Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son petit commerce en approvisionnant en bonne quantité en marchandises telles des chaussures, des bijoux, et des tissus teintés. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer au payement de la scolarité de ses enfants et à satisfaire ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Méry W. is a 48-year-old woman who is married and the mother of seven children to support.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois since March 28, 2008 and has had three experiences with loans.  Her new loan will enable her to bolster her small business by stocking up on a good quantity of merchandise, such as shoes, jewelry, and dyed fabrics.  Her revenues allow her to help pay for her children's schooling and to meet her personal needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving her level of self-financing, bolstering her small-scale commerce

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase beverages, food, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase flour and firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and farming tools

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 50 years old and is the single mother of six children aged between 16 and 32 years. Two of her children are attending school.

Elizabeth is a farmer from Western Kenya near Kitale town. She has been farming for twenty years, producing vegetables, tomatoes, milk and eggs which she sells to the local market. She relies solely on her income from farming to cater for her family's needs.

Elizabeth is one of the many active clients of Juhudi Kilimo and recently completed her fourth loan. She has requested this new loan of KES 50,000 to expand her poultry project and construct a dairy unit. The extra income from this loan will enable her to sustain her family's basic needs.

Elizabeth’s main challenge is the fluctuation in market prices and changes in climatic conditions that greatly affect her produce. In five years' time, she hopes to have expanded her poultry project and be producing more eggs. She also intends to acquire another dairy cow.

Elizabeth is grateful to Juhudi for empowering women financially.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project and construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Shabana Bahar Group

texts.en:
Sharifa is the daughter of H. A. and is the leader of Shabana Bahar Group. She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. She is 33 and is married.

There are thirteen members in Sharifa’s house and all of them benefit from the income of her husband who has a car-parts shop in the city of Kabul. She wants to take a loan for her husband; with this loan he wants to buy more car parts for his shop and he would like to expand his business.

So, Sharifa has requested a loan. Her husband would like to say that Kiva is an effective process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy more car parts for her husband's shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 52 years old and married with eight children aged from 12 to 32 years. Two of her children are currently attending school.

Mary is a farmer from Western Kenya near Kitale town. She has been farming for twenty-five years and has only one employee. Her main produce consists of maize, beans, avocados, passion fruit and sugarcane which she sells to the local market. She also sells dairy cows to the local market and earns income from a tailoring shop she owns in the area.

Mary is one of the many active clients in Juhudi Kilimo, having recently completed her fifth loan of KES 50,000. She has requested this new loan from Juhudi for KES 80,000 to purchase a tractor. This tractor will help her in her farming activities.

Mary’s biggest challenge in farming came when she started to practice dairy farming since she did not have the know-how to keep dairy animals. But now, everything seems okay. In future she would like to purchase a van for transporting milk.

Mary says her previous loans have helped her to educate her children and give them a better life. She says Juhudi Kilimo has helped raise her from poverty, since much of her assets has been acquired through it.

loans.use: To purchase a tractor

loans.name: Jawad Malek Zada Group

texts.en:
Jawad is the son of M. B. J. and is the leader of Jawad M. Zada Group. He is 20 years old, is single, and lives in 8th district, Kabul, Afghanistan.

Jawad has a general store and works hard to earn money for the support of his family’s requirements. He needs to buy more food, beverages and other things for his business because he has lots of problems in his life.

Jawad wants to take a loan and he is very glad that has the chance to progress in his life. He would like to thank all Kiva lenders a lot.

loans.use: To buy more food, beverages and other things for his store

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
24-year-old Benson is a farmer from Western Kenya near Kitale town. He is married and has two children aged 9 months and 3 years.

Benson has been farming for three years and sells his maize, bananas and vegetables to the local market. He also operates a mini-bakery in the area. His main challenge in farming is bad weather and poor milk prices.

Benson has requested this KES 31,200 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable him to meet his family’s needs.

In future, Benson would like to expand his farm from the current one acre to five acres in order to accommodate four quality dairy animals that he aspires to have.

Benson hopes that Juhudi will exist forever so that the rural people can continue to benefit.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 56 years old and is the married father of six children aged 14 to 31 years. Two of the children are still attending school.

Paul is a farmer from Eastern Kenya in Nkubu town. He has been farming for twenty-three years and has been able to employ six casual workers. His main produce is fine beans which he sells to Homegrown Horticulture Company in Kenya. He also earns income from mining, where he sells ballast (gravel) to the local market. His biggest challenge in farming is lack of a market for his produce and pests and diseases that attack his dairy animals.

Paul successfully cleared his first loan of KES 46,800 from Juhudi Kilimo which he used to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He has requested this new loan of KES 57,200 to purchase and insure another dairy cow. The income from this loan will improve the living standard of his family and educate his children, too.

In future, Paul intends to expand his farming activities by planting bananas.

Paul says loans from Juhudi Kilimo are unique; he has not seen any other micro-finance institutions offering loans for farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 47 years old and is married with five children aged between 19 and 28 years. Two of her children are currently attending school.

Mariam is a farmer from Kitale town in Western Kenya. She has been farming for twenty years and produces milk, maize, beans and vegetables that she sells to the local market. She is also a tailor and earns income from her tailoring services to the locals. Her biggest challenge in farming is the seasonal changes that have a negative impact on the business.

Mariam has requested this KES 30,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to start a poultry project. The extra income from this loan will enable her to meet her family's basic needs. Mariam hopes to have expanded her business in five years time and be in a position to produce more eggs and sell more chickens.

This being her first loan, Mariam is optimistic that she will get maximum benefits from it.

loans.use: To start a poultry project

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 45 years old, is married, and has seven children aged between 3 and 24 years. Five of her children are currently in school.

Tabitha is a farmer from Western Kenya near Kitale town. She has been farming for twenty years and has one employee. Her main produce consists of vegetables, milk, avocados and maize which she sells to the local market. She also earns income from the cereals that she sells to the locals. Her biggest challenge in this business is the stiff competition in the market and poultry diseases.

Tabitha recently completed her fourth loan from Juhudi Kilimo. She has requested this new loan of KES 80,000 to expand her poultry project. The extra income from this loan will enable her to pay school fees for her children and also meet her family's other needs. She hopes to expand her business by operating a store that will be supplying eggs to other shops in the local area.

Tabitha is grateful to Juhudi for empowering her economically.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
53-year-old Daniel is the married father of seven children aged between 20 and 34 years. Three of the children are currently attending school.

Daniel is a hardworking farmer from Kitale town in Western Kenya, where he has been practicing mixed farming for twenty-five years. His main produce consists of maize, tea and vegetables which he sells to the local market. He relies solely on the income from his farming activities to cater for his family's needs. His main challenges in this business are the fluctuations in market prices, diseases, and sometimes cattle-rustling in the area.

Daniel has requested this KES 51,600 loan through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He intends to use KES 10,000 to construct a cattle shed. This loan will enable his family to acquire another productive asset that will help boost their other sources of income. He hopes to purchase two more dairy cows in the future that will increase his milk production.

Daniel says that he has been taking loans from Juhudi that they have boosted his economic activities and have enabled his children to attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand her husband's oil shop business.

loans.name: Zebedee

texts.en:
Zebedee is 60 years old and is married with six children aged between 16 and 35 years. All of his children except one have completed school.

Zebedee is a farmer from Kitale town in Western Kenya where he has been farming for thirty years. His main produce consists of vegetables, eggs, chickens, maize and beans which he sells to the local market. He also operates a school academy to help the poor locals in the area. His main challenges in the farming business are lack of security for the chickens, poultry diseases and lack of management expertise.

Zebedee has requested this KES 50,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to expand his poultry project. This loan will enable him to increase his stock of chickens and earn him income that will enable him to meet his family's needs. He hopes that the prices of his poultry products will stabilize in future since this will be an ongoing income-generating activity for him.

Zebedee says that poultry farming is a challenging and delicate business but he hopes to beat the challenges and come up as a successful poultry farmer. He wants to make poultry farming a business and not a way of life.

loans.use: To expand his poultry project

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is 46 years old and is the married father of seven children aged from 4 to 13 years. Six of the children are currently attending school.

Eliud is a farmer from Kitale town in Western Kenya. He has been farming for ten years and has one employee. His main produce consists of maize, beans and potatoes which he sells to the local market. He solely depends on the income from farming to meet his family's needs. His biggest challenge in this business is poor weather patterns leading to low production.

Eliud has requested this KES 31,200 loan from Juhudi KIlimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable his family to access good education and good food and enable him to save for a rainy day.

In future, Eliud hopes to practice both poultry and dairy farming, thus aspiring to have a big poultry farm of up to 1,000 chickens and three quality dairy cows.

Eliud says the unique products of Juhudi Kilimo have enabled members to trust each other because of the tangible assets.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: William Arturo

texts.es:
William Bolívar S. a sus  32 años tiene una familia conformada por su esposa y 3 hijos en edades de 11 a 15 años, que ha sacado adelante mediante su trabajo en el sector  de  marroquinería; él tiene un negocio donde elabora  y comercializa, bolsos, correas, calzado y accesorios, usando materiales de cuero y sintéticos, en un local ubicado  en el barrio Techo, muy cerca a la Plaza de  las Américas, zona rosa del  suroccidente de la capital de Colombia.
Con un año de vinculación a  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, ha logrado mejorar su infraestructura locativa y con ello la exhibición de sus artículos de cuero y últimamente ha agregado ropa Hindú y calzado, con la cual logra unas hermosas combinaciones,  que hacen que mucha más gente se acerque a comprarle en conjunto vestidos, calzado, bolsos y accesorios, para proyectar una buena imagen al vestir. En la actualidad está solicitando su segundo financiamiento y necesita comprar cuero, sintéticos y ropa hindú para seguir fabricando productos bien combinados en colores y diseños adaptados a la moda.
Su sueño más adelante es tener una casa propia y un punto de venta elegante. Su desafío diario es incrementar las ventas, agregando valor y nuevos  productos, como las sandalias y la ropa hindú, que hace un año está comercializando porque se bajaron sus ventas, y con esta decisión logró dinamizarlas.
texts.en:
William Bolívar S., 32, has a family composed of his wife and three children, whose ages range from 11 to 15 years. He has supported his family through is work in leather goods. He has a business where he manufactures and sells purses, belts, shoes and accessories, made from leather and synthetic materials, located in the Techo neighborhood which is very close to the Plaza de las Américas in the Zona Rosa (trendy area) in the southwest part of Colombia’s capital. In the year that he has been associated with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo he has managed to improve the infrastructure of his locale leading to improved display of his merchandise; he added Hindu clothing and footwear to his inventory recently with which he creates beautiful complete outfits which cause many people to come by to buy sets made up of dress, shoes, purse and accessories in order to project a good image in their way of dressing. He is asking for his second loan because he needs to buy leather, synthetics and Hindu clothing in order to continue to manufacture products that are color-coordinated and designed fashionably. His dream for the long run is to have his own home and an elegant store. His daily challenge is to increase sales, adding value and new products such as sandals and Hindu clothing which he began to sell a year ago when sales dropped; this decision has brought about revitalized sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy leather, synthetics and Hindu clothing to continue producing products that are color-coordinated and designed according to current fashion.

loans.name: Ferney

texts.es:
Después de ser empleado de una vidriería, Ferney López O. acudiendo a su espíritu independiente,  empezó su gran sueño hace 4 años con un local en el barrio Alquería la fragua en la Ciudad de Bogotá: montó  en sociedad  un negocio dedicado a la  fabricación de  divisiones para baños, el cual se disolvió y 6 meses  después inició su gran reto en un nuevo local en el barrio Kennedy, donde montó  “Vidrios el Rey” , una  vidriería donde fabrica  divisiones para baños y marquetería en general. La disolución de la sociedad fue su más grande desafío, porque perdió mucho dinero y se descapitalizó,  pero siguió ofreciendo sus servicios y ha logrado salir adelante. 
Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará  materia prima como vidrio, aluminio para marquetería y también lo usará en la  reparación de  su maquinaria   Sand Blast,  que consiste en un sistema de lanzamiento de materiales abrasivos con aire a presión, los cuales producen cambios sobre  superficies rígidas, como las que usa Ferney como sus principales materias primas: vidrio, mármol,  acrílico, madera y acero. Con este sistema podrá  optimizar resultados, lograr mayor uniformidad, abatir costos en mano de obra, minimizar tiempos de trabajo, mayor anclaje y adherencia de recubrimientos y conseguir mayor pureza del material con un mínimo de esfuerzo.
